analyzed: yaḥ te vihāre vasati idha bhikkhu
translated: “The monk who lives in your dwelling,”

original: So jhānalābhī”ti ca dīpite ce;🔽Jānāti thullaccayamassa no ce;
analyzed: saḥ jhāna lābhī iti ca dīpite ce  jānāti thullaccayamassa no ce
translated: If he shines forth, “He has attained jhāna,”🔽There is a grave offense if he knows; if he does not know,

analyzed: jānāti tam dukkaṭam eva hoti
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: dhammam etam
translated: This is a non-existent quality in himself,

analyzed: atthi iti katvā
translated: But he speaks with conceit, “It exists.”

analyzed: vuttaḥ anāpatti nayaḥ pana evam
translated: The method of non-offense is stated thus:

analyzed: a vattu kāmassa tathā ādikassa
translated: For one who wants to accuse another in this way.

analyzed: pāpa iccha tā tassa asanta bhāvaḥ
translated: Bad desires, his non-existence,

analyzed: ārocanam ca iva manussakassa
translated: And informing a human being,

analyzed: naññā apadesena tat eva ñāṇam
translated: That very knowledge by means of the words “I know,”

original: Pañcettha aṅgāni vadanti dhīrā.🔽Paṭhame dutiye cante, pariyāyo na vijjati;
analyzed: pañca itthā aṅgāni vadanti dhīrā  paṭhame dutiye cante pariyāyaḥ na vijjati
translated: The wise say that there are five factors here.🔽In the first and the second, there is no permutation;

analyzed: dutiye na pana itare
translated: In the second and the third, there is an instruction, but not in the others.

analyzed: ādi meka samuṭṭhānam du aṅgam kāya cittato
translated: The first originates from one source, has two factors, and is bodily and mental;

original: Sesā ca tisamuṭṭhānā, tesamaṅgāni satta tu.🔽Sukhopekkhāyutaṃ ādi, tatiyaṃ dukkhavedanaṃ;
analyzed: sesā ca ti samuṭṭhānā tesamaṅgāni satta tu  sukha upekkhā yutam ādi tatiyam dukkha vedanaṃ
translated: The others originate from three sources, and they have seven factors.🔽The first is accompanied by the wish for happiness, the third has painful feeling;

analyzed: dutiyam ca catuttham ca tivedanam udīritam
translated: The second and the fourth are said to have three kinds of feelings.

analyzed: cittāni tatiyassa duve pana
translated: Eight kinds of consciousness for the first, and for the third two,

analyzed: dutiyassa catutthassa dasa cittāni labbhare
translated: For the second and the fourth, ten kinds of consciousness are possible.

analyzed: tasmā sa cittakam vuttam sabbam etam catubbidham
translated: Therefore all this is said to be with consciousness, fourfold,

analyzed: kriyā saññā vimokkhañca dīpitam
translated: Action, perception, deliverance, and what is reprehensible in the world are shown.

analyzed: vidhānam pana
translated: This is the rule that applies only to the offense,

analyzed: tasmai gahetabbam vibhāvinā

analyzed: an ajjhāvutthakam sabbam vaṭṭati
translated: It is allowable to have all of them brought, even if they have not been asked for.

analyzed: valli ādimhi sabbasmim garu bhaṇḍa ppahonake
translated: In the case of all creepers, etc., that are heavy goods,

original: Paresaṃ santakeyeva, hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ.🔽Paccayesu hi tīsveva, viññatti na ca vaṭṭati;
analyzed: paresam hoti āpatti dukkaṭam  paccayesu hi tīsu eva viññatti na ca vaṭṭati
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for others.🔽In the case of the three requisites,🔽asking is not allowed.

analyzed: tatiye parikathā ubhāsa nimittāni ca labbhare
translated: In the third case, there is the appearance of conversation and the signs.

analyzed: a desite ca vatthusmim pamāṇena adhikam kuṭim
translated: “In the case of a site that is not approved, a dwelling that is beyond the right size,

original: Karissāmī”ti cintetvā, araññaṃ gacchatopi ca.🔽Pharasuṃ vāpi vāsiṃ vā, nisentassāpi dukkaṭaṃ;
analyzed: karissāmi iti cintetvā araññam gacchataḥ api ca  pharasum vā api vāsim vā nisentassa api dukkaṭam
translated: if one thinks, ‘I’ll make it,’ and then goes to the wilderness,🔽or if one takes an axe or a knife, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Chindato dukkaṭaṃ rukkhaṃ, tassa pācittiyā saha.
analyzed: chindataḥ dukkaṭam rukkham tassa pācittiyā saha
translated: If one cuts a tree, there is an offense of wrong conduct and a serious offense together.

analyzed: evam pubba payogasmim kuṭi kāraka bhikkhuno
translated: In this way, in the case of the prior preparation,

analyzed: yathā apayogam āpattim vinayan ñū viniddise
translated: the one learned in the Monastic Law should determine the offense🔽of the monk who is building a dwelling according to the preparation.

original: Yā pana dvīhi piṇḍehi, niṭṭhānaṃ tu gamissati;
analyzed: yā pana dvīhi piṇḍehi niṭṭhānam tu gamissati
translated: But if it is completed with two lumps of clay,

original: Hoti thullaccayaṃ tesu, paṭhame dutiye garu.
analyzed: hoti thullaccayam tesu paṭhame dutiye
translated: there is a serious offense in the case of the first and second lumps.

original: Anāpatti sacaññassa, deti vippakataṃ kuṭiṃ;🔽Tathā bhūmiṃ samaṃ katvā, bhindatopi ca taṃ kuṭiṃ.🔽Guhaṃ leṇaṃ karontassa, tiṇapaṇṇacchadampi vā;
analyzed: anāpatti sa caññassa deti vippakatam kuṭim  tathā bhūmim samam katvā bhindataḥ api ca tam kuṭim  guham leṇam karontassa vā
translated: There is no offense if one gives a dwelling that has been built by another;🔽or if one makes the ground even and then digs up that dwelling;🔽or if one makes a cave or a shelter, or a roof-cover of grass and leaves;

analyzed: vāsāgāram aññassa atthāya vā tathā
translated: or if one makes a dwelling for the benefit of someone else.

original: Desāpetvāva bhikkhūhi, vatthuṃ pana ca bhikkhuno;🔽Kriyatova samuṭṭhāti, karoto appamāṇikaṃ.
analyzed: desāpetvā ava bhikkhūhi vatthum pana ca bhikkhuno  kriyataḥ iva samuṭṭhāti karotaḥ appamāṇikam
translated: Having not gotten permission, but the subject is a monk;🔽It originates from the action, and the one who does it is immeasurable.

original: Adesetvā karontassa, taṃ kriyākriyato siyā;🔽Samuṭṭhānādayo sesā, sañcarittasamā matā.
analyzed: a desetvā karontassa tam kriyā a kriyato siyā  samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ sesā sañcaritta samā matā
translated: If he does it without getting permission, it may be from the action or not;🔽The origins and so on are considered the same as in the case of the offense entailing suspension for a monk who has been fully admitted that is concerned with schism.

analyzed: kuṭikāra sikkhāpada kathā
translated: The training rule on huts

original: Adesetvā sace vatthuṃ, yo kareyya mahallakaṃ;
analyzed: a desetvā sace vatthum yaḥ kareyya mahallakam
translated: If he were to build a large hut without getting permission,

analyzed: vihāram atta vāsattham garukam tassa niddise
translated: a dwelling for himself, the offense for him is grave.

analyzed: pamāṇa atikkamena api doso natthi mahallake
translated: There is no offense even if it exceeds the right size;

analyzed: tasmā kriya samuṭṭhāna abhāvam samupalakkhaye
translated: Therefore, it should be recognized that it originates from the action.

analyzed: pamāṇa niyama abhāvāḥ eka saṅgha ādi sesa tā
translated: Because there is no fixed size, it is one offense entailing suspension;

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādikam sesam anantarasamam matam
translated: The origins and so on are considered the same as in the preceding case.

analyzed: mahallaka kathā
translated: The discussion of large dwellings

analyzed: pārājikāni vuttāni catuvīsati satthunā
translated: The one with twenty-four cases has stated the offenses entailing expulsion;

analyzed: bhikkhunaḥ anurūpāni tesu ekūnavīsati
translated: Among them, nineteen are appropriate for a monk.

analyzed: a mūlakena ca udeti hutvā cāvana cetano
translated: If he accuses without grounds, having the intention to make him leave the monastic life;

original: Suddhaṃ vā yadi vāsuddhaṃ, tesu aññatarena yo.
analyzed: suddham vā yadi vā a suddham tesu aññatarena yaḥ
translated: Whether pure or impure, whoever does it with any of them

analyzed: garukam tassa āpattim kata ukāsamhi niddise
translated: The offense for him is grave, I declare, when there is an opportunity to speak.

analyzed: tathā iva a kata ukāse dukkaṭa āpattiyā saha
translated: Likewise, if he accuses one who has not committed an offense entailing suspension, but one entailing confession,

analyzed: koṇṭhaḥ asi ca nigaṇṭhaḥ asi
translated: “You’re a cheat, you’re a cheat’s disciple,

analyzed: sāmaṇeraḥ asi tāpasaḥ
translated: you’re a novice monk, you’re an ascetic,

analyzed: gahaṭṭhaḥ asi tathā jeṭṭha  bbatikaḥ asi upāsakaḥ
translated: you’re a householder, you’re the eldest,🔽you’re a lay follower, you’re a trainee.”

analyzed: dussīlaḥ pāpa dhammo asi antopūti avassuto
translated: “You’re unvirtuous, you have bad qualities, you’re rotten inside, you’re corrupt,”

analyzed: iccā ivam pi vadantassa garukam tassa niddise
translated: then the offense for the one who speaks thus is grave.

analyzed: sammukhāḥ hattham uddāya codentaḥ api taṅkhaṇe
translated: If he accuses face-to-face, raising his finger,

original: Taṃ ce paro vijānāti, hoti āpatti bhikkhuno.
analyzed: tam ce paraḥ vijānāti hoti āpatti bhikkhuno
translated: and the other understands, there’s an offense for the monk.

analyzed: garukam sammukhe ṭhatvā codāpentassa kenacid
translated: If someone accuses him, saying, “You’re grave,” face-to-face,

analyzed: tassa vācāya vācāya codāpentassa niddise
translated: then the offense for the one who accuses is laid down for each statement.

original: Atha sopi “mayā diṭṭhaṃ, sutaṃ vā”ti ca bhāsati;
analyzed: atha saḥ api mayā diṭṭham sutam vāti ca bhāsati
translated: If the other says, “I’ve seen it, I’ve heard it,”

original: Tesaṃ dvinnampi saṅghādi-seso hoti na saṃsayo.
analyzed: tesam dvinnam pi saṅgha ādisesaḥ hoti na saṃsayaḥ
translated: then there’s a legal issue for both of them, and there’s no doubt.🔽But if he accuses by sending a messenger,

original: Dūtaṃ vā pana pesetvā, paṇṇaṃ vā pana sāsanaṃ;
analyzed: dūtam vā pana pesetvā paṇṇam vā pana sāsanam
translated: or by a written message,

analyzed: codāpentassa āpatti na hoti iti pakāsitā
translated: then the offense for the one who accuses is not laid down, so it’s said.

analyzed: tathā saṅgha ādi sesehi vutte cāvana saññinaḥ
translated: Likewise, if he accuses one who understands the confession,

analyzed: hoti pācittiya āpatti sesa āpattīhi dukkaṭam
translated: saying, “You’ve committed an offense entailing suspension,”🔽then there’s an offense entailing confession. If he accuses one who doesn’t understand the confession, saying, “You’ve committed an offense entailing confession,” then there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: akkosana adhippāyassa
translated: The one who intends to accuse, if there is no opportunity to do so,

analyzed: saha pācittiyenassa vadantassa ca dukkaṭam
translated: commits an offense entailing confession when he speaks, and a serious offense when he says the first word.

analyzed: asammukhā vadantassa āpattīhi pi sattahi
translated: When one accuses someone in his absence, there are seven kinds of offenses:

original: Tathā kammaṃ karontassa, hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: tathā kammam karontassa hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ
translated: when one performs a legal procedure, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽There is no offense for those who are not aiming at a weakness, and so on;

analyzed: na pañcaṅga saṃyutam
translated: the five factors are present:

original: Upasampannatā tasmiṃ, puggale suddhasaññitā.🔽Pārājikena codeti, yena tassa amūlatā;
analyzed: upasampanna tā tasmin puggale suddha saññi tā  pārājikena codeti yena tassa amūla tā
translated: the other person is fully ordained; one perceives the other person as fully ordained;🔽one accuses him of an offense entailing expulsion; the accusation is groundless;

analyzed: sammukhā codanā ca iva tassa cāvana saññino
translated: the accusation is face-to-face; one perceives the other person as fully ordained;

original: Taṅkhaṇe jānanañceva, pañcaṅgāni bhavanti hi;🔽Idaṃ tu tisamuṭṭhānaṃ, sacittaṃ dukkhavedanaṃ.
analyzed: pañcaṅgāni bhavanti hi  idam tu ti samuṭṭhānam sa cittam dukkha vedanaṃ
translated: one knows at that moment;🔽this originates in three ways; it is curable; it is painful.

analyzed: duṭṭha dosa kathā
translated: The discussion of accusing out of hatred is finished.

analyzed: lesa mattam upādāya bhikkhumantima vatthunā
translated: On the grounds of mere surmise, one who accuses a monk of a heavy offense,

analyzed: codeyya garuka āpatti sace cāvana cetanaḥ
translated: if he has the intention to defame him,

original: Codeti vā tathāsaññī, codāpeti parena vā;
analyzed: codeti vā tathā saññī codāpeti parena vā
translated: accuses him, or perceives him as such, or has him accused by another,

analyzed: anāpatti siyā sesaḥ anantarasamaḥ mataḥ
translated: there is no offense for the rest; it is considered to be the same as the preceding.

analyzed: dutiya duṭṭha dosa kathā
translated: The second discussion of accusing out of hatred is finished.

original: Samaggassa ca saṅghassa, bhedatthaṃ vāyameyya yo;
analyzed: samaggassa ca saṅghassa bheda ttham vā āyameyya yaḥ
translated: One who, for the purpose of schism, makes an effort to cause a schism in a united Sangha,

analyzed: bheda hetum gahetvā vā tiṭṭheyya paridīpayan
translated: Or, having taken the cause of schism, he would stand, revealing it.

original: So hi bhikkhūhi vattabbo, “bhedatthaṃ mā parakkama”;
analyzed: saḥ hi bhikkhūhi vattabbaḥ bheda ttham mā parakkama
translated: He should be told by the monks, “Don’t strive for the sake of schism”;

analyzed: iti saṅghassa mā tiṭṭha gahetvā bheda kāraṇam
translated: Thus, “Don’t stand, taking the cause of schism in the Saṅgha.”

original: Vuccamāno hi teheva, nissajjeyya na ceva yaṃ;
analyzed: vuccamānaḥ hi tehā iva nissajjeyya na ca iva yam
translated: If, being spoken to by them, he would not give it up,

analyzed: tam accajam garukam phuse
translated: he should be pressed up to the third time. He would incur a heavy offense.🔽If a monk, seeing, hearing, or knowing,

analyzed: parakkamantam saṅghassa bhikkhum bhedāya bhikkhunaḥ
translated: that a monk is striving for the sake of schism in the Saṅgha,

original: Disvā sutvā hi ñatvā vā, avadantassa dukkaṭaṃ.🔽Gantvā ca pana vattabbo, addhayojanatādikaṃ;
analyzed: disvā sutvā hi ñatvā vā a vadantassa dukkaṭaṃ  gantvā ca pana vattabbaḥ addha yojana tā ādikam
translated: and if he does not tell him, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽And having gone, he should tell him, even if it is a half-league away.

original: Dūrampi pana gantabbaṃ, sace sakkoti tāvade.
analyzed: dūram pi pana gantabbam sace sakkoti tāvade
translated: Even if it is far, he should go, if he is able to do so.

analyzed: tikkhattum pana vuttassa a pariccajataḥ api tam
translated: But if, after being told three times, he does not give it up,

original: Dūtaṃ vā pana paṇṇaṃ vā, pesatopi ca dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: dūtam vā pana paṇṇam vā pesataḥ pi ca dukkaṭam
translated: then there is an offense of wrong conduct for sending a messenger or a note.

analyzed: ñattiyā pariyosāne dukkaṭam paridīpitam
translated: At the end of the motion, an offense of wrong conduct is declared;

original: Kammavācāhi ca dvīhi, hoti thullaccayaṃ dvayaṃ.
analyzed: ca dvīhi hoti thullaccayam dvayam
translated: and with the two announcements of the transaction, there are two serious offenses.🔽But when the first resolution has been reached,

analyzed: yyakāre pana sampatte garukeya iva tiṭṭhati
translated: it remains as a heavy offense.

analyzed: passambhanti hi tissaḥ api bhikkhuno dukkaṭa ādayaḥ
translated: For the monk, too, the three kinds of offenses🔽From the offense of wrong conduct down

analyzed: a kate pana kammasmim a pariccajato pi ca
translated: Are all allayed. But in the case of an unfinished offense,🔽And also in the case of one who does not relinquish,

analyzed: tassa saṅgha ādisesena anāpatti pakāsitā
translated: It is declared that there is no offense entailing suspension.

original: Ñattito pana pubbe vā, pacchā vā taṅkhaṇepi vā;🔽Asampatte yya-kārasmiṃ, paṭinissajjatopi ca.
analyzed: ñattitaḥ pana pubbe vā pacchā vā vā  a sampatte yyakārasmin paṭinissajjataḥ pi ca
translated: Before the motion, after the motion, or at the very moment of the motion,🔽Or when the “thus” has not yet been reached,🔽And also in the case of one who relinquishes,🔽Or in the case of one who is being reminded,

analyzed: paṭinissajjataḥ vā api tam vā samanubhāsataḥ
translated: Or in the case of one who is insane, etc.,

analyzed: tathā iva ummattaka ādīnam anāpatti pakāsitā
translated: It is declared that there is no offense.🔽If fish or meat has been prepared

analyzed: yat hi bhikkhum an uddissa macchamaṃsam katam bhave
translated: With reference to a monk,🔽And if he has no doubt about it,

original: Yasmiñca nibbematiko, taṃ sabbaṃ tassa vaṭṭati.
analyzed: yasmin ca nibbematikaḥ tam sabbam tassa vaṭṭati
translated: Then all of it is allowable for him.🔽But if he knows that it has been prepared with reference to him,

analyzed: samuddissa katam ñatvā bhuñjantassa iva dukkaṭam
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for eating it.🔽So too, if he eats meat that is not allowable,

analyzed: tathā akappiyam maṃsam a jānitvā api khādataḥ
translated: Even if he does not know about it.

analyzed: ahi kukkura dīpinam  sīha byaggha taracchānam maṃsam hoti a kappiyam
translated: The meat of elephants, horses, dogs, and snakes,🔽Lions, tigers, and panthers is not allowable.

analyzed: thullaccayam manussānam maṃse sesesu dukkaṭam
translated: In the case of human meat, it is a serious offense; in the case of the rest, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: sa cittakam samuddissa katam sesam acittakam
translated: The preparation is intentional; the preparation and the eating are intentional.

original: Pucchitvāyeva maṃsānaṃ, bhikkhūnaṃ gahaṇaṃ pana;🔽Etaṃ vattanti vattaṭṭhā, vadanti vinayaññuno.
analyzed: pucchitvāya iva maṃsānam bhikkhūnam gahaṇam pana  etam vattanti vattaṭṭhāḥ vadanti vinayaññunaḥ
translated: Asking, and then the monks’ taking of the meat:🔽This is what they say is the basis for the practice, say those who know the Monastic Law.

analyzed: idam eka samuṭṭhānam vuttam samanubhāsanam
translated: This was spoken about cross-questioning:

analyzed: kāya kammam vacī kammam akriyam dukkha vedanam
translated: It originates in body and speech, it is non-action, and it has painful feeling.

analyzed: saṅgha bheda kathā
translated: The discussion of schism in the Sangha.

analyzed: dutiye saṅgha bhedasmiṃ vattabbam natthi kiñcipi
translated: In the second schism in the Sangha, there is nothing to be said;

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ pi sa paṭhamena samā matā
translated: Its origins and so on are regarded as the same as those of the first.

analyzed: dutiya saṅgha bheda kathā
translated: The discussion of the second schism in the Sangha.

analyzed: uddesa pariyāpanne bhikkhu dubbaca jātiko
translated: In the recitation, a monk who is difficult to correct

analyzed: a vacanīya mattānam karoti garukam siyā
translated: declares himself incapable of being corrected, and that may be serious.

analyzed: pana itasmin saṅgha bhedaka vaṇṇane
translated: But in this description of the schism in the Sangha,

analyzed: sabbaḥ vutta nayena iva veditabbaḥ vinicchayaḥ
translated: the whole of the decision should be understood according to the method stated in the case of the difficult person.

analyzed: dubbaca kathā  yaḥ kula dūsakaḥ
translated: The discussion of the difficult person.🔽One who, out of desire and so on, corrupts families

original: Kamme kariyamāne taṃ, accajaṃ garukaṃ phuse.
analyzed: kamme kariyamāne tam accajam garukam phuse
translated: and is touched by a serious offense when the legal procedure is being done.

original: Cuṇṇaṃ paṇṇaṃ phalaṃ pupphaṃ, veḷuṃ kaṭṭhañca mattikaṃ;
analyzed: cuṇṇam paṇṇam phalam puppham veḷum kaṭṭham ca mattikam
translated: Flour, leaves, fruit, flowers, bamboo, wood, and clay:

analyzed: kula saṅgahaṇa tthāya attanaḥ vā parassa vā
translated: for the sake of supporting a family, either one’s own or another’s.

original: Santakaṃ dadato hoti, kuladūsanadukkaṭaṃ;🔽Bhaṇḍagghena ca kātabbo, theyyā saṅghaññasantake.
analyzed: santakam dadataḥ hoti kula dūsana dukkaṭam  bhaṇḍagghena ca kātabbaḥ theyyā saṅghañña santake
translated: When giving what belongs to the Sangha, there is a serious offense for defaming the family.🔽And one should be made to pay the price of the goods, if he steals what belongs to the Sangha.

analyzed: saṅghikam garu bhaṇḍam vā senāsana niyāmitam
translated: If he gives away heavy goods belonging to the Sangha, or what is reserved for the dwellings,

analyzed: thullaccayam phuse
translated: then, because of his being a thief, he comes to have a serious offense.

analyzed: haritvā vā harāpetvā pakkositvā āgatassa vā
translated: If he takes it himself or has it taken, or if he has it brought to one who has come,

analyzed: kula saṅgahaṇa atthāya puppham dentassa dukkaṭaṃ
translated: then there is an offense of wrong conduct for giving flowers for the sake of winning over a family.

original: Haritvā vā harāpetvā, pitūnaṃ pana vaṭṭati;🔽Dātuṃ pupphaṃ panaññassa, āgatasseva ñātino.
analyzed: haritvā vā harā petvā pitūnam pana vaṭṭati  dātum puppham pana aññassa āgatassa iva ñātinaḥ
translated: If he takes it himself or has it taken, it is allowable for his parents,🔽but he may give flowers to a relative who has come, to no one else.

original: Tañca kho vatthupūjatthaṃ, dātabbaṃ na panaññathā;
analyzed: tat ca kho vatthu pūja attham dātabbam na pana aññathā
translated: And that is only for the purpose of worshiping the shrine, not for any other purpose.

original: Sivādipūjanatthaṃ vā, maṇḍanatthaṃ na vaṭṭati.🔽Phalādīsupi sesesu, bhikkhunā vinayaññunā;
analyzed: siva ādi pūjana attham vā maṇḍana attham na vaṭṭati  phala ādīsu pi sesesu bhikkhunā
translated: It is not allowable for the purpose of worshiping Śiva, etc., or for the purpose of decoration.🔽In the case of the remaining fruits, etc.,

analyzed: pupphe vutta nayena iva veditabbaḥ vinicchayaḥ
translated: the adjudicator of the Monastic Law should understand the legal procedure in the same way as for flowers.

analyzed: puppha ādi bhājane koci āgacchati sace pana
translated: If someone comes to the distribution of flowers, etc.,

analyzed: sammatena assa dātabbam ñāpetvā itarena tu
translated: it should be given to the one who is agreed upon, but only after informing the other.

analyzed: upaḍḍha bhāgam dātabbam iti vuttam kurundiyam
translated: In the Kūṭadanta Sutta it is said that half should be given.

original: “Thokaṃ thoka”nti niddiṭṭhaṃ, mahāpaccariyaṃ pana.🔽Gilānānaṃ manussānaṃ, dātabbaṃ tu sakaṃ phalaṃ;
analyzed: thokam thokam ti niddiṭṭham mahā paccariyam pana  gilānānam manussānam dātabbam tu sakam phalam
translated: “A little at a time”: this is the instruction. But in the Great Analysis,🔽“The fruit of one’s own tree should be given to sick people.

analyzed: paribbaya vihīnassa sampatti ssariyassa api
translated: It’s allowable for one who has no almsfood or who is on his way to a formal meeting of the community.”

original: Saṅghārāme yathā yatra, saṅghena katikā katā;🔽Phalarukkhaparicchedaṃ, katvā tatrāgatassapi.🔽Phalaṃ yathāparicchedaṃ, dadato pana vaṭṭati;
analyzed: saṅgha ārāme yathā yatra saṅghena katikā katā  phala rukkha paricchedam katvā tatra āgataḥ sa api  phalam yathā paricchedam dadataḥ pana vaṭṭati
translated: “In a monastery, wherever the Sangha has made a rule,”🔽“Having defined the area of the fruit tree, it’s allowable for one who has come there🔽to give the fruit according to the definition.”

analyzed: dassetabbā api vā rukkhāḥ itas gaṇha phalanti ca
translated: “Trees should be pointed out. Take the fruit from here.”

analyzed: sayam khaṇitvā pathavim mālā gaccha ādi ropane
translated: “Having dug the ground oneself, in planting a creeper or a tree,”

analyzed: hoti pācittiyenassa dukkaṭam kula dūsane
translated: “There’s an offense entailing confession. There’s an offense of wrong conduct for corrupting families.”

analyzed: akappiyena vākyena tathā ca
translated: “With an improper statement, and in planting in the same way,”

analyzed: sabbattha dukkaṭam vuttam bhikkhuno kula dūsane
translated: “Everywhere, it’s said, there’s an offense of wrong conduct for a monk who corrupts families.”

analyzed: ropane dukkaṭaṃya iva hoti kappiya bhūmiyam
translated: “In planting on a suitable site, there’s just an offense of wrong conduct,”

original: Tathā ropāpane vuttaṃ, ubhayattha ca bhikkhuno.
analyzed: tathā ropa āpane vuttam ubhayattha ca bhikkhuno
translated: “And in planting in the same way, it’s said, there’s an offense for a monk in both cases.”

original: Sakiṃ āṇattiyā tassa, bahūnaṃ ropane pana;
analyzed: sakim āṇattiyā tassa bahūnam ropane pana
translated: “But if he gives a single instruction for planting many,”

original: Sadukkaṭā tu pācitti, suddhaṃ vā dukkaṭaṃ siyā.
analyzed: sa dukkaṭā tu pācitti suddham vā dukkaṭam siyā
translated: “There are many offenses of wrong conduct and one offense entailing confession, or it’s just an offense of wrong conduct.”

analyzed: kappiyena iva vākyena ubhayattha ca bhūmiyā
translated: With the right words, and on both kinds of land,

original: Ropane paribhogatthaṃ, na doso koci vijjati.
analyzed: ropane paribhoga attham na doso koci vijjati
translated: When planting for the sake of using, there is no offense at all.

original: Kappiyabhūmi ce hoti, sayaṃ ropetumeva ca;
analyzed: ce hoti sayam ropetum eva ca
translated: If the land is suitable, and he plants it himself,

analyzed: vaṭṭati iti ca niddiṭṭham mahā paccariyam pana
translated: It is allowable, as stated in the Great Analysis.

analyzed: ārāma ādīnam atthāya sayam saṃropitassa vā
translated: For the sake of a monastery, etc., or if he has planted it himself,

original: Vaṭṭateva ca bhikkhūnaṃ, taṃ phalaṃ paribhuñjituṃ.
analyzed: vaṭṭatā iva ca bhikkhūnam tam phalam paribhuñjitum
translated: It is allowable for monks to use the fruit.

original: Siñcane pana sabbattha, sayaṃ siñcāpanepi ca;
analyzed: siñcane pana sabbattha sayam ca
translated: But when watering, everywhere, and also when he waters himself,

analyzed: a kappiya udakena iva hoti pācitti bhikkhunaḥ
translated: With unsuitable water, there is an offense entailing confession for a monk.

analyzed: kula saṅgahaṇa attham ca paribhoga attham eva vā
translated: For the purpose of supporting families, or for the sake of using,

analyzed: saddhim pācittiyenassa siñcataḥ hoti dukkaṭam
translated: When watering, there is wrong conduct along with the offense entailing confession.

analyzed: tesam yeva pana atthāya dvinnam kappiya vārinā
translated: But for the sake of those very two, with suitable water,

original: Siñcane dukkaṭaṃ vuttaṃ, tathā siñcāpanepi ca.
analyzed: siñcane dukkaṭam vuttam tathā siñcāpane pi ca
translated: When watering, wrong conduct is declared, and also when having it watered.

analyzed: kula saṅgahaṇa atthāya pupphānaṃ ocināpane
translated: For the purpose of supporting families, when picking flowers,

analyzed: saya mocinane ca api sa pācittiya dukkaṭam
translated: And also when picking them himself, there is an offense entailing confession and wrong conduct.

analyzed: pupphānam gaṇanāyassa puppha mocinato pana
translated: When counting the flowers, and when picking the flowers,

original: Hoti pācittiyāpatti, kulatthaṃ ce sadukkaṭā.🔽Ganthimaṃ gopphimaṃ nāma, vedhimaṃ veṭhimampi ca;
analyzed: hoti pācittiya āpatti kulattham ce sa dukkaṭā  ganthimam gopphimam nāma vedhimam veṭhimam pi ca
translated: There is an offense entailing confession for a flower, and for a bean there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Pūrimaṃ vāyimaṃ ceti, chabbidho pupphasaṅgaho.🔽Tattha daṇḍena daṇḍaṃ vā, vaṇṭenapi ca vaṇṭakaṃ;
analyzed: pūrimam vāyimam ca iti chabbidhaḥ puppha saṅgaho  daṇḍena daṇḍam vā ca vaṇṭakam
translated: A flower garland is of six kinds: knotted, strung on a thread, pierced, threaded, woven, and braided.🔽There is a flower garland made by tying a stalk to a stalk,

original: Ganthitvā karaṇaṃ sabbaṃ, “ganthima”nti pavuccati.🔽Gopphimaṃ nāma gopphetvā, suttādīhi karīyati;🔽Ekatovaṇṭikā mālā, ubhatovaṇṭikā ca taṃ.
analyzed: ganthitvā karaṇam sabbam ganthimanti pavuccati  gopphimam nāma gopphetvā sutta ādīhi  ekatas vaṇṭikā mālā ubhatas vaṇṭikā ca tam
translated: or a stalk to a flower, or a flower to a flower. All of these are called “knotted”.🔽A flower garland is of two kinds: strung on a thread, and strung on a stalk.🔽A flower garland is of two kinds: pierced, and threaded.

original: Vedhimaṃ nāma vijjhitvā, bundesu makulādikaṃ;🔽Āvutā sūciādīhi, mālāvikati vuccati.🔽Veṭhimaṃ nāma veṭhetvā, kataṃ mālāguṇehi vā;🔽Vākādīhi ca baddhaṃ vā, “veṭhima”nti pavuccati.
analyzed: nāma vijjhitvā bundesu makula ādikam  sūci ādīhi vuccati  veṭhimam nāma veṭhetvā katam mālāguṇehi vā  vāka ādīhi ca baddham vā veṭhimanti pavuccati
translated: A flower garland is of two kinds: woven, and braided.🔽A flower garland is of two kinds: woven, and braided.🔽A flower garland is of two kinds: woven, and braided.

original: Pūrimaṃ pana daṭṭhabbaṃ, pupphamālāhi pūraṇe;🔽Bodhiṃ pupphapaṭādīnaṃ, parikkhepesu labbhati.🔽Vāyimaṃ nāma daṭṭhabbaṃ, puppharūpapaṭādisu;
analyzed: pūrimam pana daṭṭhabbam puppha mālāhi pūraṇe  bodhim puppha paṭa ādīnam parikkhepesu labbhati  vāyimam nāma daṭṭhabbam puppha rūpa paṭa ādisu
translated: A flower garland is of two kinds: woven, and braided.🔽A flower garland is of two kinds: woven, and braided.🔽A flower garland is of two kinds: woven, and braided.

analyzed: puppha mālā guṇeha iva vāyitvā karaṇe pana
translated: A flower garland is of two kinds: woven, and braided.

original: Sabbametaṃ sayaṃ kātuṃ, kārāpetuṃ parehi vā;
analyzed: sabbam etam sayam kātum kārāpetum parehi vā
translated: All this, whether one does it oneself or has it done by others,

analyzed: bhikkhūnam bhikkhunīnam ca buddhassa api na vaṭṭati
translated: Is not allowed for monks and nuns, and also for the Buddha.

analyzed: tathā kalambakam kātum aḍḍhacandakam eva vā
translated: Likewise, to make a garland of kalambaka flowers, or a half-moon garland,

original: Aññehi pūritaṃ puppha-paṭaṃ vā vāyitumpi ca.
analyzed: aññehi pūritam puppha paṭam vā vāyitum pi ca
translated: Or to make a flower-cloth filled with other flowers, or a garland of air.

analyzed: piṭṭhakāca mayam dāmam geṇḍu puppha mayam api ca
translated: A necklace of glass beads, and also a garland of geṇḍu flowers,

original: Kharapattamayaṃ mālaṃ, sabbaṃ kātuṃ na vaṭṭati.
analyzed: khara patta mayam mālam sabbam kātum na vaṭṭati
translated: And a garland of khaṇḍa flowers, all this is not allowed to make.

analyzed: kaṇikāra ādi pupphāni vitāne baddha kaṇṭake
translated: If one pierces kaṇikāra flowers, etc., on a string for a canopy,

analyzed: hīra ādīhi paṭāka attham vijjhantassa api dukkaṭam
translated: Or if one pierces a cloth with needles, etc., it is a wrong doing.

analyzed: kaṇṭaka ādīhi bhikkhussa eka puppham pi vijjhitum
translated: If one pierces even a single flower on a thorn, etc., for a monk,

original: Pupphesuyeva vā pupphaṃ, pavesetuṃ na vaṭṭati.
analyzed: vā puppham pavesetum na vaṭṭati
translated: Or if one puts a flower on a flower, it is not allowed.

analyzed: antare
translated: If one puts flowers inside aśoka flowers, etc., on a thread of Dhamma,

original: Pavesentassa pupphāni, na doso koci vijjati.
analyzed: pavesentassa pupphāni na doso koci vijjati
translated: There is no fault at all in putting in flowers.

analyzed: ṭhapitesu pavesetvā kadali chatta bhittisu
translated: If one puts in flowers after having put them on kadalī leaves, on walls,

analyzed: kaṇṭakesu pi pupphāni vijjhantassa api dukkaṭam
translated: And also on thorns, it is a wrong doing in piercing the flowers.

analyzed: kappiyam pana vattabbam vacanam vatthu pūjane
translated: But it is allowed to say, “Speak,” the words of praise of the cloth,

analyzed: nimitta ubhāsa pariyāḥ vaṭṭanti iti pakāsitā
translated: The light of the sign, the round, Is declared.

analyzed: na kevalam akattabbam kula dūsanam eva ca
translated: Not only what should not be done, But also the defilement of the family,

original: Atha kho vejjakammādi, na kattabbaṃ kudācanaṃ.
analyzed: atha kho vejja kamma ādi na kattabbam kudācanam
translated: Then the work of a doctor, etc., Should never be done.

analyzed: kātabbam pana bhesajjam pañcannam sahadhamminam
translated: But medicine should be given To the five who are of the same religion,

analyzed: katvā api akata viññattim kā kathā dhane
translated: Even though they have not asked, What to say of one’s own wealth?

analyzed: tathā mātā pitūnam pi tad upaṭṭhāka jantunaḥ  ca iva
translated: In the same way to one’s mother and father, To the person who attends on them,🔽To one’s own son, and to the one who does services,

original: Jeṭṭhabhātā kaniṭṭho ca, tathā bhaginiyo duve;
analyzed: jeṭṭhabhātā ca tathā bhaginiyo duve
translated: To the elder brother and the younger brother, And in the same way to the two sisters,

analyzed: cūḷa mātā cūḍa pitā mahāmātā mahā pitā
translated: To the younger mother and the younger father, To the elder mother and the elder father,

original: Pitucchā mātulo cāti, dasime ñātayo matā;
analyzed: pitucchāḥ mātulo ca ati dasime ñātayaḥ matā
translated: To the mother’s brother and the father’s brother— These ten relatives are dead;

analyzed: imesam pi dasannam ca kātum vaṭṭati bhikkhuno
translated: It is proper for a monk to do this For these ten.

original: Sace bhesajjametesaṃ, nappahoti na hoti vā;
analyzed: sace bhesajjam etesam nappahoti na hoti vā
translated: If he cannot get medicine For these, or if he has none,

original: Yācantipi ca taṃ bhikkhuṃ, dātabbaṃ tāvakālikaṃ.
analyzed: yācanti pi ca tam bhikkhum dātabbam tāvakālikam
translated: And if they ask the monk, It should be given on loan.

original: Sace te na ca yācanti, dātabbaṃ tāvakālikaṃ;
analyzed: sace te na ca yācanti dātabbam tāvakālikam
translated: If they do not ask, It should be given on loan,

original: Ābhogaṃ pana katvā vā, “dassanti puna me ime”.
analyzed: ābhogam pana katvā vā dassanti puna me ime
translated: But having made a promise, Thinking, “They will give it back to me.”

original: Etesaṃ tu kulā yāva, sattamā kuladūsanaṃ;
analyzed: etesam tu kulā sattamā
translated: But in the case of these families, even up to the seventh generation, the defiling of the family,

analyzed: bhesajja karaṇa āpatti viññatti vā na rūhati
translated: The offense for making medicine, or the request does not hold.

analyzed: vā sace
translated: If it is the wife of a brother, or if it is the husband of a sister,

original: Sace te ñātakā honti, kātuṃ tesampi vaṭṭati.
analyzed: sace te ñātakāḥ honti kātum tesam pi vaṭṭati
translated: If they are your relatives, it is allowable for them to do it.

original: Aññātakā sace honti, bhātuno anujāya vā;
analyzed: aññātakā sace honti bhātunaḥ anujāya vā
translated: If they are not relatives, of a brother or a sister’s child,

analyzed: tumhākam jaggana ṭṭhāne detha iti ca vade budho
translated: The wise one should say, “In the place of looking after you, give it to them.”

original: Atha tesampi puttānaṃ, katvā dātabbameva vā;
analyzed: atha tesam pi puttānam katvā dātabbam eva vā
translated: Then, if it is their children, it should be given after making it,

analyzed: mātā pitūnam tumhākam detha iti vinayaññunā
translated: Saying, “Give it to your mother and father,” by one who knows the Monastic Law.

original: Aññopi yo koci panissaro vā;🔽Coropi vā yuddhaparājito vā;
analyzed: aññaḥ pi yaḥ koci panissaraḥ vā  coraḥ upi vā yuddha parājitaḥ vā
translated: But also anyone else who is a master,🔽Or a thief defeated in battle,

analyzed: āgantukaḥ khīṇa paribbayaḥ vā
translated: Or a visitor who is worn out by wandering,

analyzed: a kallakaḥ ñāti jana ujjhitaḥ vā
translated: Or one who is not related, but is sent by relatives.

analyzed: etesam pana sabbesam a paccāsīsa tā satā
translated: But in the case of all of these,

analyzed: kātabbaḥ paṭisanthāraḥ bhikkhunā sādhunā adhunā
translated: The proper reception should be done by a monk who is good and proper, up to a distance of 15 kilometers.

analyzed: paritta udaka suttāni vutte detha ati kenaci
translated: If it is said by anyone, “Give after reciting the Paritto water suttas,”

original: Jalaṃ hatthena cāletvā, madditvā pana suttakaṃ.
analyzed: jalam hatthena cāletvā madditvā pana suttakam
translated: After moving the water with the hand, and after kneading the thread,

original: Dātabbaṃ bhikkhunā katvā, tesameva ca santakaṃ;
analyzed: dātabbam bhikkhunā katvā tesam eva ca santakam
translated: The monk should give it after making it, and it is their property.

original: Attano udakaṃ tesaṃ, suttaṃ vā deti dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: attanaḥ udakam tesam suttam vā deti dukkaṭam
translated: If he gives them his own water, Or a thread, it’s a wrong-doing.

analyzed: anāmaṭṭhaḥ pi dātabbaḥ piṇḍapātaḥ vijānatā
translated: One who knows should give alms food To those who haven’t received any,

original: Dvinnaṃ mātāpitūnampi, tadupaṭṭhāyakassa ca.🔽Issarassāpi dātabbo, coradāmarikassa ca;🔽Bhaṇḍukassattano ceva, veyyāvaccakarassapi.
analyzed: dvinnam mātā pitūnam pi tad upaṭṭhāyakassa ca  issarassa api dātabbo cora dāmarikassa ca  ca iva
translated: To his own mother and father, And to those who are looking after them.🔽It’s allowable to give to a master, To a thief, to a jailer,🔽To a tax collector, and to one who is doing work for him.

analyzed: dātum paṇḍu palāsassa thālake pi ca vaṭṭati
translated: It’s allowable to give to one who is sick, Even in a bowl, to one who is pale.

original: Ṭhapetvā taṃ panaññassa, pitunopi na vaṭṭati.
analyzed: ṭhapetvā tam panaññassa pituno pi na vaṭṭati
translated: But apart from that, it’s not allowable To give to anyone, not even to one’s own father.

analyzed: gihīnam pana dūteyyam ca
translated: But it’s allowable to take a message For householders, and to go on foot as a messenger,

original: Satthunā dukkaṭaṃ vuttaṃ, karontassa pade pade.🔽Bhaṇḍumātāpitūnampi, veyyāvaccakarassa ca;
analyzed: satthunā dukkaṭam vuttam karontassa pade pade  ca
translated: If one is going in the same direction. It’s said that for the one who does it, It’s a wrong-doing for every step.🔽It’s allowable to take a message For one’s own mother and father, And for one who is doing work for him, And for a fellow monastic.

analyzed: sāsanam sahadhammīnam haritum pana vaṭṭati
translated: It’s allowable to take a message For one who is sick, and for one who is pale, And for one who is in a monastery, And for one who is on a journey.

analyzed: kula dūsana kammena laddham aṭṭhavidhena pi
translated: But what has been obtained by means of The eight kinds of impure almsfood,

original: Pañcannaṃ sahadhammīnaṃ, na ca vaṭṭati bhuñjituṃ.
analyzed: pañca annam sahadhammīnam na ca vaṭṭati bhuñjitum
translated: It’s not allowable for the five kinds of fellow monastics To eat it.

analyzed: ajjhohāresu sabbattha dukkaṭam paridīpitam
translated: In the case of those who are receiving, A wrong-doing is declared in every case.

analyzed: paribhoga vasena iva ayam nayaḥ
translated: The same method applies to the rest, According to the way they are used.

analyzed: katvā rūpi yavohāram ca
translated: Having done a silver transaction, and by telling a lie;

analyzed: uppanna paccayā sabbe samānā ati pakāsitā
translated: All of these, when the requisite is arisen, are announced as equal.

analyzed: viññatti nuppadānam ca vejja kamma manesanam  pāribhaṭukatam muggasūpatam vatthuvijjakam
translated: The request, and the undertaking, and the doctor, and the search;🔽The service of a prostitute, the mung-bean, the rice, the palmistry;

analyzed: jaṅgha pesaniyam dūta kammam ca kula dūsanam
translated: The sending of a message, the mission, and the defiling of a family;

analyzed: abhūta ārocanam buddha paṭikuṭṭham vivajjaye
translated: The telling of a lie, and the Buddha, should be avoided.

analyzed: na dos ummattaka ādīnam paṭinissajjataḥ api tam
translated: Not for those who are insane, and so on, and for one who is giving up;

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādikam sabbam saṅgha bheda samam matam
translated: All of the origins and so on are considered the same as a schism in the Sangha.

analyzed: kula dūsana kathā
translated: The discussion of defiling a family.

analyzed: yāvatiham yena chāditā āpatti bhikkhunā
translated: As long as one knows, as long as one conceals an offense, a monk;

analyzed: akāmā parivatthabbam tena tāvatiham pana
translated: Without wanting, he should change, for that long, however.

analyzed: āpatti ca an ukkhittaḥ pahu ca ānantarāyikaḥ
translated: And the offense is not confessed, and there are many, and there is no obstacle;

analyzed: catusu api ca taṃsaññī tassa chādetu kāma tā
translated: And in all four, he perceives it, and he wants to conceal it.

analyzed: chādananti pana itehi dasa haṅgehi bhikkhunā
translated: But by these ten factors, it is said that an offense is concealed by a monk;

analyzed: channā nāma siyā patti aruṇuggamanena sā
translated: And by the break of dawn, it is an offense.

analyzed: dve bhāṇa vārā niṭṭhitā
translated: Two sections are finished.

analyzed: tividhaḥ parivāsaḥ hi tividha apeta cetasā
translated: For probation is of three kinds, and of three kinds by intention;

analyzed: paṭicchanno ca dīpito
translated: Concealed and pure, and also mixed: This is how the training is shown.

analyzed: tatra ayam tu paṭicchanna parivāsaḥ pakāsitaḥ
translated: Herein, this is the explanation of the concealed probation:

analyzed: paṭicchannāya dātabbaḥ vasena āpattiyā ati ca
translated: It should be given to one who’s concealed, By the offense and by the period.

analyzed: vatthu gotta vasena api nāma āpatti vasena vā
translated: By the basis, by the class, and by the name, And by the offense,

original: Kammavācā hi kātabbā, dātabbo tassa tena ca.
analyzed: kamma vācā hi kātabbā dātabbaḥ tassa tena ca
translated: The announcement should be made, And it should be given to him.

analyzed: vattam samādiyāmi iti parivāsanti vā punar
translated: “I undertake the practice,” or “probation,” Or again,

analyzed: samādiyitvā saṅghassa ārocetabbam āditas
translated: Having undertaken it, he should inform the Sangha at the beginning.

analyzed: punappunā āgatānam pi ārocentaḥ uva rattiyā
translated: Even if he comes again and again, He should inform the Sangha each time.

original: Chedaṃ vā vattabhedaṃ vā, akatvāva sadā vase.🔽Parivāso visodhetuṃ, na sakkā tattha ce pana;
analyzed: chedam vā vatta bhedam vā a katvā ava sadā vase  parivāsaḥ visodhetum na sakkā tattha ce pana
translated: Without breaking the continuity or the announcement, He should always observe it.🔽If he’s unable to purify the probation, And if he’s given it up,

original: Nikkhipitvāna taṃ vattaṃ, vatthabbaṃ tena bhikkhunā.
analyzed: nikkhipitvāna tam vattam vatthabbam tena bhikkhunā
translated: That monk should observe it again.

original: Tattheva saṅghamajjhe vā, puggale vāpi nikkhipe;
analyzed: tattha iva saṅgha majjhe vā puggale vā api nikkhipe
translated: Either in the midst of the Sangha, Or to an individual,

original: Nikkhipāmīti vattaṃ vā, parivāsanti vā tathā.
analyzed: nikkhipāmi iti vattam vā parivāsanti vā tathā
translated: He should give it up, saying, “I give up the practice,” Or “the probation,”

analyzed: evam eka padena api padehi dvīhi vā pana
translated: In this way, with one statement, Or with two statements,

analyzed: vattam nikkhipitabbam tam samādāne pi ayam nayaḥ
translated: He should give it up. The same method applies to undertaking it.

analyzed: nikkhitta kālato uddham pakatatto ti vuccati
translated: From the time of putting it down, he is called a regular monk.

original: Puna paccūsakālasmiṃ, saddhimekena bhikkhunā.🔽Parikkhittavihārassa, dve parikkhepato bahi;
analyzed: puna paccūsa kālasmim saddhim ekena bhikkhunā  parikkhitta vihārassa dve parikkhepataḥ bahi
translated: Again, at dawn, with a pure monk,🔽In the case of a monastery with an enclosure, two outside the enclosure;

original: Parikkhepārahaṭṭhānā, aparikkhittato bahi.🔽Leḍḍupāte atikkamma, okkamitvā ca maggato;
analyzed: parikkhepa āraha ṭhānā a parikkhittataḥ bahi  leḍḍupāte atikkamma okkamitvā ca maggataḥ
translated: In the case of one without an enclosure, outside the place where the enclosure should be.🔽Having gone beyond the range of a stone thrown by a strong man, and having left the path,

original: Gumbena vatiyā vāpi, channaṭṭhāne ṭhitena tu.🔽Tena antoruṇeyeva, vattamādāya viññunā;
analyzed: gumbena vatiyā vā api channa ṭṭhāne ṭhitena tu  tena vattam ādāya viññunā
translated: Either by a tree or by a creeper, standing in a concealed place,🔽The wise one should take up the observance right there inside the enclosure,

analyzed: ārocetvā aruṇe tasmin vuṭṭhite tassa santike
translated: And when the dawn has risen, he should announce it in the presence of the other.

original: Nikkhipitvā tato vattaṃ, gantabbaṃ tu yathāsukhaṃ;
analyzed: nikkhipitvā tatas vattam gantabbam tu yathāsukham
translated: Having put down the observance, he may then go as he likes;

original: Antoyevāruṇe bhikkhu, gato ce yassa kassaci.
analyzed: bhikkhu gataḥ ce yassa kassaci
translated: If a monk has gone anywhere inside the enclosure at dawn,

original: Ārocetvāva taṃ vattaṃ, nikkhipe puna paṇḍito;
analyzed: ārocetvā ava tam vattam nikkhipe puna paṇḍito
translated: Having announced the observance again, the wise one should put it down.

analyzed: sesam samuccayaḥ saṭṭhakathāya ca vibhāvaye
translated: The rest should be understood from the explanation in the section on the six announcements.

analyzed: āpattīnam ca rattīnam paricchedam na jānati
translated: If he does not know the distinction between offenses and nights,

analyzed: yaḥ tassa pana dātabbo suddhanto ti pavuccati
translated: But he should be given, it is said, “purification of the mind.”

analyzed: esa iva parisuddhehi suddha antaḥ duvidhaḥ mataḥ
translated: This very purification of the mind is considered twofold by the pure ones:

analyzed: cūḷasuddhanta nāmaḥ ca mahāsuddhanta nāmakaḥ
translated: One called a short purification, and one called a long purification.

analyzed: duvidhaḥ api ayam ratti paricchedam a jānataḥ
translated: Both of these are for one who does not know the definition of a night,

original: Ekaccaṃ sakalaṃ vāpi, dātabbo vimatissa vā.🔽Itaropi samodhāna-parivāso tidhā mato;
analyzed: ekaccam sakalam vā api dātabbaḥ vimatissa vā  itaraḥ api samodhāna parivāsaḥ tidhā mataḥ
translated: Or for one who is unsure of all or some.🔽The other is considered to be a probation that is combined, of three kinds:

analyzed: saḥ odhāna samodhānaḥ aggha missaka pubbakaḥ
translated: It is called a probation that is combined with a further one, with a mixture of the most serious, and with a previous one.

original: Āpajjitvāntarāpattiṃ, chādentassa hi bhikkhuno;🔽Divase parivutthe tu, odhunitvā padīyate.
analyzed: āpajjitvā antarāpattim chādentassa hi bhikkhuno  divase parivutthe tu odhunitvā padīyate
translated: For a monk who, after having committed an offense, conceals it,🔽When the probation has been completed during the day, it is given after the offense has been confessed.

analyzed: purima āpattiyāḥ mūla divase tu vinicchite
translated: When the first offense has been determined on the day it was committed,

original: Pacchā āpannamāpattiṃ, samodhāya vidhānato.🔽Yācamānassa saṅghena, dātabbo pana bhikkhuno;
analyzed: pacchā āpannam āpattim samodhāya vidhānataḥ  yācamānassa saṅghena dātabbaḥ pana bhikkhuno
translated: The offense that was committed later is combined with it, according to the rule.🔽It should be given to a monk who asks for it

analyzed: esodhāna samodhāna parivāsaḥ pakāsitaḥ
translated: by the Sangha. This is called a probation that is combined with a further one.🔽In the same way, it is for one, for two,

original: Tathā sambahulāsvekā, dve vā sambahulāpi vā;🔽Yā yā cirapaṭicchannā, tāsaṃ agghavasena hi.
analyzed: tathā sambahulāsu ekā dve vā sambahulā api vā  yā yā cira paṭicchannā tāsam aggha vasena hi
translated: or for a number of people.🔽And for whichever offense has been concealed the longest,🔽according to the most serious.

analyzed: āpattīnam ūna paṭicchannānam eva yaḥ
translated: For those who have committed a number of offenses, concealed for less than that period,

analyzed: samodhāya padātabbo parivāso ti vuccati
translated: it is called a probation that is combined.

analyzed: nānā vatthuka saññāyo sabbāḥ āpattiyaḥ pana
translated: All the offenses,

original: Sabbātā ekato katvā, dātabbo missako mato.
analyzed: ekatas katvā dātabbaḥ missakaḥ mataḥ
translated: Having collected all together, the Mūla should be given.

analyzed: parivuttha parivāsassa mānattam deyyam uttari
translated: The trial period having been done, the trial period should be given;

analyzed: cha rattiyaḥ paṭicchanna a paṭicchanna vasāḥ duve
translated: Six nights are concealed, two are concealed and unconcealed.

original: Tattha yā apaṭicchannā, hoti āpatti yassa tu;
analyzed: tattha yā apaṭicchannā hoti āpatti yassa tu
translated: Therein, the offense that is unconcealed, of him

analyzed: tassa dātabba mānattam apaṭicchanna nāmakam
translated: The trial period should be given, called “unconcealed.”

analyzed: paṭicchannā parivāsa avasānake
translated: The offense that is concealed, at the end of the trial period,

analyzed: tassa dātabba mānattam paṭicchannan ti vuccati
translated: The trial period should be given, called “concealed.”

analyzed: gantvā catūhi bhikkhūhi paccūsa samaye saha
translated: Having gone with four monks, at the time before dawn, together,

analyzed: parivāse viniddiṭṭha ppakāram desam eva ca
translated: And the kind of announcement that is done in the same place,

analyzed: vattam samādiyāmi iti mā ānattam iti vā pana
translated: “I undertake the trial period,” or “the trial period,”

analyzed: tam visāradaḥ
translated: Having undertaken it, having informed them, confidently,

original: Nikkhipe santike tesaṃ, vattaṃ tesu gatesu vā;
analyzed: nikkhipe santike tesam vattam tesu gatesu vā
translated: He should deposit it with them, or when they have gone,

analyzed: bhikkhussa pubbadiṭṭhassa ārocetvāna nikkhipe
translated: Having informed the monk who was seen first, he should deposit it.

analyzed: tassa dāna vidhānañca ratti cheda ādikaḥ nayaḥ
translated: And the method of giving it, and the principle of cutting off the night, etc.,

analyzed: ñeyyaḥ samuccayaḥ saṭṭha kathā pāḷi vasena tu
translated: Should be known by the method of the section of the Monastic Code of the sixth section of the summary.

analyzed: puna tam ciṇṇam ānattam saṅghaḥ vīsati vaggikaḥ
translated: Having done the trial period again, the Saṅgha of twenty members

analyzed: abbheyya vidhinā bhikkhu pakatatto punabbhitaḥ
translated: Should rehabilitate the monk by the rule, he who has been frightened again.

analyzed: chādentiyā api āpattim parivāsaḥ na vijjati
translated: Even when concealing an offense, probation is not found;

analyzed: na ca bhikkhuniyā apatti attano chādayantiyā
translated: There is no offense for a nun who conceals it herself.

original: Chādetvā vāpi āpattiṃ, acchādetvāpi vā pana;
analyzed: chādetvā vā api āpattim a chādetvā api vā pana
translated: Whether concealing an offense or not,

analyzed: kevalam caritabbanti pakkha mānattam eva tu  vinaya naya mati buddhi dīpanam  vinaya vinicchayam etam uttamam
translated: only the trial period of half a month.🔽Illuminating the understanding of the method of the Monastic Law,🔽this is the best discernment of the Monastic Law.

analyzed: vividha nayana yutam upenti ye
translated: Those who follow the many methods of the Monastic Law

analyzed: vinaya naye paṭutam upenti te
translated: will be skilled in the Monastic Law.

analyzed: iti vinaya vinicchaye saṅgha ādi sesa kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The section on the offenses entailing suspension in the Khandhaka on the Monastic Law is finished.

analyzed: aniyata kathā  rahaḥ mātu gāmassa santikam
translated: The undetermined rules🔽Approaching a woman in private,🔽he invites her to a secluded place,

analyzed: gantu kāmaḥ nivāseti akkhim añja iti bhuñjati
translated: sits down, touches her, and eats.

original: Payoge ca payoge ca, hoti sabbattha dukkaṭaṃ;
analyzed: payoge ca payoge ca hoti sabbattha dukkaṭam
translated: For every attempt, there is a serious offense.🔽For every step he takes,

analyzed: gacchataḥ padavārena gantvā ca ssa nisīdataḥ
translated: and for every time he sits down,🔽for both of them,

analyzed: nisajjāya payoga gaṇanāya ca
translated: according to the number of attempts,

analyzed: hoti pācittiyam tassa bahukāni bahūsu api
translated: There is an offense entailing confession for him, for many, and for many things.

analyzed: samīpe pi ṭhitaḥ andhaḥ antar dvādasa hatthake
translated: Even if standing close by, a blind person, within twelve handspans,

original: Na karoti anāpattiṃ, itthīnaṃ tu satampi ca.
analyzed: na karoti anāpattim itthīnam tu ca
translated: Does not commit an offense, but even a thousand women do not.

analyzed: cakkhumā api nipajjitvā niddāyantaḥ pi kevalam
translated: Even if a sighted person is lying down, or even sleeping,

analyzed: dvāre pihita gabbhassa nisinnaḥ api na rakkhati
translated: If the door is closed and the room is locked, he is not guarding.

original: Anandhe sati viññusmiṃ, ṭhitassārahasaññino;🔽Nisajjapaccayā doso, natthi vikkhittacetaso.
analyzed: an andhe sati viññusmin  nisajja paccayā doso natthi vikkhitta cetasaḥ
translated: If there is no desire, if the sensible person is standing, thinking it is a private matter,🔽There is no offense for one who is sitting, but there is for one whose mind is distracted.

analyzed: na dosummattaka ādīnam tīhipi
translated: There is no offense for one who is insane, etc., or for any of the three who are asleep.

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ tulyā
translated: The origins, etc., are the same as in the first and last rules.

analyzed: paṭhamā aniyata kathā
translated: The first undetermined offense is finished.

original: Anandhābadhiro viññū, itthī vā purisopi vā;
analyzed: an andha abadhiraḥ viññū itthī vā purisaḥ api vā
translated: A sensible person who is blind and deaf, whether a woman or a man,

analyzed: anāpatti karo siyā
translated: Standing within twelve handspans, may not commit an offense.

original: Andho abadhiro vāpi, badhiro vāpi cakkhumā;
analyzed: andhaḥ a badhiraḥ vā api badhiraḥ vā api cakkhumā
translated: A blind person or a deaf person, or a sighted person who is deaf,

original: Na karoti anāpattiṃ, tisamuṭṭhānamevidaṃ.🔽Dutiyāniyatakathā.🔽Iti vinayavinicchaye aniyatakathā niṭṭhitā.🔽Nissaggiyakathā
analyzed: na karoti anāpattim ti samuṭṭhānam eva idam 🔽dutiyā aniyata kathā 🔽iti vinaya vinicchaye aniyatakathā niṭṭhitā 🔽nissaggiya kathā
translated: Does not commit an offense. This has three origins.

analyzed: khomam kappāsa koseyyam sāṇam bhaṅgam ca kambalam
translated: Linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp:

original: Cīvaraṃ chabbidhaṃ vuttaṃ, jātito pana kappiyaṃ.🔽Dukūlañceva pattuṇṇaṃ, cinaṃ somārapaṭṭakaṃ;
analyzed: cīvaram chabbidham vuttam jātitaḥ pana kappiyam  dukūlam ca iva pattuṇṇam cinam somāra paṭṭakam
translated: These are the six kinds of robe-cloth that are allowable by nature.

original: Iddhijaṃ devadinnañca, tassetaṃ anulomikaṃ.🔽Ticīvaraṃ parikkhāra-coḷañca mukhapuñchanaṃ;
analyzed: iddhi jam deva dinnam ca tassa itam anulomikam  ti cīvaram parikkhāra coḷam ca mukha puñchanam
translated: Fine cloth, cotton, silk, Chinese silk, linen, and divine cloth:🔽These are the six kinds of robe-cloth that are allowable by permission.🔽The three robes, the requisites, the cloth for wiping the bowl and face,

analyzed: nisīdanam adhiṭṭheyya paccattharaṇam eva ca
translated: The sitting mat, and the sheet to protect the furniture:

original: Ekāhampi vinā bhikkhu, na vaseyya ticīvaraṃ;
analyzed: eka aham pi vinā bhikkhu na vaseyya ti cīvaram
translated: Without one of the three robes, a monk should not stay even one day;

analyzed: na vaseyya cātumāsam nisīdanam
translated: And he should not stay without the sitting mat, which is determined for four months.

original: Rajitvā kappiyaṃ binduṃ, datvā tattha ticīvaraṃ;
analyzed: rajitvā kappiyam bindum da tvā tattha ti cīvaram
translated: Having washed the allowable drop, and having given there the three robes,

original: Upapannaṃ pamāṇena, adhiṭṭhātabbameva taṃ.🔽Pacchimantena saṅghāṭi, dīghaso muṭṭhipañcakā;
analyzed: upapannam pamāṇena adhiṭṭhātabbam eva tam  pacchimantena saṅghāṭi dīghasaḥ muṭṭhi pañcakā
translated: Having measured it, it should be determined.🔽The outer robe, at the most, is five hand spans in length;

original: Muṭṭhittikā ca tiriyaṃ, uttamantena sā pana.🔽Satthuno cīvarūnāpi, vaṭṭatīti pakāsitā;
analyzed: muṭṭhittikā ca tiriyam uttama antena sā pana  satthuno vaṭṭati iti pakāsitā
translated: And two and a half hand spans in width.🔽This is the measure for the upper robe,

analyzed: idam eva uttarāsaṅge pamāṇam paridīpitam
translated: As taught by the Teacher.

analyzed: muṭṭhi pañcakam dīghantam pamāṇam
translated: The upper robe, at the most, is five hand spans in length;

original: Aḍḍhateyyaṃ dvihatthaṃ vā, sese antaravāsake.🔽Ahatāhatakappānaṃ, saṅghāṭi diguṇā matā;
analyzed: aḍḍhateyyam dvi hattham vā sese antaravāsake  saṅghāṭi diguṇā matā
translated: A double or a double-and-a-half, And the rest for the sarong.🔽For the upper robe, the outer robe, And the sarong, the same is said.

analyzed: eka paṭṭuttarāsaṅgaḥ evam antaravāsakaḥ
translated: The sarong is one layer.

analyzed: pana
translated: But for robes that are worn out,

analyzed: saṅghāṭi bhikkhussa catugguṇā vā
translated: The outer robe is fourfold,

analyzed: duve api sesā vuttā
translated: And the other two are double.

analyzed: yathāsukham vaṭṭati paṃsukūlam
translated: A rag robe is allowed as one likes.

original: Tīṇipi dvepi cekaṃ vā, chinditabbaṃ pahoti ce;
analyzed: tīṇi pi dve pi ca ikam vā chinditabbam pahoti ce
translated: If one can make them, three, two, or one,

analyzed: sabbesu deyyam anvādhikam pi vā
translated: If one has none, one should ask for them.

analyzed: acchinnam vā an ādinnam dhārentassa ti cīvaram
translated: If one wears the three robes uncut,

original: Bhikkhuno dukkaṭaṃ vuttaṃ, dubbhogena ca sevato.
analyzed: bhikkhunaḥ dukkaṭam vuttam dubbhogena ca sevataḥ
translated: Or if one uses a double mat, it’s a wrongdoing.🔽A fringe, half a fringe,

analyzed: kusim aḍḍhakusim ca api maṇḍalam aḍḍhamaṇḍalam
translated: A border, half a border,

analyzed: vivaṭṭam anuvivaṭṭam bāhantam pi ca bhikkhuno
translated: A patch, and also a monk’s cloak:🔽Having shown all these,

analyzed: dassetvā ava vidhim sabbam pañcaka ādi ppabhedakam
translated: The different kinds beginning with the five,

analyzed: chinnam samaṇa sāruppam kātabbam tu ti cīvaram
translated: The three robes should be cut, in a way suitable for an ascetic.

analyzed: vissāsa ggahaṇena ca
translated: By giving, by cutting, by taking on trust,

analyzed: sikkhāya ca pahānato
translated: And by turning to a lower life, And by giving up the training.

analyzed: paccuddhāra vināsehi liṅgassa parivattanā
translated: By taking back, by destruction, By changing the sex;

analyzed: sabbam bhijja tidhiṭṭhānam chidda bhāve ti cīvaram
translated: All is destroyed by a breach, The three robes by being cut up.

analyzed: kaniṭṭhaḥ aṅgulassa iva nakha piṭṭhi ppamāṇakam
translated: The size of the back of a finger-nail, Of the youngest finger;

analyzed: vinividdham pana chiddam adhiṭṭhāna vināsanam
translated: Cut off, with a hole, By determination, by destruction.

original: Eko tantupi acchinno, adhiṭṭhānaṃ na bhindati;
analyzed: ekaḥ acchinnaḥ adhiṭṭhānam na bhindati
translated: Even if one thread is uncut, The determination is not broken;

analyzed: seta bhāvam karontena rajakena vā
translated: By one who makes it white, By a washerman or by dyeing.

original: Paṭhamaṃ aggaḷaṃ datvā, pacchā chindati rakkhati;
analyzed: paṭhamam aggaḷam da tvā pacchā chindati rakkhati
translated: Having first given the bolt, Afterwards he cuts, he preserves;

original: Ghaṭetvā koṭiyo dve vā, pacchā chindati rakkhati.
analyzed: ghaṭetvā koṭiyaḥ dve vā pacchā chindati rakkhati
translated: Having joined two corners, Afterwards he cuts, he preserves.

analyzed: catur aṭṭhaṅgulāḥ tirīyataḥ
translated: Four or eight fingerbreadths across, One or two, from the third;

analyzed: tiṇṇam pi dīghataḥ chiddam bhindatā iva vidatthiyā
translated: For all three, a hole lengthwise, It certainly breaks the binding.

analyzed: nisīdanassa dīghena bhavanti dve vidatthiyaḥ
translated: Of the sitting mat, lengthwise, There are two bindings;

analyzed: vitthārena diyaḍḍhā ca sugatassa vidatthiyā
translated: In breadth, one and a half, Of the Sugata’s binding.

analyzed: honti kaṇḍu paṭicchādi tiriyam dve
translated: There are two bindings across, For the itch-covering cloth;

analyzed: dīghato pi sugatassa
translated: Lengthwise, there are four, Of the Sugata’s binding.

analyzed: dīghataḥ sugatassa iva bhavanti cha vidatthiyaḥ
translated: In length it is the same as the Sugata’s, And in width it is a cubit and a half;

analyzed: siyā vassika sāṭikā
translated: The rainy-season robe may be this size.

analyzed: muninā tīsu etesu karontassa tad uttarim
translated: If one makes one exceeding these three,

analyzed: adhika chedanam tassa pācittiyam udīritam
translated: The cutting off of the excess is said to be an offense entailing confession.

analyzed: mukha puñchana coḷassa paccattharaṇakassa vā
translated: The size of the face-washing cloth, Or of the sheet for spreading on the seat,

analyzed: pamāṇam appamāṇena na ca iva paridīpitam
translated: Has not been laid down either by measure or by size.

original: Sadasaṃ adasaṃ sabbaṃ, paccattharaṇacīvaraṃ;🔽Mahantaṃ khuddakaṃ eka-manekampi ca vaṭṭati.
analyzed: sadasam adasam sabbam paccattharaṇa cīvaram  mahantam khuddakam ekam anekam pi ca vaṭṭati
translated: The whole of the sheet for spreading on the seat, Whether it is incomplete or complete,🔽May be large or small, or it may be single or double.

original: Mukhapuñchanacoḷekaṃ, dvepi vaṭṭanti sabbathā;🔽Sadasaṃ adasaṃ vāpi, sadasaṃva nisīdanaṃ.
analyzed: mukha puñchana coḷekam dve api vaṭṭanti sabbathā  sadasam adasam vā api sadasam vā nisīdanam
translated: The single face-washing cloth, Or the double one, is allowable in every way;🔽Whether it is incomplete or complete, The sitting-cloth is also like this.

analyzed: adasā rajitāya iva
translated: The sheet for spreading on the seat is only allowable when it is incomplete, And when it is dyed; it is not allowable when it is new.

original: Vuttā kaṇḍuppaṭicchādi, tathā vassikasāṭikā.🔽Gaṇanaṃ vā pamāṇaṃ vā, na parikkhāracoḷake;
analyzed: vuttā kaṇḍuppaṭicchādi tathā vassikasāṭikā  gaṇanam vā pamāṇam vā na parikkhāra coḷake
translated: The itch-covering cloth and the rainy-season robe are also like this.🔽In the case of the robe-cloth for the requisites, There is no enumeration or measure;

analyzed: bhaṇanti pakataññuno
translated: Those who know the rules say that it is not an offense If it exceeds the measure or the number.

analyzed: sugata ṭṭhaṅgula āyāmam catur aṅgula vitthatam
translated: The smallest robe is one that is eight standard fingerbreadths long And four wide;

analyzed: vikappana upagam hoti pacchimam nāma cīvaram
translated: This is the smallest robe that is allowable.

analyzed: parissāva paṭam patta potthaka tthavika ādikam
translated: A cloth for sweat, a bowl, a water filter, a bag, a key, and so on,

analyzed: adhiṭṭheyya parikkhāra coḷam pacchima cīvaram
translated: A requisite, a cloth, and the last robe.

analyzed: bahūni ekatas katvā adhiṭṭhātum pi vaṭṭati
translated: Having made many into one, it is allowable to determine;

analyzed: mātu ādīnam atthāya ṭhapite natthi dosa tā
translated: For the sake of mother and so on, there is no fault in what is set aside.

analyzed: vassa māse adhiṭṭheyya caturaḥ vassa sāṭikam
translated: In the rainy season one should determine four robes for the rainy season;

original: Puna paccuddharitvā taṃ, vikappeyya tato paraṃ.
analyzed: puna paccuddharitvā tam vikappeyya tatas param
translated: Having again relinquished them, one may make them up afterwards.

original: Tāva kaṇḍuppaṭicchādiṃ, yāva rogo na sammati;
analyzed: tāva kaṇḍu paṭicchādim yāva rogaḥ na
translated: For as long as the itch does not subside, the itch-covering cloth;

original: Adhiṭṭhahitvā tato uddhaṃ, uddharitvā vikappaye.🔽“Imaṃ kaṇḍuppaṭicchādiṃ, imamantaravāsakaṃ;
analyzed: adhiṭṭhahitvā tatas uddham uddharitvā vikappaye  imam kaṇḍuppaṭicchādim imam antaravāsakam
translated: Having determined it, afterwards, having relinquished it, one may make it up.

analyzed: sesesu pi ayam nayaḥ
translated: “I determine this itch-covering cloth, this inner cloth,” thus one should determine; in the rest of the cases this is the method.

analyzed: imam kaṇḍu paṭicchādim etanti ca a sammukhe
translated: “This itch-covering cloth, this,” and not face to face,

analyzed: vatvā paccuddhareyya evam sesesu pi vicakkhaṇaḥ
translated: Having said, one should relinquish it thus; in the rest of the cases the wise one should do likewise.

analyzed: ābhogam manasā katvā kāyena phusanākatam
translated: Having made the resolve mentally, having touched it with the body,

analyzed: vacasā adhiṭṭhitam ca ati adhiṭṭhānam dvidhā matam
translated: And having determined it verbally, the determining is considered twofold.

analyzed: iti sabbam idam vuttam tecīvarika bhikkhuno
translated: Thus all this has been said for the bhikkhu who has three robes,

analyzed: tathā vatvā avadhiṭṭheyya tam parikkhāra coḷikaḥ
translated: Having said that, he should determine it, and that is the robe-cloth for requisites.

analyzed: ti cīvaram parikkhāra coḷam kātum pi vaṭṭati
translated: It is allowable to make a triple-robe and robe-cloth for requisites;

analyzed: evam vutto parihāraḥ niratthako
translated: When it is thus determined, the explanation of the exception is pointless.

analyzed: na tecīvarikassa iva vuttattā tattha satthunā
translated: Because it is said only of the triple-robe,

analyzed: tam parikkhāra coḷassa tasmā sabbam pi vaṭṭati
translated: not of the robe-cloth for requisites, therefore all is allowable.

analyzed: adhiṭṭheti vikappeti anāpatti iti ettha ca
translated: And in the case of “He determines, he exchanges, there is no offense,”

analyzed: adhiṭṭhātabbakassa iva vikappana vidhānataḥ
