analyzed: bhikkhu nissaggiya āpattim āpajjati na saṃsayaḥ  bhikkhunaḥ ñātaka ādīnam tantavāyesu attanaḥ
translated: The monk commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽When they have spun the yarn themselves, and then woven it,🔽The monk commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽When they have spun the yarn themselves, and then woven it,

analyzed: dhanenaññassa catthāya anāpattim viniddise
translated: The monk commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽When they have spun the yarn themselves, and then woven it,🔽The monk commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

analyzed: vāyāpentassa appaggham mahaggham kattu kāminaḥ
translated: When they have spun the yarn themselves, and then woven it,🔽The monk commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

analyzed: tathā ummattaka ādīnam sesam vuttam anantare
translated: When they have spun the yarn themselves, and then woven it,

analyzed: pesakāra kathā  vassaṃvuṭṭhe yam uddissa bhikkhū dīyati cīvaram
translated: The monk commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽When they have spun the yarn themselves, and then woven it,🔽The monk commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽When they have spun the yarn themselves, and then woven it,

analyzed: pavāraṇāya pubbā iva tam hotat ceka cīvaram
translated: The monk commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: Pure pavāraṇāyeva, bhājetvā yadi gayhati;🔽Vassacchedo na kātabbo, saṅghikaṃ taṃ karoti ce.
analyzed: pure pavāraṇāya iva bhājetvā yadi gayhati  vassa chedaḥ na kātabbaḥ saṅghikam tam karoti ce
translated: When they have spun the yarn themselves, and then woven it,🔽The monk commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽When they have spun the yarn themselves, and then woven it,🔽The monk commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽When they have spun the yarn themselves, and then woven it,

original: Anāpatti adhiṭṭheti, antosamayameva taṃ;🔽Vissajjeti vikappeti, vinassati ca ḍayhati.
analyzed: anāpatti adhiṭṭheti antosamayam eva tam  vissajjeti vikappeti vinassati ca ḍayhati
translated: The monk commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽When they have spun the yarn themselves, and then woven it,🔽The monk commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽When they have spun the yarn themselves, and then woven it,

analyzed: kathine tu an attha te
translated: The monk commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽When they have spun the yarn themselves, and then woven it,🔽The monk commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽When they have spun the yarn themselves, and then woven it,🔽The monk commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽When they have spun the yarn themselves, and then woven it,🔽The monk commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

analyzed: dasa aha paramaḥ mataḥ
translated: The maximum is one month, it is thought, and ten days at the most.

original: Atthate kathine tassa, pañca māsā pakāsitā;
analyzed: atthate kathine tassa pañca māsā pakāsitā
translated: When the kaṭhina has been spread, five months are allowed;

analyzed: parihāraḥ pana
translated: The maximum is ten days, it is said, by the Lord of the Dhamma.

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayo sabbe kathinena samā matā
translated: All the origins, etc., are considered the same as with the kaṭhina;

analyzed: paṭhamena a kriyā cittam ti cittam ca ti vedanam
translated: The first is with non-information, and the mind is threefold, and the feeling is threefold.

analyzed: accekacīvara kathā
translated: The account of the urgent robe.

original: Vasitvā pana ce bhikkhu, pubbakattikapuṇṇamaṃ;🔽Ṭhapetvā cīvaraṃ gāme, paccaye sati tādise.
analyzed: vasitvā pana ce bhikkhu pubbakattikapuṇṇamam  ṭhapetvā cīvaram gāme paccaye sati tādise
translated: But if a monk, after staying, the full moon of Kattika,🔽Having left his robe in the village, with requisites of that kind available,

analyzed: chāratta paramam tena vasitabbam vinā tatas
translated: He may stay away for six days at the most, and not more than that;

original: Uttariṃ vasato doso, vinā saṅghassa sammutiṃ.
analyzed: uttarim vasataḥ dosaḥ vinā saṅghassa sammutim
translated: If he stays beyond that, there is an offense, unless there is consent of the Sangha.

analyzed: kattikeya iva māsasmim paṭhamāya pavāritaḥ
translated: If he is invited for the first month, he should make it in that month;

analyzed: pacchimena pamāṇena yutte sa āsaṅka sammate
translated: With the measure of the last, it is proper, and it is considered doubtful.

analyzed: senāsane eka cīvaram
translated: Staying in a dwelling, he should leave one robe;

analyzed: catur aṅga samāyoge labhati iti
translated: When the four factors are complete, it is said, he gets it.

original: Yaṃ gāmaṃ gocaraṃ katvā, bhikkhu āraññake vase;
analyzed: yam gāmam gocaram katvā bhikkhu āraññake vase
translated: The monk who makes a village his alms resort and stays in the wilderness

original: Tasmiṃ gāme ṭhapetuṃ taṃ, māsamekaṃ tu vaṭṭati.
analyzed: tasmin gāme tam māsam ekam tu vaṭṭati
translated: May leave it there for one month.

analyzed: aññattha iva vasantassa chāratta paramam matam
translated: If he stays elsewhere, it’s agreed that he has seven days at the most.

analyzed: ayam assa adhippāyaḥ paṭicchannaḥ pakāsito
translated: This is the intention, but it’s concealed.

analyzed: senāsanam atha āgantvā sattamam aruṇam pana
translated: If he goes to the dwelling place, but the sun has already set on the seventh day,

analyzed: uṭṭhāpetum vidūra ttā a sakkontassa bhikkhuno
translated: And if the monk is unable to get up because of a long distance,

original: Gāmasīmampi vā gantvā, vasitvā yattha katthaci;
analyzed: vā gantvā vasitvā yattha katthaci
translated: Or if he goes to the village zone, and he stays anywhere,

original: Cīvarassa pavattiṃ so, ñatvā gacchati vaṭṭati.
analyzed: cīvarassa pavattim saḥ ñatvā gacchati vaṭṭati
translated: And he knows the robe-cloth is lost, he may go.

analyzed: evam ca api a sakkontaḥ ñatvā tattha iva paṇḍito
translated: But if he’s still unable, the wise one should know right there,

original: Khippaṃ paccuddhare ṭhāne, atireke hi tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: khippam paccuddhare ṭhāne atireke hi tiṭṭhati
translated: And quickly disrobe right there, for it’s excessive to keep it.

analyzed: vissajjeti anāpatti vinassati ca ḍayhati
translated: If he gives it away, there’s no offense, if it’s lost or burned,

analyzed: a chindane ca vissāse bhikkhu sammutiyā api vā
translated: If it’s stolen or given on trust, or if it’s agreed by the Sangha.

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayo sabbe kathinena samā matā
translated: All the origins, etc., are considered the same as with the kaṭhina.

analyzed: dutiyena munindena tena sāsaṅka sammate
translated: The second Buddha, the leader of the world,🔽Agreed to the kaṭhina in inhabited areas.

analyzed: sā asaṅka kathā
translated: The discussion of inhabited areas.

original: Jānaṃ pariṇataṃ lābhaṃ, bhikkhusaṅghassa yo pana;
analyzed: jānam pariṇatam lābham bhikkhu saṅghassa yo pana
translated: If a monk, knowing that a gain is intended for the Sangha of monks,

analyzed: tassa nissaggiyam siyā
translated: Redirects it to himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

analyzed: sace aññassa dehi iti pariṇāmeti bhikkhuno
translated: If he redirects it, saying, “Give it to so-and-so,” to a monk,

analyzed: suddhikam suddha cittena pācittiyam udīritam
translated: With a pure mind, he should confess it: The offense entailing confession has been declared.

original: Cīvaraṃ vā parasseka-mekaṃ vā pana attano;
analyzed: cīvaram vā parassa ikam ekam vā pana attanaḥ
translated: If he exchanges a robe belonging to another, or one belonging to himself,

original: Pariṇāmeyya ce saddhiṃ, dve pācittiyo siyuṃ.🔽Saṅghassa pana yaṃ dinnaṃ, taṃ gahetuṃ na vaṭṭati;
analyzed: ce saddhim dve pācittiyaḥ siyuṃ  saṅghassa pana yam dinnam tam gahetum na vaṭṭati
translated: For one belonging to another, there are two offenses entailing confession.🔽But if something has been given to the Sangha, he should not take it;

analyzed: saṅghassa iva padātabbaḥ a dentassa parājayaḥ
translated: He should return it to the Sangha. If he does not return it, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

original: Cetiyassa ca saṅghassa, puggalassapi vā pana;
analyzed: cetiyassa ca saṅghassa puggalassa api vā pana
translated: If he exchanges something belonging to a shrine, to the Sangha,

analyzed: aññassa dukkaṭaṃ
translated: Or to an individual, for something belonging to another, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: yaḥ panantamasaḥ bhikkhu sunakhassa pi
translated: But if a monk exchanges something belonging to a dog,

analyzed: su nakhassa panaññassa pariṇāmeyya dukkaṭam
translated: Or something belonging to a dog for something belonging to another, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽This rule comes from the three sources,

analyzed: idam hi ti samuṭṭhānam kriyam saññā vimokkhakam
translated: It is an action, and it is liberated by perception,

analyzed: kāya kammam vacī kammam ti cittam ca ti vedanam
translated: It is bodily and verbal action, and it has three kinds of origins. It has three kinds of origins and three kinds of feelings.

analyzed: pariṇata kathā
translated: The discussion of exchanging is finished.

analyzed: patta vaggaḥ tatiyaḥ
translated: The third sub-chapter on the bowl is finished.

analyzed: tena eka vatthugga taraṅga mālam
translated: The garland of waves that has come down in the lineage,

analyzed: sīlantam āpatti vipatti gāham
translated: The one with the virtue of seizing offenses and downfalls,

analyzed: taranti paññatti mahā samuddam  vinicchayam ye panimam taranti
translated: Those who cross the great ocean of the Monastic Code,🔽They cross this exposition.

analyzed: iti vinaya vinicchaye nissaggiya kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of relinquishment in the Khandhaka on the Monastic Law is finished.

analyzed: pācittiya kathā
translated: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

analyzed: sampajāna musāvāde pācittiyam udīritam
translated: In a deliberate lie, an offense entailing confession is declared.

analyzed: davāḥ ravāḥ bhaṇantassa na dosa ummattaka ādinaḥ
translated: When speaking out of excitement or jest, there is no offense if one is not thinking of it as a lie.

analyzed: aññattha āpattiyaḥ pañca musāvādassa kāraṇā
translated: There are five other kinds of offenses that are the basis for a lie.

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayo sabbe adinnādāna tulyakā
translated: All the origins, etc., are the same as for stealing.

analyzed: sampajāna musā vāda kathā
translated: The chapter on deliberate lies

analyzed: jāti ādīsu vuttesu
translated: In the ten cases of abuse, as stated,🔽whether it is true or not,

original: Bhūtena vā abhūtena, yena kenaci vatthunā.
analyzed: bhūtena vā abhūtena yena kenacid vatthunā
translated: with any kind of words,

original: Yāya kāyaci bhāsāya, hatthamuddāya vā pana;🔽Pārājikamanāpannaṃ, bhikkhumāpannameva vā.
analyzed: yāya kāyaci bhāsāya hattha muddāya vā pana  pārājikam an āpannam bhikkhum āpannam eva vā
translated: or by raising a hand,🔽against a monk who has not committed an offense entailing expulsion, or who has committed such an offense,

analyzed: aññatra aññā apadesena omasantassa bhikkhuno
translated: except if one is asking a question,

analyzed: tattha pācittiya āpatti sambuddhena pakāsitā
translated: the Buddha has declared an offense entailing confession for a monk who abuses him.🔽If one is asking a question,

analyzed: tehi ivaññā apadesena pāḷi mutta padehi pi
translated: or if one uses the words of the text,

analyzed: sabbattha an upasampannam akkosantassa dukkaṭam
translated: then it is a serious offense for abusing one who is not fully ordained, anywhere.

analyzed: an akkositu kāmassa kevalam dava kamyatā
translated: If one does not want to abuse, but only to joke,

analyzed: vadataḥ pana sabbattha dubbhāsitam udīritam
translated: then it is said to be wrong speech in all cases.

analyzed: paviṭṭha an upasampanna ṭṭhāne idha ca bhikkhunī
translated: In the case of one who is not fully ordained who has entered the monastery, and in this case a nun,

analyzed: anāpatti purakkhatvā attha dhamma anusāsanim
translated: There’s no offense if, putting them first, you instruct them in the Teaching and the Monastic Law.

analyzed: vadataḥ pana bhikkhussa samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ nayā
translated: But if a monk speaks, the origins, etc., are the same as for the offense entailing confession.

analyzed: anantara samā vuttā dukkhā hotā ittha vedanā
translated: The next section is spoken in the same way, but with painful feeling.

analyzed: omasavāda kathā
translated: The section on abusive speech.

analyzed: āpatti bhikkhu pesuññe duvidhākārataḥ siyā
translated: There are two kinds of offenses in connection with malicious talebearing:

analyzed: attanaḥ piya kāmassa para bheda tthinaḥ pi vā
translated: One who is fond of the other person, or one who wants to cause a schism.

analyzed: akkosantassa ca
translated: When one who is scolding uses the text of the Monastic Code or the method of the Monastic Code,

analyzed: vacanassu upasaṃhāre hoti āpatti dukkaṭam
translated: and when one who is speaking stops, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: tathā an upasampanna akkosam harataḥ api ca
translated: So too when one who is not fully ordained is scolding, and one who is fully ordained stops it;

analyzed: ṭhitā an upasampanna ṭhāne idha ca bhikkhunī
translated: and when one who is not fully ordained is standing in the place for fully ordained monks, and a nun is standing in the place for nuns.

original: Na ceva piyakāmassa, na ca bhedatthinopi vā;
analyzed: na ca iva piya kāmassa na ca bhedatthinaḥ pi vā
translated: One who is not fond of the other person, and one who does not want to cause a schism;

original: Pāpānaṃ garahatthāya, vadantassa ca bhikkhuno.🔽Tathā ummattakādīnaṃ, anāpattīti dīpitā;
analyzed: pāpānam gara hatthāya vadantassa ca bhikkhunaḥ  tathā ummattaka ādīnam anāpatti iti dīpitā
translated: and a monk who is speaking in order to criticize bad behavior.🔽So too for one who is insane, etc.;

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ sabbe
translated: no offense is declared. The origins, etc., are the same as for the offense entailing confession for stealing.

analyzed: pesuñña kathā  ṭhapetvā bhikkhunim bhikkhum aññena piṭaka ttayam
translated: The section on malicious talebearing.🔽Except for a nun and a monk,

original: Dhammaṃ saha bhaṇantassa, tassa pācittiyaṃ siyā.
analyzed: dhammam saha bhaṇantassa tassa pācittiyam siyā
translated: there is an offense entailing confession for one who recites the Teaching together with someone belonging to another religion.

analyzed: rājovāda ādayaḥ vuttāḥ mahā paccariya ādisu
translated: The “royal proclamations,” etc., are stated in the Mahāpaccariya and so on;

original: Anāruḷhesu saṅgītiṃ, āpattijanakāti hi.🔽Dukkaṭaṃ hoti bhikkhusmiṃ, tathā bhikkhuniyāpi ca;
analyzed: an āruḷhesu saṅgītim āpatti janakā ati hi  dukkaṭam hoti bhikkhusmim tathā bhikkhuniyā api ca
translated: In the unestablished recitations, the origin of offenses is called “janaka.”🔽There is an offense of wrong conduct for a monk,

original: Bhikkhussānupasampanna-saññino vimatissa vā.🔽Ekato uddisāpeti, sajjhāyaṃ vā karoti yo;
analyzed: bhikkhussa anupasampanna saññinaḥ vimatissa vā  ekatas uddisa apeti sajjhāyam vā karoti yaḥ
translated: And likewise for a nun, if she perceives the other as not fully ordained, or is unsure of it.🔽If he recites together with one who is not fully ordained,🔽Or if he recites aloud with him,

original: Bhaṇantaṃ paguṇaṃ ganthaṃ, opāteti ca yo pana.
analyzed: bhaṇantam paguṇam gantham ca yaḥ pana
translated: Or if he corrects the text of a recitation that is not faulty,

analyzed: tassa ca an upasampanna santike gaṇhataḥ pi ca
translated: Or if he memorizes it in the presence of one who is not fully ordained,

original: Uddesaṃ tu anāpatti, bhaṇane tena ekato.
analyzed: uddesam tu anāpatti bhaṇane tena ekatas
translated: There is no offense in reciting together with him.🔽It originates from speech,

original: Vācato ca samuṭṭhāti, vācācittadvayāpi ca;🔽Samuṭṭhānamidaṃ vuttaṃ, padasodhammasaññitaṃ.
analyzed: ca ca  samuṭṭhānam idam vuttam pada sodhamma saññitam

analyzed: pada sodhamma kathā
translated: The discussion of the purification of the text.

original: Sabbacchannaparicchanne, nipajjeyya sace pana;🔽Yebhuyyena paricchanne, channe senāsanepi vā.
analyzed: sabba channa paricchanne nipajjeyya sace pana  yebhuyyena paricchanne channe senāsane pi vā
translated: If one lies down in a covered and enclosed space,🔽Or in a space that is mostly covered, or in a covered sleeping place,

original: Tissannaṃ pana rattīnaṃ, uddhaṃ yo pana rattiyaṃ;
analyzed: tissannam pana rattīnam uddham yaḥ pana rattiyam
translated: Or if one, during the night, after the third watch,

analyzed: ṭhapetvā bhikkhum aññena tassa pācittiyam siyā 🔽vatthum yam pana niddiṭṭham methunassa pahonakam

analyzed: tena tiracchāna gatena api  nipanne upasampanne itaraḥ ce nipajjati  itarasmin nipanne vā sace bhikkhu nipajjati

analyzed: vā siyā

translated: If he lies down with a partition, or he lies down without a partition,

analyzed: parikkhittam api tat sabbam parikkhittanti vuccati

analyzed: sahaseyyāya āpatti hoti iti paridīpitaḥ

analyzed: sabba channa paricchanna yebhuyya ādi ppa bhedato  satta daṭṭhabbāni subuddhinā

translated: For “half-covered” and “partially-covered”,

translated: And in five other ways: “all-covered”, “partially-covered”, and so on.

original: Anāpatti dirattaṃ vā, tirattaṃ vasato saha;

analyzed: aruṇassa pureyā iva tatiyāya ca rattiyā

analyzed: nikkhamitvā vasantassa puna saddhiñca bhikkhuno

original: Tathā sabbaparicchanna-sabbacchannādikepi ca.🔽Evaṃ anupasampanne, nipannepi nisīdato;
analyzed: tathā sabba paricchanna sabba channa ādike pi ca  evam an upasampanne nipanne api nisīdataḥ

translated: The rule on sleeping in the same sleeping place

analyzed: sace tad ahu jātāya api yaḥ mānusitthiyā
translated: If he invites a human girl who was born on that very day

analyzed: methuna vatthu bhūtāya tiracchānaga titthiyā
translated: Or with a female animal that is a fit object for sexual intercourse,

analyzed: vatthūnam gaṇanāyassa hoti āpatti dukkaṭam  idha eka divasena iva āpatti paridīpitā

analyzed: sesaḥ anantare vutta sadisaḥ iva vinicchayaḥ

analyzed: dutiya sahaseyya kathā
translated: The second rule on the same sleeping place

analyzed: chappañca vācāhi viññum purisa viggaham
translated: If the other person is an adult human male, and he has more than five statements,

original: Vinā dhammaṃ bhaṇantassa, hoti pācitti itthiyā.
analyzed: vinā dhammam bhaṇantassa hoti pācitti itthiyā
translated: If one speaks Dhamma without a woman, there is an offense entailing confession.

original: Gāthāpādo panekova, ekavācāti saññito;🔽Padasodhammaṃ niddiṭṭhaṃ, dhammamaṭṭhakathampi vā.
analyzed: gāthā pādo panekaḥ iva eka vācā ati saññitaḥ  niddiṭṭham vā

original: Channaṃ upari vācānaṃ, padādīnaṃ vasā pana;🔽Desentassa siyāpatti, padādigaṇanāya ca.
analyzed: channam upari vācānam pada ādīnam vasa pana  desentassa pada ādi gaṇanāya ca

analyzed: nimminitvā ṭhitena api saddhim purisa viggaham
translated: Even if one conjures up a human form and then teaches together with it,

analyzed: yakkhena api ca petena tiracchāna gatena api

original: Ṭhitassa mātugāmassa, dhammaṃ yo pana bhāsati;
analyzed: ṭhitassa mātugāmassa dhammam yaḥ pana bhāsati

analyzed: channam upari vācānam tassa pācittiyam siyā

analyzed: purise itthi saññissa vimatissa ca paṇḍake

original: Uttari chahi vācāhi, vadato hoti dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: uttari chahi vācāhi vadataḥ hoti dukkaṭam
translated: or to a man who is unsure of his gender, it is a serious offense for each of the six lines.

analyzed: ca

analyzed: dukkaṭam yakkhi petīnam tiracchānaga titthiyā

original: Aññissā puna aññissā, itthiyā bhaṇatopi ca;

translated: And to another woman, and also to one who is speaking,

analyzed: chahi pañcahi vācāhi anāpatti pakāsitā

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ matā

analyzed: ayam eva kriyākriyam idam pana

analyzed: dhamma desanā kathā

analyzed: mahaggatam paṇītam vā ārocentassa bhikkhuno

analyzed: anāpatti tathārūpe kāraṇe sati

analyzed: sabbassa api ca sīla ādim vadataḥ ādikamminaḥ

analyzed: bhūtārocanakam nāma samuṭṭhānam idam matam

translated: If a monk tells,

analyzed: saṅgha ādisesam āpannaḥ mocetvā asucim ayam

analyzed: idha duṭṭhulla āpattiyaḥ matā

analyzed: ajjhācāram a duṭṭhullam ārocetum na vaṭṭati

translated: But when one reports either the action or the offense,

analyzed: mūsi kukkara gokaṇṭa gaṇḍuppāda malesu pi

analyzed: gaṇhissāmi iti saññāya gahetum pana vaṭṭati

translated: If, while taking it, the bricks, etc., fall down, and

analyzed: anāpatti siyā āpatti mattikam yadi gaṇhati

analyzed: a tintaḥ mattikā puñjaḥ antar gehe sace siyā

analyzed: anovaṭṭhaḥ ca bhikkhūnam sabbadā hoti kappiyaḥ

analyzed: temitaḥ vārinā saḥ ce ekābaddhaḥ uva bhūmiyā
translated: If it is shaken by water, and is still connected with the ground,

translated: Then it is still earth, and it is not allowable to dig it up.

translated: If it is an open space, and the rampart is circular, and is made of clay,

analyzed: cātumāsaccaye jātā pathavī iti pavuccati
