analyzed: dukkaṭam kāla saññissa anāpatti pakāsitā  idam eḷaka lomena samuṭṭhāna ādinā samam
translated: It is wrong conduct; if he perceives it as time, non-offence has been stated.🔽This is the same as the origin, etc., of the eating of unallowable food.

analyzed: vikāla bhojana kathā
translated: The Discussion of Eating Out of Time is finished.

original: Bhojanaṃ sannidhiṃ katvā, khādanaṃ vāpi yo pana;
analyzed: bhojanam sannidhim katvā khādanam vā api
translated: If one, having stored up food, or even edible plants,🔽

original: Bhuñjeyya vāpi khādeyya, tassa pācittiyaṃ siyā.🔽Bhikkhu yaṃ sāmaṇerānaṃ, pariccajatyanālayo;
analyzed: bhuñjeyya vā api khādeyya tassa pācittiyam siyā  bhikkhu yam sāmaṇerānam pariccajati an ālayaḥ
translated: If he stores food, or what is to be chewed or sucked, and then eats it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Nidahitvā sace tassa, denti taṃ puna vaṭṭati.
analyzed: nidahitvā sace tassa denti tam puna vaṭṭati
translated: If a monk gives to novice monks, and they do not store it, and then give it back to him, it is allowable for him to receive it again.

analyzed: sayam paṭiggahetvāna a pariccattam eva yam
translated: If he receives it himself, and it has not been given back to him,

original: Dutiye divase tassa, nihitaṃ taṃ na vaṭṭati.🔽Tato ajjhoharantassa, ekasitthampi bhikkhuno;
analyzed: dutiye divase tassa nihitam tam na vaṭṭati  tatas ajjhoharantassa eka sittham pi bhikkhuno
translated: then if he stores it on the following day, it is not allowable for him to eat it.🔽If he eats even just a single grain from that,

analyzed: kathitā suddhā suddha cittena tādinā
translated: then for that monk there is an offense entailing confession, as declared by the one who is pure in conduct.

original: Akappiyesu maṃsesu, manussasseva maṃsake;🔽Thullaccayena pācitti, dukkaṭena sahetare.🔽Yāmakālikasaṅkhātaṃ, pācitti paribhuñjato;
analyzed: akappiyesu maṃsesu manussassa iva maṃsake  thullaccayena pācitti dukkaṭena saha itare  yāma kālika saṅkhātam pācitti paribhuñjataḥ
translated: In the case of the kinds of meat that are not allowable, and in the case of human flesh,🔽there is a serious offense and an offense entailing confession, and in the other cases there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If he eats what is called “to be eaten within seven days”,

analyzed: dukkaṭa āpattiyā saddhim āhāra atthāya bhuñjataḥ
translated: then he commits an offense entailing confession together with an offense entailing acknowledgment, if he eats it for the purpose of nourishment.

original: Sace pavārito hutvā, annaṃ anatirittakaṃ;🔽Bhuñjato pakataṃ tassa, hoti pācittiyadvayaṃ.
analyzed: sace pavāritaḥ hutvā annam anatirittakam  bhuñjataḥ pakatam tassa hoti pācittiya dvayam
translated: If he has refused an invitation to eat more, and then he eats staple food that is not left-over,🔽then he commits two offenses entailing confession.

original: Thullaccayena saddhiṃ dve, maṃse mānusake siyuṃ;
analyzed: thullaccayena saddhim dve maṃse mānusake siyum
translated: In the case of human flesh, there are two offenses entailing a serious offense,

original: Sese akappiye maṃse, dukkaṭena saha dvayaṃ.
analyzed: sese akappiye maṃse dukkaṭena saha dvayam
translated: In the rest of the unsuitable meat, there are two offenses together with wrong conduct.

analyzed: yāma kālika saṅkhātam bhuñjataḥ sati paccaye
translated: When one who is eating what is called “to be eaten within seven days,” when there is a reason,

analyzed: sa āmisena mukhena dve ekam eva nirāmisam
translated: There are two offenses with material, one offense with immaterial.

analyzed: āhāra atthāya kevalam
translated: When one is storing that very thing, only for the purpose of eating,

original: Dvīsu tesu vikappesu, dukkaṭaṃ pana vaḍḍhati.
analyzed: dvīsu tesu vikappesu dukkaṭam pana vaḍḍhati
translated: In the case of those two kinds of storing, the wrong conduct increases.

analyzed: vikāle bhuñjataḥ suddham sannidhi paccayā api ca
translated: When one is eating at the wrong time, pure or because of storing,

analyzed: vikāla bhojanā ca iva hoti pācittiya dvayam
translated: There are two offenses entailing confession: the offense for eating at the wrong time,

analyzed: maṃse thullaccayam ca iva dukkaṭam pi ca vaḍḍhati
translated: And the serious offense and the offense of wrong conduct increase in the case of meat.

analyzed: manussa maṃse sese ca yathā anukkamataḥ dvayam
translated: In the case of the rest of human flesh, there are two offenses in the right order.

analyzed: nattha iva anatirittam pi vikāle paribhuñjato
translated: When one is eating what is not left over, what is not leftover, or what is not stored, at the wrong time,

analyzed: doso sabba vikappesu bhikkhunaḥ tad nimittako
translated: In the case of all kinds of storing, there is an offense for the monk on that account.

analyzed: vikāla paccayā vā api na dosaḥ yāmakālike
translated: There is no offense in the case of what is to be eaten within seven days, or in the case of what is to be eaten within one day,

original: Sattāhakālikaṃ yāva-jīvikaṃ paṭigaṇhato.🔽Āhārasseva atthāya, gahaṇe duvidhassa tu;
analyzed: satta aha kālikam yāvajīvikam paṭigaṇhataḥ  āhārassa iva atthāya gahaṇe duvidhassa tu
translated: When one is receiving what is to be eaten within seven days, or what is to be eaten all one’s life.🔽When one is receiving the two kinds of medicines, only for the purpose of eating,

analyzed: ajjhohāra payogesu dukkaṭam tu nirāmise
translated: In the case of the immaterial, there is wrong conduct in the case of the methods of storing.

analyzed: atha āmisa saṃsaṭṭham gahetvā ṭhapitam sace
translated: But if one receives material and immaterial together, and then stores it,

analyzed: puna ajjhoharantassa pācittā iva pakāsitā
translated: If he eats it again, it’s explained that there’s an offense entailing confession.

original: Kālo yāmo ca sattāhaṃ, iti kālattayaṃ idaṃ;
analyzed: kālaḥ yāmaḥ ca satta aham iti kālattayam idam
translated: The time, the period, and seven days: these are the three times.

original: Atikkamayato doso, kālaṃ taṃ taṃ tu kālikaṃ.
analyzed: atikkamayataḥ dosaḥ kālam tam tam tu kālikam
translated: If he goes beyond that time, there’s an offense. But if it’s the right time, it’s allowable.

analyzed: tīṇi sambhinna rasāni itarāni hi
translated: Three of them are mixed with his own saliva. The others are as they are.

analyzed: sabhāvam upanetā iva yāvakālikam attano
translated: He should eat them according to their original nature and within the right time.

analyzed: evam eva ca sesesu kālikesu viniddise
translated: And in the same way with the other allowable foods.

analyzed: imesu pana sabbesu kālikesu catūsu api
translated: But in the case of all four of these allowable foods,

analyzed: kālika dvayam ādimhi sannidhi
translated: The first two allowable foods and the stored food and the food that has been prepared—

original: Ubhayampi na hoteva, pacchimaṃ kālikadvayaṃ.🔽Akappiyāya kuṭiyā, vutthenantadvayena taṃ;🔽Gahitaṃ tadahe vāpi, dvayaṃ pubbaṃ na vaṭṭati.
analyzed: ubhayam pi na hotā iva pacchimam kālika dvayam  a kappiyāya tam  gahitam tad ahe vā api dvayam pubbam na vaṭṭati
translated: None of these four is allowable. The last two allowable foods🔽Are not allowable in a hut that is not allowable. The first two🔽Are not allowable if he takes them on the same day.

analyzed: mukhasannidhi nāma ayam antovuttham na kappati
translated: The stored food is called “stored near the mouth”. It’s not allowable if it’s been stored overnight.

original: Iti vuttaṃ daḷhaṃ katvā, mahāpaccariyaṃ pana.
analyzed: iti vuttam daḷham katvā mahā paccariyam pana
translated: This is what is said in the Great Analysis.

analyzed: na dosaḥ nidahitvā api paṭhamam
translated: There’s no offense if he stores the first three allowable foods,

original: Taṃ taṃ sakaṃ sakaṃ kāla-manatikkamma bhuñjato.
analyzed: tam tam sakam sakam kālam an atikkamma bhuñjataḥ
translated: And then eats them after the right time of the particular food has passed.

analyzed: tathā ummattaka ādīnam anāpatti pakāsitā
translated: And it’s been explained that there’s no offense for one who is insane, etc.

analyzed: samam eḷaka lomena samuṭṭhāna ādinā idam
translated: With the same kind of sugar, and with the same kind of molasses, and with the same kind of honey, and with the same kind of oil, and with the same kind of syrup, and with the same kind of fresh butter, and with the same kind of curd, and with the same kind of milk, and with the same kind of rice, and with the same kind of porridge, and with the same kind of meat, and with the same kind of fish, and with the same kind of cake, and with the same kind of pastries, and with the same kind of solid food, and with the same kind of soft food, and with the same kind of fresh food, and with the same kind of cooked food, and with the same kind of fresh food and cooked food, and with the same kind of fruit, and with the same kind of storing.

analyzed: sannidhi kāra kathā  bhojanāni paṇītāni a gilānaḥ panattanaḥ
translated: The discussion of storing.

analyzed: atthāya viññāpetvāna pācitti paribhuñjataḥ
translated: Fine foods, not being sick, oneself, for the sake of, having asked, and eating: the offense entailing confession for one who eats.

original: “Sappinā dehi bhattaṃ me, sasappiṃ sappimissakaṃ;🔽Sappibhattañca dehī”ti, viññāpentassa dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: sappinā dehi bhattam me sa sappim sappi missakam  sappi bhattañca dehi iti viññāpentassa dukkaṭam
translated: “Give me ghee. Give me rice with ghee. Give me rice mixed with ghee. Give me rice and ghee.” The offense of wrong conduct for one who asks in this way.

original: Viññāpetvā tathā taṃ ce, dukkaṭaṃ paṭigaṇhato;
analyzed: viññāpetvā tathā tam ce dukkaṭam paṭigaṇhato
translated: If he asks in this way and then accepts it, there is the offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: puna ajjhoharantassa pācitti pariyāputā
translated: If he eats it again, the offense entailing confession is completed.

analyzed: suddhāni sappi ādīni viññāpetvāna bhuñjataḥ
translated: If he eats fine ghee, etc., after asking for it,

analyzed: viññatti dukkaṭam paridīpaye
translated: and if he asks for the training rules, the offense of wrong conduct is announced.

analyzed: tasmai paṇīta saṃsaṭṭham viññāpetvā ava bhuñjataḥ
translated: Therefore, if he eats after asking for fine food mixed with any of the above,

analyzed: satta dhañña mayam bhattam pācittiyam udīraye
translated: the offense entailing confession should be declared for rice porridge made with seven kinds of grain.

analyzed: sace gosappinā mayham dehi yācitaḥ
translated: If he is asked, “Give me rice with cow’s ghee,”

analyzed: ajiyā sappi ādīhi visaṅketam dadāti ce
translated: and he gives it without specifying, with goat’s ghee, etc.,

analyzed: sappinā dehi vuttaḥ ce navanīta ādikesu pi
translated: if he is asked, “Give me ghee,” and he gives any of the following: fresh butter, etc.,

analyzed: deti aññatarena assa visaṅketam ti dīpitam
translated: it is said that he gives without specifying.

original: Yena yena hi viññattaṃ, tasmiṃ mūlepi tassa vā;🔽Laddhepi pana taṃ laddhaṃ, hotiyeva na aññathā.
analyzed: yena yena hi viññattam tasmim mūle pi tassa vā  laddhe ipi pana tat laddham hotiyā iva na aññathā
translated: If something is requested, even if it is obtained at the root of a tree,🔽it is obtained, and it is not otherwise.

analyzed: ṭhapetvā sappi ādīni āgatāni hi pāḷiyam
translated: Except for ghee and so on, which are mentioned in the text,

original: Aññehi viññāpentassa, hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ.🔽Sabbehi sappiādīhi, viññāpetvāva ekato;
analyzed: aññehi viññāpentassa hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ  sabbehi sappi ādīhi viññāpetvā ava ekatas
translated: if one requests other things, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽Having requested all the ghee and so on together,

analyzed: bhuñjatā eka rasam katvā nava pācittiyaḥ matā
translated: if one eats it after making it into a single flavor, nine offenses entailing confession are considered.

original: Akappiyena vuttepi, sappinā deti tena ce;
analyzed: akappiyena vutte pi sappinā deti tena ce
translated: If one says, “I’ll give you ghee,” but gives oil instead,

analyzed: gahaṇe paribhoge pi dukkaṭam paridīpitam
translated: then in receiving it and in eating it, there is said to be an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: gilānassa gilānaḥ ti saññinaḥ vimatissa vā
translated: If one is sick, if one perceives oneself as sick, or if one is unsure of it,

original: Dukkaṭaṃ muninā vuttaṃ, anāpatti pakāsitā.🔽Gilānakāle viññatta-magilānassa bhuñjato;
analyzed: dukkaṭam muninā vuttam anāpatti pakāsitā  gilāna kāle viññattam agilānassa bhuñjataḥ
translated: the Awakened One said there is an offense of wrong conduct. He declared that there is no offense in the following cases:🔽if one has requested it when sick; if one eats what remains of what was requested when sick;

analyzed: gilānassa avasesam vā ñātaka ādīnam eva vā
translated: if it is given by relatives, etc.;

analyzed: idam catu samuṭṭhānam kāyataḥ kāya vācato
translated: This training rule has four origins: it originates in body, in speech and body,

analyzed: tathā ca
translated: in body and mind, and in speech, body, and mind.

analyzed: paṇīta bhojana kathā
translated: The discussion of fine foods is finished.

analyzed: mukha dvāram āhāram āhareyya yaḥ
translated: If one eats food that has not been given,

original: Dantaponodakaṃ hitvā, tassa pācittiyaṃ siyā.🔽Hatthapāsobhinīhāro, majjhimuccāraṇakkhamo;
analyzed: danta ponodakam hitvā tassa pācittiyam siyā  hattha pāsa abhinīhāraḥ majjhima uccāraṇa khamo
translated: If he throws out the water used for rinsing the teeth, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Manusso vāmanusso vā, deti kāyādinā tidhā.
analyzed: manussaḥ vā amanussaḥ vā deti kāya ādinā tidhā
translated: The arm’s reach, the shout, the middle, the recitation, the human, the dwarf, giving by body, speech, or gesture, in three ways.

original: Paṭiggaṇhāti taṃ bhikkhu, dīyamānaṃ sace dvidhā;
analyzed: paṭiggaṇhāti tam bhikkhu dīyamānam sace dvidhā
translated: If a monk receives what is being given in two ways,

original: Evaṃ pañcaṅgasaṃyoge, gahaṇaṃ tassa rūhati.🔽Dāyako gaganaṭṭho ce, bhūmaṭṭho cetaro siyā;
analyzed: evam pañcaṅga saṃyoge tassa rūhati  dāyakaḥ gagana aṭṭho ce bhūma aṭṭho ca itaro siyā
translated: then the taking increases with the combination of five factors.🔽If the giver is in the sky and the other is on the ground,

analyzed: bhūma ṭṭhassa ca sīsena gagana ṭṭhassa dehino
translated: or if the giver is on the ground and the other is in the sky,

original: Yamāsannataraṃ aṅgaṃ, orimantena tassa tu;🔽Dātuṃ vāpi gahetuṃ vā, vinā hatthaṃ pasāritaṃ.
analyzed: aṅgam tassa tu  dātum vā api vā vinā hattham pasāritam
translated: then the part that is closest to the one on the ground🔽is for the one on the ground to give or receive, except if the arm is extended.

analyzed: hattha pāsaḥ minetabbaḥ naga ṭṭha ādīsu ayam nayaḥ
translated: The arm’s reach is to be measured from the tree, etc.

original: Evarūpe pana ṭhāne, ṭhatvā ce deti vaṭṭati.🔽Pakkhī vā mukhatuṇḍena, hatthī soṇḍāya vā pana;
analyzed: evarūpe pana ṭhāne ce deti vaṭṭati  pakkhī vā mukha tuṇḍena hatthī soṇḍāya vā pana
translated: But if he stands in such a place, it is allowable for him to receive.🔽If a bird gives a flower or fruit with its beak or if an elephant gives with its trunk,

original: Sace yaṃ kiñci pupphaṃ vā, phalaṃ vā deti vaṭṭati.
analyzed: sace yam kiñci puppham vā phalam vā deti vaṭṭati
translated: it is allowable.

analyzed: bhatta byañjana puṇṇāni bhājanāni
translated: Many vessels full of cooked food and curry,🔽if he carries them on his head and then goes to someone else,

analyzed: sīsena ādāya bhikkhussa gantvā kassaci santikam
translated: and if that other person gives to the monk,🔽it is allowable for him to receive.

analyzed: īsakam pana onatvā gaṇhāti yadi bhāsati
translated: If he says, “Take it,” bending down the bowl,

original: Tena hatthaṃ pasāretvā, heṭṭhimaṃ pana bhājanaṃ.
analyzed: tena hattham pasāretvā heṭṭhimam pana bhājanam
translated: Then, having extended his hand, he should receive the lower vessel.

original: Paṭicchitabbaṃ taṃ eka- desenāpi ca bhikkhunā;🔽Honti ettāvatā tāni, gahitāneva sabbaso.
analyzed: paṭicchitabbam tam eka desena api ca bhikkhunā  honti ettāvatā tāni gahitāni iva sabbaso
translated: It should be received by the monk with even one edge;🔽To that extent all of them are completely received.

original: Tato paṭṭhāya taṃ sabbaṃ, oropetvā yathāsukhaṃ;
analyzed: tatas paṭṭhāya tam sabbam oropetvā yathāsukham
translated: From then on, having taken down all of it, as he likes,

original: Ugghāṭetvā tato iṭṭhaṃ, gahetuṃ pana vaṭṭati.
analyzed: ugghāṭetvā tatas iṭṭham gahetum pana vaṭṭati
translated: Having uncovered it, it is allowable for him to take what he wants.

analyzed: pacchi ādimhi vattabbam atthi kim eka bhājane
translated: What is to be said about the back, etc.? Is there (anything) in a single bowl?

original: Kājabhattaṃ haranto ce, onatvā deti vaṭṭati.
analyzed: harantaḥ ce onatvā deti vaṭṭati
translated: If he is carrying a tray of food, it is allowable if he gives it, bending down.

original: Tiṃsahattho siyā veḷu, antesu ca duve ghaṭā;
analyzed: tiṃsahatthaḥ siyā antesu ca duve
translated: The bamboo may be thirty handspans long, and there are two pots at the ends,

analyzed: sappinaḥ gahita ekasmin sabbam gahitam eva tam
translated: If one of them is received, all of it is received.

original: Bahupattā ca mañce vā, pīṭhe vā kaṭasārake;
analyzed: bahu pattā ca mañce vā pīṭhe vā kaṭasārake
translated: If many leaves are placed on a bed, or on a chair, or on a stool,

original: Ṭhapitā dāyako hattha-pāse ṭhatvāna deti ce.🔽Paṭiggahaṇasaññāya, mañcādīni sace pana;🔽Nisīdati phusitvā yo, yañca pattesu dīyati.
analyzed: ṭhapitā dāyakaḥ hattha pāse deti ce  paṭiggahaṇa saññāya mañca ādīni sace pana  nisīdati phusitvā yaḥ yat ca pattesu dīyati
translated: If the giver stands within hand’s reach and gives,🔽If, thinking ‘I will receive’, he sits down, touching the bed, etc.,

original: Gahitaṃ tena taṃ sabbaṃ, hotiyeva na saṃsayo;
analyzed: gahitam tena tam sabbam na saṃsayo
translated: And if it is given on the leaves, all of that is received by him, there is no doubt.

analyzed: paṭiggahessāmi icca iva mañca ādīni sace pana
translated: If he thinks, “I’ll receive,” then the bed, etc.,

original: Gahitaṃ hoti taṃ sabbaṃ, āruhitvā nisīdati;
analyzed: gahitam hoti tam sabbam āruhitvā nisīdati
translated: are all taken. He sits down on it,

original: Āhacca kucchiyā kucchiṃ, ṭhitā pattā hi bhūmiyaṃ.
analyzed: āhat ca kucchiyā kucchim ṭhitā pattā hi bhūmiyam
translated: standing with his belly against his belly.

original: Yaṃ yaṃ aṅguliyā vāpi, phusitvā sūciyāpi vā;
analyzed: yaṃ yaṃ aṅguliyā vā api phusitvā sūciyā api vā
translated: If he touches it with a finger or a needle,

original: Nisinno tattha tattheva, dīyamānaṃ tu vaṭṭati.
analyzed: nisinnaḥ tattha tattha iva dīyamānam tu vaṭṭati
translated: then he may receive it right there, wherever he is sitting.

original: Kaṭasāre mahantasmiṃ, tathā hatthattharādisu;🔽Gaṇhato hatthapāsasmiṃ, vijjamāne tu vaṭṭati.
analyzed: kaṭa sāre mahantasmin tathā hatthatthara ādisu  gaṇhataḥ hattha pāsasmim vijjamāne tu vaṭṭati
translated: If it’s a large basket, or a handspan, etc.,🔽then it’s allowable to receive it in the hand, if it’s available.

analyzed: tattha jātaka paṇṇesu gahetum na ca vaṭṭati
translated: But it’s not allowable to receive it on leaves that grow on the spot,

original: Na panetāni kāyena, paṭibaddhāni honti hi.
analyzed: na pana itāni kāyena paṭibaddhāni honti hi
translated: because they’re not connected to the body.🔽On a rock that can’t be carried off,

analyzed: asaṃhārim apāsāṇe phalake vā api tādise
translated: or on a board or the like,🔽or on a bed tied to a post,

original: Khāṇubaddhepi vā mañce, gahaṇaṃ neva rūhati.
analyzed: khāṇu baddhe pi vā mañce na iva rūhati
translated: the receiving is not valid.🔽On leaves of tintiṇī grass, etc.,

analyzed: tintiṇika ādi paṇṇesu bhūmiyam patthaṭesu vā
translated: or on the ground, if they’re spread out,

analyzed: na ca rūhati
translated: the receiving is not valid, because they’re unable to hold it.🔽If he gives with a long stick

analyzed: hattha pāsam atikkamma dīgha daṇḍena deti ce
translated: beyond the reach of the hand,🔽the server should be told by the monk who has approached,

analyzed: vattabbaḥ bhikkhunā āgantvā dehi iti parivesakaḥ
translated: “Give it.”

original: Sace patte rajo hoti, dhovitabbo jale sati;
analyzed: sace patte rajaḥ hoti dhovitabbaḥ jale sati
translated: If there’s dust in the bowl, it should be washed if there’s water.

original: Tasmiṃ asati puñchitvā, gahetabbo asesato.🔽Piṇḍāya vicarantassa, rajaṃ patati ce pana;
analyzed: tasmin asati puñchitvā gahetabbaḥ asesataḥ  piṇḍāya vicarantassa rajam patati ce pana
translated: If there isn’t, it should be rubbed with sand and then held.🔽If dust falls on a monk while he’s walking for alms,

original: Bhikkhā paṭiggahetvāva, gahetabbā vijānatā.🔽Appaṭiggahite bhikkhuṃ, gaṇhato pana dukkaṭaṃ;
analyzed: bhikkhā paṭiggahetvā ava gahetabbā vijānatā  a paṭiggahite bhikkhum gaṇhataḥ pana dukkaṭam
translated: he should receive the alms and then hold the bowl.🔽If he receives the alms without holding the bowl, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: paṭiggahetvā anāpatti pacchā tam paribhuñjataḥ
translated: There’s no offense if he receives the alms and then holds it afterwards.

analyzed: paṭiggahetvā detha iti vutte tam vacanam pana
translated: If someone says, “Give it after receiving it,”

original: Asutvānādiyitvā vā, denti ce natthi dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: a sutvā an ādiyitvā vā denti ce natthi dukkaṭam
translated: and if he doesn’t hear or understand, there’s no offense in giving it.🔽He should receive the alms and then hold the bowl.

original: Pacchā paṭiggahetvāva, gahetabbaṃ vijānatā;🔽Sace rajaṃ nipāteti, mahāvāto tato tato.
analyzed: pacchā paṭiggahetvā ava gahetabbam vijānatā  sace rajam nipāta iti mahā vātaḥ tatas tatas
translated: If dust falls on the almsfood

original: Na sakkā ca siyā bhikkhaṃ, gahetuṃ yadi bhikkhunā;
analyzed: na sakkā ca siyā bhikkham gahetum yadi bhikkhunā
translated: and it’s not possible for the monk to receive the alms,

analyzed: aññassa dātu kāmena gahetum pana vaṭṭati
translated: but he wants to give it to someone else, he may receive it.

original: Sāmaṇerassa taṃ datvā, dinnaṃ vā tena taṃ puna;
analyzed: sāmaṇerassa tam da tvā dinnam vā tena tam puna
translated: If he gives it to a novice monk, or if the novice monk gives it to him,

original: Tassa vissāsato vāpi, bhuñjituṃ pana vaṭṭati.
analyzed: tassa vissāsataḥ vā api bhuñjitum pana vaṭṭati
translated: or if he has confidence in the novice monk, he may eat it.

original: Bhikkhācāre sace bhattaṃ, sarajaṃ deti bhikkhuno;
analyzed: bhikkhācāre sace bhattam sarajam deti bhikkhuno
translated: If someone gives rice stored in a container to a monk who is walking for alms,

original: “Paṭiggahetvā bhikkhaṃ tvaṃ, gaṇha vā bhuñja vā”ti ca.
analyzed: paṭiggahetvā bhikkham tvam gaṇha vā bhuñja vā ati ca
translated: “Having accepted the alms, you may take it or eat it.”

original: Vattabbo so tathā tena, kattabbañceva bhikkhunā;
analyzed: vattabbaḥ saḥ tathā tena kattabbam ca iva bhikkhunā
translated: He should be told by him in this way, and the monk should do it.

original: Rajaṃ upari bhattassa, tassuplavati ce pana.
analyzed: rajam upari bhattassa ce pana
translated: If the rice falls on top of the food,

analyzed: kañjikam tu pavāhetvā bhuñjitabbam yathāsukham
translated: he should sprinkle it with sour liquid and eat it as he likes.

original: Anto paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paviṭṭhaṃ tu sace pana.🔽Patitaṃ sukkhabhatte ce, apanīyāva taṃ rajaṃ;
analyzed: antar paṭiggahetabbam paviṭṭham tu sace pana  patitam sukkha bhatte ce apanīya ava tam rajam
translated: If it falls inside the bowl,🔽if the rice falls on dry food, he should remove the rice.

original: Sukhumaṃ ce sabhattampi, bhuñjitabbaṃ yathāsukhaṃ.🔽Uḷuṅkenāharitvāpi, dentassa paṭhamaṃ pana;
analyzed: sukhumam ce sabhattam pi bhuñjitabbam yathāsukham  uḷuṅkena āharitvā api paṭhamam pana
translated: If it’s a little, he may eat the food together with the rice.🔽If he’s given it after picking it up with his nails,

original: Thevo uḷuṅkato patte, sace patati vaṭṭati.🔽Bhatte ākiramāne tu, carukena tato pana;
analyzed: thevaḥ uḷuṅkataḥ patte sace patati vaṭṭati  bhatte ākiramāne tu carukena tatas pana
translated: if it falls from the nails into the bowl, it’s allowable.🔽If rice is scattered while he’s eating,

original: Masi vā chārikā vāpi, sace patati bhājane.
analyzed: masi vā chārikā vā api sace patati bhājane
translated: if it falls into the dish with the porridge or the ashes,🔽and if it’s sprinkled on the food,

analyzed: tassa ca abhihaṭa ttā api na doso upalabbhati
translated: there’s no offense.

analyzed: anantarassa bhikkhussa dīyamānam tu pattataḥ
translated: If it’s given from the bowl of the monk next to him,🔽if it falls into his bowl after being sprinkled,

original: Uppabhitvā sace patte, itarassa ca bhikkhuno;
analyzed: uppabhitvā sace patte itarassa ca bhikkhuno
translated: and if it falls into the bowl of the other monk,

analyzed: patati vaṭṭatā iva ayam paṭiggahitam eva tam
translated: it’s allowable, for it’s already accepted.

original: Pāyāsassa ca pūretvā, pattaṃ ce denti bhikkhuno;
analyzed: pāyāsassa ca pūretvā pattam ce denti bhikkhuno
translated: If they fill a bowl with rice-gruel And give it to a monk,

original: Uṇhattā pana taṃ heṭṭhā, gahetuṃ na ca sakkati.
analyzed: uṇha ttā pana tam heṭṭhā gahetum na ca sakkati
translated: Because of its heat he’s unable To take hold of it from below.

analyzed: vaṭṭati iti ca niddiṭṭham gahetum mukhavaṭṭiyam
translated: If it’s said, “It’s allowable,” he should take hold of it at the rim;

original: Na sakkā ce gahetabbo, tathā ādhārakenapi.
analyzed: na sakkā ce gahetabbaḥ tathā ādhārakena api
translated: If he’s unable to do that, he should do the same with a support.

original: Sace āsanasālāyaṃ, gahetvā pattamattano;🔽Niddāyati nisinnova, dīyamānaṃ na jānati.
analyzed: sace āsana sālāyam gahetvā  niddāyati nisinnā uva dīyamānam na jānati
translated: If, in the meal hall, he takes hold of his own bowl,🔽And falls asleep while sitting, and doesn’t know when it’s given,

analyzed: na iva āhariyamānam vai a paṭiggahitam eva tam
translated: Or when it’s being taken away, it’s not received.

original: Ābhogaṃ pana katvā ce, nisinno hoti vaṭṭati.
analyzed: ābhogam pana katvā ce nisinnaḥ hoti vaṭṭati
translated: But if he’s lying down and he makes an effort, it’s allowable.

original: Sace hatthena muñcitvā, pattaṃ ādhārakampi vā;🔽Pelletvā pana pādena, niddāyati hi vaṭṭati.🔽Pādenādhārakaṃ akka-mitvāpi paṭigaṇhato;
analyzed: sace hatthena muñcitvā pattam ādhārakam pi vā  pelletvā pana pādena niddāyati hi vaṭṭati  pādena ādhārakam akkamitvā api paṭigaṇhataḥ
translated: If he lets go of his hand, or the bowl or the support,🔽And falls asleep while lying down, it’s allowable.🔽If he falls asleep while sitting, having placed the support on the floor,

analyzed: jāgarassa api hotā iva gahaṇasmin anādaraḥ
translated: And receives it with his foot, he still shows disrespect in receiving it.

original: Tasmā taṃ na ca kātabbaṃ, bhikkhunā vinayaññunā;
analyzed: tasmā tam na ca kātabbam bhikkhunā vinayaññunā
translated: So that should not be done by a monk who respects the rule.

original: Yaṃ dīyamānaṃ patati, gahetuṃ taṃ tu vaṭṭati.
analyzed: yam dīyamānam patati gahetum tam tu vaṭṭati
translated: But if it falls while being given, it’s allowable to receive it.

original: Bhuñjantānañca dantā vā, khīyantipi nakhāpi vā;
analyzed: dantāḥ vā vā
translated: If, while eating, his teeth or nails break,

original: Tathā pattassa vaṇṇo vā, abbohāranayo ayaṃ.
analyzed: tathā pattassa vaṇṇaḥ vā ayam
translated: And so with a bowl: this is the method for the non-offence.

analyzed: satthakena ucchu ādīni sace malam
translated: If, when the teacher, etc., are scraping, a stain is seen,

original: Paññāyati hi taṃ tesu, siyā navasamuṭṭhitaṃ.
analyzed: paññāyati hi tam tesu siyā nava samuṭṭhitam
translated: It is indeed arisen from the new one;

original: Paṭiggahetvā taṃ pacchā, khāditabbaṃ tu bhikkhunā;
analyzed: paṭiggahetvā tam pacchā khāditabbam tu bhikkhunā
translated: The monk should eat it after having accepted it.

original: Na paññāyati ce tasmiṃ, malaṃ vaṭṭati khādituṃ.🔽Pisantānampi bhesajjaṃ, koṭṭentānampi vā tathā;
analyzed: na paññāyati ce tasmin malam vaṭṭati khāditum  pisantānam pi bhesajjam koṭṭentānam pi vā tathā
translated: If no stain is seen, it is allowable to eat it.🔽So too with medicine being rubbed, or being scraped,

analyzed: nisada udukkhala ādīnam khīyane pi ayam nayaḥ
translated: And with the bed, the bench, etc., being repaired.

original: Bhesajjatthāya tāpetvā, vāsiṃ khīre khipanti ce;
analyzed: bhesajjatthāya tāpetvā vā asim khīre khipanti ce
translated: If, after heating a razor for the purpose of medicine,

original: Uṭṭheti nīlikā tattha, satthake viya nicchayo.
analyzed: uṭṭheti nīlikā tattha satthake viya nicchayaḥ
translated: They put it in milk, a stain arises there, just as on a knife.

original: Sace āmakatakke vā, khīre vā pakkhipanti taṃ;
analyzed: sace āmaka takke vā khīre vā pakkhipanti tam
translated: If they put it in unripe mangoes or in milk,

original: Sāmapākanimittamhā, na tu muccati dukkaṭā.🔽Piṇḍāya vicarantassa, vassakālesu bhikkhuno;
analyzed: na tu muccati dukkaṭā  piṇḍāya vicarantassa vassa kālesu bhikkhuno
translated: It is not released from the offence of wrong-doing because of the sign of the cooking.🔽If a drop of water falls into a monk’s bowl

original: Patte patati ce toyaṃ, kiliṭṭhaṃ kāyavatthato.
analyzed: patte patati ce toyam kiliṭṭham kāya vatthato
translated: While he is walking for alms in the rainy season, from his dirty body or robe,

analyzed: pacchā paṭiggahetvā tam bhuñjitabbam yathāsukham
translated: He should eat it after having accepted it;

original: Eseva ca nayo vutto, rukkhamūlepi bhuñjato.
analyzed: esa iva ca nayaḥ vuttaḥ rukkha mūle pi bhuñjataḥ
translated: This is the method stated for one who eats at the foot of a tree too.

original: Sattāhaṃ pana vassante, deve suddhaṃ jalaṃ sace;
analyzed: satta aham pana vassante deve suddham jalam sace
translated: But if it rains for seven days, and the water is pure,

original: Abbhokāsepi vā patte, toyaṃ patati vaṭṭati.
analyzed: vā patte toyam patati vaṭṭati
translated: Then it is allowable to collect the water that falls on the bare ground in a leaf.

original: Odanaṃ pana dentena, sāmaṇerassa bhikkhunā;🔽Dātabbo acchupantena, tassa pattagatodanaṃ.🔽Paṭiggahetvā vā pattaṃ, dātabbo tassa odano;
analyzed: odanam pana dentena sāmaṇerassa bhikkhunā  dātabbaḥ acchupantena tassa patta gata udanam  paṭiggahetvā vā pattam dātabbaḥ tassa odanaḥ
translated: But when a monk novice is given boiled rice,🔽The monk should give him his own rice in his bowl.🔽Or he should give him his bowl after taking the rice out of it;

original: Chupitvā deti ce bhattaṃ, taṃ panuggahitaṃ siyā.
analyzed: chupitvā deti ce bhattam tam panuggahitam siyā
translated: If he gives the rice after having eaten it, it is allowable.

analyzed: aññassa dātu kāmena pariccattam sace pana
translated: If he wants to give to another, but the other one

analyzed: yāva hattha gatam tāva paṭiggahitam eva tam
translated: Has already taken the rice in his hand, it is already received.🔽If he says, “Take it,” without paying attention,

analyzed: gaṇhāti nirapekkhaḥ uva pattam ādhārake ṭhitam
translated: And the rice is placed on the edge of the bowl,

original: Sace vadati pacchā taṃ, paṭiggaṇheyya paṇḍito.
analyzed: sace vadati pacchā tam paṭiggaṇheyya paṇḍitaḥ
translated: If he says, “After,” the wise one should receive it.

analyzed: sa apekkhaḥ yeva yaḥ pattam ṭhapetvā ādhārake pana
translated: But if he places the bowl on the edge of the platform,

original: “Etto pūvampi bhattaṃ vā, kiñci gaṇhā”ti bhāsati.
analyzed: ettas pūvam pi bhattam vā kiñci gaṇhāti bhāsati
translated: And says, “Take it from there,” or “Take the rice,”

original: Sāmaṇeropi taṃ bhattaṃ, dhovitvā hatthamattano;🔽Attapattagataṃ bhattaṃ, aphusitvā sace pana.
analyzed: sāmaṇeraḥ api tam bhattam dhovitvā  atta patta gatam bhattam a phusitvā sace pana
translated: The novice monk should wash his hands,🔽And if he does not touch the rice in his own bowl,

analyzed: pakkhipantaḥ sa takkhattum uddharitvā api gaṇhatu
translated: He may take it, even if he has to take it out a hundred times,

original: Taṃpaṭiggahaṇe kiccaṃ, puna tassa na vijjati.
analyzed: tad paṭiggahaṇe kiccam puna tassa na vijjati
translated: There’s no need to receive it again.

analyzed: atta patta gatam bhattam phusitvā yadi gaṇhati
translated: If he touches the food that’s been put in his bowl,

analyzed: pacchā paṭiggahetabbam saṃsaṭṭha ttā parena tam
translated: He should receive it again, because it’s then mixed with the other.

original: Bhikkhūnaṃ yāguādīnaṃ, pacane bhājane pana;🔽Pakkhipitvā ṭhapentena, aññassatthāya odanaṃ.
analyzed: bhikkhūnam yāgu ādīnam pacane bhājane pana  pakkhipitvā ṭhapentena aññassa atthāya odanaṃ
translated: If he cooks rice for the monks, porridge, etc.,🔽And puts it in a pot for the sake of another,

analyzed: bhājana upari hatthesu sāmaṇerassa pakkhipe
translated: And if he puts it in the hands of a novice,

original: Patitaṃ hatthato tasmiṃ, na karoti akappiyaṃ.🔽Pariccattañhi taṃ evaṃ, akatvākirateva ce;
analyzed: patitam hatthataḥ tasmin na karoti a kappiyam  pariccattam hi tam evam a katvā akirata iva ce
translated: It’s not allowable to eat what falls from his hands.🔽If it’s given up in this way,🔽But he doesn’t do anything to it,

original: Bhuñjitabbaṃ tu taṃ katvā, pattaṃ viya nirāmisaṃ.
analyzed: bhuñjitabbam tu tam katvā pattam viya nirāmisam
translated: He should eat it after doing something to it,🔽Like a bowl, without any personal interest.🔽If the pot of porridge is full

original: Sace yāgukuṭaṃ puṇṇaṃ, sāmaṇero hi dubbalo;
analyzed: sace yāgu kuṭam puṇṇam sāmaṇeraḥ hi dubbalaḥ
translated: And the novice is weak,

original: Bhikkhuṃ paṭiggahāpetuṃ, na sakkoti hi taṃ puna.
analyzed: bhikkhum paṭiggahāpetum na sakkoti hi tam puna
translated: He may not be able to have the monk receive it again.🔽The monk should put the pot on his neck

analyzed: kuṭassa gīvam pattassa ṭhapetvā mukha vaṭṭiyam
translated: And then put his mouth to the pot’s opening.

analyzed: bhikkhunā upanītassa āvajjeti hi vaṭṭati
translated: If he receives it in this way, it’s allowable.

original: Atha vā bhūmiyaṃyeva, hatthe bhikkhu ṭhapeti ce;
analyzed: atha vā bhūmiyaṃyeva hatthe bhikkhu ṭhapeti ce
translated: Or else, if the monk puts his hand on the ground🔽And the novice lifts it up and turns it over,

original: Āropeti pavaṭṭetvā, tattha ce pana vaṭṭati.
analyzed: āropeti pavaṭṭetvā tattha ce pana vaṭṭati
translated: It’s allowable if it’s in that place.

analyzed: ayam eva vinicchayaḥ
translated: This is the decision on the carrying of food and the carrying of a bowl.

original: Dve tayo sāmaṇerā vā, denti ce gahaṇūpagaṃ.
analyzed: dve tayo sāmaṇerāḥ vā denti ce gahaṇu upagam
translated: Two or three novice monks may carry it if they are able to carry it.

analyzed: bhāram ekassa bhikkhussa gahetum pana vaṭṭati
translated: But it is allowed for one monk to carry the load.

original: Ekena vā tathā dinnaṃ, gaṇhanti dve tayopi vā.
analyzed: ekena vā tathā dinnam gaṇhanti dve vā
translated: If it is given to one, two or three may carry it.

analyzed: mañcassa pāde pīṭhassa pāde tela ghaṭa ādikam
translated: If oil-pots and so on are hung on the legs of a bed or on the legs of a chair,

analyzed: laggenti tattha bhikkhussa vaṭṭatā iva nisīditum
translated: it is allowed for a monk to sit there.

analyzed: a paṭiggahitam heṭṭhāmañce ce tela thālakam
translated: If an oil-jar is on the ground under a bed,

original: Sammujjanto ca ghaṭṭeti, na panuggahitaṃ siyā.🔽Paṭiggahitasaññāya, appaṭiggahitaṃ pana;
analyzed: sammujjantaḥ ca ghaṭṭeti na panuggahitam siyā  paṭiggahita saññāya a paṭiggahitam pana
translated: and it is struck by someone getting up, it is not considered to be received.🔽But if he thinks it is received,

original: Gaṇhitvā puna taṃ ñatvā, ṭhapetuṃ tattha vaṭṭati.
analyzed: gaṇhitvā puna tam ñatvā ṭhapetum tattha vaṭṭati
translated: and then, realizing it is not, he puts it back there, that is allowed.

original: Vivaritvā sace pubbe, ṭhapitaṃ pihitampi ca;🔽Tatheva taṃ ṭhapetabbaṃ, kattabbaṃ na panaññathā.🔽Bahi ṭhapeti ce tena, chupitabbaṃ na taṃ puna;
analyzed: vivaritvā sace pubbe ṭhapitam pihitam pi ca  tathā iva tam ṭhapetabbam kattabbam na pana aññathā  bahi ṭhapeti ce tena chupitabbam na tam puna
translated: If he opens it and then closes it again,🔽he should put it back as it was, and not do anything else.🔽If he puts it outside, he should not take it again.

original: Yadi chupati ce ñatvā, taṃ panuggahitaṃ siyā.
analyzed: yadi chupati ce ñatvā tam siyā
translated: But if he takes it, knowing it, it is considered to be received.

analyzed: paṭiggahita telasmiṃ uṭṭheti yadi kaṇṇakā
translated: If a mosquito comes out of oil that has been received,

analyzed: siṅgīverādike mūle ghana cuṇṇam pi vā tathā
translated: And at the root of the ginger lily, etc., or likewise pounded bark,

analyzed: tad samuṭṭhānato sabbam tat na eva ati pavuccati
translated: All that is called “from that source” because it originates from that.

original: Paṭiggahaṇakiccaṃ tu, tasmiṃ puna na vijjati.
analyzed: paṭiggahaṇa kiccam tu tasmin puna na vijjati
translated: But the function of receiving is not found in it again.

original: Tālaṃ vā nāḷikeraṃ vā, āruḷho koci puggalo;
analyzed: tālam vā nāḷikeram vā āruḷhaḥ koci puggalo
translated: If a man has climbed a palm tree or a coconut tree,

analyzed: tatraṭṭhaḥ tāla piṇḍim saḥ otāretvāna rajjuyā
translated: And he lets fall a fruit from the tree with a rope,

analyzed: sace vadati gaṇhāti na gahetabbam eva ca
translated: If he says, “Pick it up,” it must not be picked up;

original: Tamañño pana bhūmaṭṭho, gahetvā deti vaṭṭati.
analyzed: tamaññaḥ pana bhūmaṭṭhaḥ gahetvā deti vaṭṭati
translated: But if another man standing on the ground picks it up and gives it, it is allowable.

original: Chinditvā ce vatiṃ ucchuṃ, phalaṃ vā deti gaṇhituṃ;
analyzed: chinditvā ce vatim ucchum phalam vā deti gaṇhitum
translated: If he cuts the stalk and gives the sugar-cane, or if he gives the fruit, it is allowable to pick it up;

analyzed: daṇḍake a phusitvā ava niggatam pana vaṭṭati
translated: But if he does not touch the stalk, what falls off is allowable.

original: Sace na puthulo hoti, pākāro atiuccako;🔽Antoṭṭhitabahiṭṭhānaṃ, hatthapāso pahoti ce.
analyzed: sace na puthulaḥ hoti pākāraḥ atiuccako  antar ṭṭhita bahi ṭṭhānam hattha pāso pahoti ce
translated: If the wall is not high, but the rampart is very high,🔽And if the hand can be stretched in from inside to where it is,

original: Uddhaṃ hatthasataṃ gantvā, sampattaṃ puna taṃ pana;
analyzed: uddham hattha satam gantvā sampattam puna tam pana
translated: And if it reaches up to a height of a hundred hands, and if it comes down again,

analyzed: gaṇhataḥ bhikkhuno doso koci na iva upalabbhati
translated: There is no offence for the monk who picks it up.

original: Bhikkhuno sāmaṇeraṃ tu, khandhena vahato sace;
analyzed: bhikkhuno sāmaṇeram tu khandhena vahato sace
translated: If a novice monk carries a monk on his shoulder,

original: Phalaṃ gahetvā tattheva, nisinno deti vaṭṭati.
analyzed: phalam gahetvā tattha iva nisinnaḥ deti vaṭṭati
translated: And if he picks up the fruit and gives it there and then while sitting, it is allowable.

original: Aparopi vahantova, bhikkhuṃ yo koci puggalo;🔽Phalaṃ khandhe nisinnassa, bhikkhuno deti vaṭṭati.
analyzed: aparaḥ api vahantaḥ iva bhikkhum yaḥ koci puggalo  phalam khandhe nisinnassa bhikkhuno deti vaṭṭati
translated: If another person, while walking, gives fruit to a monk sitting in the resting place, it is allowable for the monk to receive it.

original: Gahetvā phaliniṃ sākhaṃ, chāyatthaṃ yadi gacchati;
analyzed: gahetvā phalinim sākham chāyattham yadi gacchati
translated: If he goes for the sake of shade, taking a branch with fruit,

original: Puna citte samuppanne, khādituṃ pana bhikkhuno.
analyzed: puna citte samuppanne khāditum pana bhikkhunaḥ
translated: but when he has a thought about it, it is not allowable for the monk to eat it.

analyzed: sākham paṭiggahāpetvā phalam khādati vaṭṭati
translated: If he has it taken, and then eats the fruit, it is allowable;

analyzed: makkhikānam nivāra attham nayaḥ
translated: this is the rule even if it is taken for the sake of keeping flies away.

original: Kappiyaṃ pana kāretvā, paṭiggaṇhāti taṃ puna;
analyzed: kappiyam pana kāretvā paṭiggaṇhāti tam puna
translated: But if he has it made allowable, and then receives it,

analyzed: bhottu kāmaḥ sace mūla gahaṇaṃyā iva vaṭṭati
translated: if he wants to eat it, it is only allowable to receive the root.

analyzed: mātā pitūnam atthāya gahetvā sappi ādikam
translated: If he takes ghee, etc., for the sake of his mother and father,

original: Gacchanto antarāmagge, yaṃ icchati tato pana.
analyzed: gacchantaḥ antarāmagge yam icchati tatas pana
translated: while going along the road, whatever he wants from it,

analyzed: tam saḥ paṭiggahāpetvā paribhuñjati vaṭṭati
translated: he can have it taken, and then eat it; it is allowable.

original: Taṃ paṭiggahitaṃ mūla-gahaṇaṃyeva vaṭṭati.🔽Sāmaṇerassa pātheyya-taṇḍule bhikkhu gaṇhati;
analyzed: tam paṭiggahitam mūla gahaṇam yā iva vaṭṭati  sāmaṇerassa pātheyya taṇḍule bhikkhu gaṇhati
translated: But it is only allowable to receive the root of what he has received.🔽If a monk receives rice for provisions for a novice,

analyzed: bhikkhussa sāmaṇeraḥ api gahetvā pana gacchati
translated: and the novice, after receiving it, goes away,

original: Taṇḍulesu hi khīṇesu, attanā gahitesu so;
analyzed: taṇḍulesu hi khīṇesu attanā gahitesu so
translated: if the rice is finished, it is only allowable for him to receive it himself.

analyzed: sace yāgum pacitvāna
translated: If he cooks rice gruel, and then, with rice and other things,

analyzed: ubhinnam dvīsu pattesu ākiritvā
translated: Pours them both into his own bowl,

original: Yāguṃ bhikkhussa taṃ datvā, sayaṃ pivati tassa ce.
analyzed: yāgum bhikkhussa tam da tvā sayam pivati tassa ce
translated: And gives the gruel to the monk, and drinks it himself,

analyzed: sannidhi paccayāḥ na iva na uggahita kāraṇā
translated: There is no offense because of storing, nor because of receiving;

analyzed: sāmaṇerassa pīta ttā dosaḥ bhikkhussa vijjati
translated: But there is an offense for the monk because the novice drank it.

analyzed: ca
translated: And if he takes oil, etc., for the sake of his parents,

analyzed: chāyā ādi atthāya imassa na visesa tā
translated: Or a branch for the sake of shade, there is no difference for him.

original: Tasmā hissa visesassa, cintetabbaṃ tu kāraṇaṃ;
analyzed: tasmā hi ssa visesassa cintetabbam tu kāraṇam
translated: Therefore, one should think of a reason for his difference,

analyzed: tassa sa ālaya bhāvam tu visesam
translated: And I infer that the difference is that he is a layman.

analyzed: taṇḍule pana dhovitvā celakaḥ
translated: But if he washes the rice, and then the rice-water overflows,

original: Na sakkoti sace te ca, taṇḍule bhājanampi ca.
analyzed: na sakkoti sace te ca taṇḍule bhājanam pi ca
translated: And if he cannot do it, and the rice and the vessel,

analyzed: paṭiggahetvā dhovitvā āropetvā panuddhanam
translated: Having received it, washed it, and put it on the fire,

analyzed: bhikkhunā aggi na kātabbaḥ vivaritvā api pakka tā
translated: The monk should not cook it, even if he opens it and stirs it.

analyzed: ñātabbā pakka kālasmiṃ oropetvā yathāsukham
translated: It should be known at the time of cooking, and having taken it down as he likes,

analyzed: bhuñjitabbam na pacchassa paṭiggahaṇa kāraṇam
translated: He should eat it, not after, because of the reason for receiving it.

analyzed: āropetvā sace bhikkhu uddhanam suddha bhājanam
translated: If a monk, having put it on, heats water in a clean vessel,

analyzed: udakam yāgu atthāya tāpa iti yadi vaṭṭati
translated: In order to make a drink, if he heats it, it is allowable.

original: Tatte panudake koci, ce pakkhipati taṇḍule;
analyzed: tat te panudake koci ce pakkhipati taṇḍule
translated: But if someone puts rice into that water,

original: Tato paṭṭhāya tenaggi, na kātabbova bhikkhunā.
analyzed: tatas paṭṭhāya tenaggi na kātabbaḥ uva bhikkhunā
translated: From that time on, the monk must not make a fire.

original: Paṭiggahetvā taṃ yāguṃ, pātuṃ vaṭṭati bhikkhuno;
analyzed: paṭiggahetvā tam yāgum pātum vaṭṭati bhikkhunaḥ
translated: Having accepted that drink, it is allowable for the monk to drink it.

original: Sace pacati pacchā taṃ, sāmapākā na muccati.
analyzed: sace pacati pacchā tam sāma pākā na muccati
translated: If he cooks it later, it is not released by cooking.

analyzed: kiñci saha valliyā
translated: If he mixes with it any fruit that grows on that spot, together with the creeper,

original: Tasseva ca tato laddhaṃ, phalaṃ kiñci na vaṭṭati.🔽Phalarukkhaṃ parāmaṭṭhuṃ, tamapassayitumpi vā;
analyzed: tassa iva ca tatas laddham phalam kiñci na vaṭṭati  phala rukkham parāmaṭṭhum tam a passayitum pi vā
translated: And if he gets any fruit from that, it is not allowable.🔽It seems to be allowable for a monk to touch a fruit tree,

original: Kaṇṭake bandhituṃ vāpi, bhikkhuno kira vaṭṭati.
analyzed: kaṇṭake bandhitum vā api bhikkhunaḥ kira vaṭṭati
translated: Or to look at it, or to tie a rope to it.

original: Saṇḍāsena ca dīghena, gahetvā thālakaṃ pana;
analyzed: saṇḍāsena ca dīghena thālakam pana
translated: Having taken a ladle with a long handle,

original: Pacato bhikkhuno telaṃ, bhasmaṃ patati tattha ce.
analyzed: pacataḥ bhikkhuno telam bhasmam patati tattha ce
translated: If ash falls from the oil-pot onto the monk while he is cooking,

analyzed: amuñcantena hatthena pacitvā
translated: Having cooked the oil-pot with a hand that is not free from ash,

analyzed: otāretvā ava tam pacchā paṭiggaṇheyya vaṭṭati
translated: Having poured it out later, it is allowable for him to accept it.

original: Paṭiggahetvā aṅgāre, tāni dārūni vā pana;
analyzed: paṭiggahetvā aṅgāre tāni dārūni vā pana
translated: Having accepted the embers or the wood,

analyzed: ṭhapitāni sace honti pubbagāhā uva vaṭṭati
translated: If they have been put there, it is allowable for the one who was there first.

original: Ucchuṃ khādati ce bhikkhu, sāmaṇeropi icchati;
analyzed: ucchum khādati ce bhikkhu sāmaṇeraḥ api icchati
translated: If a monk eats sugar-cane, a novice too wishes for it.

original: “Chinditvā tvamito gaṇha”, iti vutto ca gaṇhati.
analyzed: chinditvā tvam itas gaṇhe iti ca gaṇhati
translated: When told, “Cut it from here and take it,” he takes it.

original: Nattheva avasesassa, paṭiggahaṇakāraṇaṃ;🔽Khādato guḷapiṇḍampi, ayameva vinicchayo.
analyzed: nattha eva avasesassa paṭiggahaṇa kāraṇam  khādataḥ guḷa piṇḍam pi ayam eva vinicchayaḥ
translated: There is no reason for him to receive the remainder.🔽The same decision applies to eating a lump of sugar.

analyzed: kātum sāgara toyena loṇa kiccam tu vaṭṭati
translated: It is allowable to make salt with the water of the ocean,

analyzed: yāvajīvika saṅkhātam toyattā na tu gacchati

analyzed: idam kāla vinimmuttam udakam paridīpitam
translated: This water, which is not for a specific purpose, is explained,

analyzed: nibbānam viya nibbāna kusalena mahā esinā
translated: Like Nibbāna, by the Great Sage who is skilled in Nibbāna.

original: Udakena samā vuttā, himassa karakāpi ca;🔽Kūpādīsu jalaṃ pātuṃ, bahalampi ca vaṭṭati.
analyzed: udakena samā vuttā himassa karakā api ca  kūpa ādīsu jalam pātum ca vaṭṭati
translated: And the ice that is said to be like water,🔽It is allowable to drink thick water from a well, etc.

original: Khettesu kasitaṭṭhāne, bahalaṃ taṃ na vaṭṭati;
analyzed: khettesu kasita ṭṭhāne bahalam tam na vaṭṭati

analyzed: sanditvā yadi tam gantvā nadim pūra iti vaṭṭati
translated: But if it flows and goes to a river, it is allowable.

analyzed: sa ubbhesu kakudhā ādīnam jale puppha samākule

original: Na ñāyati raso tesaṃ, na paṭiggahaṇakāraṇaṃ.
analyzed: na ñāyati raso tesam na paṭiggahaṇa kāraṇam
translated: Their taste is not known, and there is no reason for him to receive it.

analyzed: sa reṇukāni pupphāni pānīyassa ghaṭe pana
translated: If there are flowers in a garland, Or in a pot of drinking water,

analyzed: pakkhittāni sace honti paṭiggaṇheyya tam pana  paṭiggahetvā deyyāni vāsa pupphāni tattha vā

analyzed: kamallikāsu dinnāsu vaṭṭati  a paṭiggahitassa iva dantakaṭṭhassa yaḥ rasaḥ
translated: If the juice of a tooth-stick,

analyzed: sarīraṭṭhesu bhūtesu kim vaṭṭati na vaṭṭati  kappākappiya maṃsānam khīram sabbam pi vaṭṭati  kaṇṇakkhigūthakaḥ danta malam muttam karīsakam
translated: What’s allowable and what’s not allowable regarding the beings in the body?🔽The milk of all animals is allowable,🔽As well as earwax, nasal mucus, dental plaque, urine, semen,

original: Semhaṃ siṅghāṇikā kheḷo, assu loṇanti vaṭṭati.
analyzed: semham siṅghāṇikā kheḷaḥ assu vaṭṭati

analyzed: yam pana ittha saka ṭṭhānā cavitvā patitam siyā
translated: But if it falls from its place onto

analyzed: sāmam gahetvā cattāri vikaṭāni nadāyake

analyzed: na dosaḥ paribhuñjato

analyzed: sikkha ppahāna maraṇehi ca liṅga bhedāḥ

analyzed: dānena tassa ca parassa abhikkhukassa
translated: and because of giving to him and to a visitor,

translated: all receiving is the same.🔽What is shown in the case of bad conduct,🔽and in the case of holding what has not been received,

analyzed: antovutthe sayaṃpakke antopakke ca dukkaṭam
translated: is a wrong-doing in the case of what is already inside, in the case of what grows together, and in the case of what grows in the vicinity.

analyzed: paṭiggahitake tasmim a paṭiggahita saññinaḥ

analyzed: tattha vematikassa api hoti āpatti dukkaṭam

analyzed: paṭiggahita saññissa danta ponodakesu pi

analyzed: na dosa iḷaka lomena samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ samāḥ

analyzed: nava majjhima thera bhikkhunīnam
translated: For the nine, the middle one, the senior monk, and the nun,

analyzed: sakalaḥ mayā
translated: I have explained it all, without abbreviation.

analyzed: kathitaḥ ettha vinicchayo tato

analyzed: danta pona kathā
translated: The discussion of tooth cleaners.

analyzed: bhojana vaggo catutthaḥ
translated: The fourth sub-chapter on eating is finished.

analyzed: yam kiñcicelaka ādīnam titthiyānam pana āmisam
translated: “Whatever belonging to the ascetics of other religions, such as a needle case,

analyzed: dentassa ika payogena ekam pācittiyam siyā  vicchinditvāna payoga gaṇanā vasā

analyzed: honti tassa tika pācittiyam siyā
translated: There is one offense entailing confession for each use. There is one offense entailing confession.

original: Udakaṃ dantaponaṃ vā, dentassa ca atitthiye;
analyzed: udakam danta ponam vā dentassa ca atitthiye
translated: If one gives water or a tooth cleaner to a person belonging to another religion,

analyzed: titthiyo ti ca saññissa dukkaṭam vimatissa ca
translated: And one perceives the person as belonging to another religion, there is an offense of wrong conduct. If one is unsure of it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: dāpentassa panaññena sāmaṇeḥ ādikena vā
translated: But if one has another person—a novice monk, for example—give it,

analyzed: nikkhitta bhājane tesam dentassa bahi lepanam
translated: Or if one gives a tooth cleaner to a person belonging to another religion after placing it in a container,

analyzed: ṭhapetvā bhojanam tesam santike gaṇhatha ati ca
translated: Except for food, if one says to a person belonging to another religion, “Take it,”

original: Vadantassa anāpatti, samuṭṭhāneḷakūpamaṃ.🔽Acelakakathā.🔽Dāpetvā vā adāpetvā, bhikkhu yaṃ kiñci āmisaṃ;🔽Kattukāmo sace saddhiṃ, hasanādīni itthiyā.🔽Uyyojeti hi “gacchā”ti, vatvā tappaccayā pana;
analyzed: vadantassa anāpatti samuṭṭhāna iḷakūpamam 🔽acelaka kathā 🔽dāpetvā vā a dāpetvā bhikkhu yam kiñci āmisam 🔽kattu kāmaḥ sace saddhim hasana ādīni itthiyā 🔽uyyoja iti hi gaccha ati vatvā tad paccayā pana

analyzed: dukkaṭam paṭhamena ca

analyzed: pādenassu upacārasmin atikkante ca dukkaṭam

analyzed: dutiyena assa pācitti sīmā atikkamane pana
translated: With the second, there’s an offense entailing confession, but only when the monastery zone is passed.

analyzed: dassane upacārassa hatthāḥ dvādasa desitā
translated: In the case of seeing, the access is said to be twelve handspans;

original: Pamāṇaṃ savane cevaṃ, ajjhokāse na cetare.
analyzed: pamāṇam savane ca ivam ajjhokāse na ca itare
translated: In the case of hearing, the same applies. In the open air, it’s not so.

analyzed: bhikkhusmim tika pācitti itare tika dukkaṭam
translated: With a monk, there are three offenses entailing confession; with the others, three offenses of wrong conduct.

original: Ubhinnaṃ dukkaṭaṃ vuttaṃ, kalisāsanaropane.🔽Uyyojentassa kiccena, na dosummattakādino;
analyzed: ubhinnam dukkaṭam vuttam kali sāsana ropane  uyyojentassa kiccena na dosummattaka ādinaḥ

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ
translated: The origins, etc., are the same as for stealing.

analyzed: uyyojana kathā

analyzed: khuddake piṭṭhi vaṃsam yaḥ atikkamma nisīdati
translated: If one sits down on a bed or a bench with detachable legs that is less than a handspan high,

analyzed: sa bhojane kule tassa hoti pācitti bhikkhuno  hattha pāsam atikkamma piṭṭhi saṅghāṭakassa ca

analyzed: sayanassa pana āsanne ṭhāne dosaḥ mahallake
translated: and of the bed or the bench with detachable legs that is nearby, there’s no offense in a large dwelling.

analyzed: a saya nighare tassa saya nighara saññinaḥ

analyzed: tattha vematikassa api dukkaṭam paridīpitam

analyzed: nisīdantassa anāpatti bhikkhussa dutiye sati

translated: Or when they are free from passion, or both have left.

analyzed: nisinnassa an atikkamma padesam vutta lakkhaṇam
translated: When sitting, having passed beyond a part that has the characteristics stated;

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ tulyā
translated: The origins, etc., are the same as in the first and last cases.

analyzed: sa bhojana kathā
translated: The sub-chapter on eating

analyzed: samuṭṭhānam pana itesam anantarasamam matam
translated: The origins are regarded as the same as in the immediately preceding rule;

analyzed: ayam eva visesaḥ ti dīpitaḥ  rahaḥ upaṭicchanna rahaḥ nisajja kathā  bhojanānam tu pañcannam vuttaḥ aññatarena yo

analyzed: santam bhikkhuman āpucchā āpajjeyya kulesu ce
translated: Invites a monk to eat at one’s house, without asking permission,

original: Cārittaṃ tassa pācitti, aññatra samayā siyā;
analyzed: cārittam tassa pācitti aññatra samayā siyā
translated: One commits an offense entailing confession, except on an appropriate occasion.

analyzed: ṭhapetvā samayam bhikkhu duvidham vutta lakkhaṇam
translated: The proper conduct is that, except on an appropriate occasion, a monk🔽Should not go to a house that has the characteristics stated.

analyzed: a vītivatte majjhaṇhe ghara maññassa gacchati
translated: When it is not yet midday, and he goes to a house that has the characteristics stated,

analyzed: gharū pacāra ukkamane paṭhamena hi dukkaṭam
translated: Then, when he enters the house, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: atikkante gharummāre aparam pi ca dukkaṭam
translated: After the death of the householder, there was another offense,

analyzed: dutiyena ca pādena pācitti samatikkame
translated: And with the second foot, he went beyond the offense entailing confession.🔽If a monk, standing in a place where he can see,

analyzed: ṭhita ṭṭhāne sace bhikkhum oloketvā na passati
translated: Does not see a monk, and without asking permission,

analyzed: a santanti an āpucchā paviṭṭhaḥ nāma vuccati

analyzed: sace dūre ṭhitaḥ hoti asantaḥ nāma bhikkhu so

original: Natthi ārocane kiccaṃ, gavesitvā ito cito.
