translated: There is no need to inform him, but he should be sought here and there.

original: Na doso samaye santaṃ, āpucchitvā ca gacchato;
analyzed: na dosaḥ samaye santam āpucchitvā ca gacchataḥ
translated: There is no offense if he is present at the right time,🔽And if he enters after asking permission,

original: Bhikkhuṃ gharena maggo ce, ārāmaṃ gacchatopi ca.🔽Titthiyānampi seyyaṃ vā, tathā bhikkhunupassayaṃ;
analyzed: bhikkhum gharena maggo ce ārāmam gacchataḥ pi ca  titthiyānam pi seyyam vā tathā bhikkhun upassayam
translated: If the path to the monastery goes through a house,🔽Or if he goes to a non-Buddhist dwelling, a bed,🔽Or a nun’s dwelling, or a building for sick monks,

analyzed: āpad āsana sālam vā bhattiyassa gharam pi vā
translated: Or a house of a supporter.

original: Idaṃ pana samuṭṭhānaṃ, kathinena samaṃ mataṃ;
analyzed: idam pana samuṭṭhānam kathinena samam matam
translated: This origin is considered the same as that of the kaṭhina robe,

analyzed: kriyā akriyam acittam ca ti cittam ca ti vedanam
translated: And it has action, inaction, and mind, and three kinds of consciousness and three kinds of feelings.

analyzed: cārittakathā
translated: The discussion of conduct.🔽All the invitations should be accepted,

analyzed: sabbā api sāditabbā ava catu māsa pavāraṇā
translated: The four-month invitation,

analyzed: bhikkhunā a gilānena puna nicca pavāraṇā
translated: And the invitation again by a sick monk.

analyzed: viññāpessāmi rogasmiṃ sati me paccaya iti ca
translated: “I will inform you if I have the requisites for the illness,”

original: Na paṭikkhipitabbā sā, “rogo dāni na me”ti ca.🔽Tikapācittiyaṃ vuttaṃ, dukkaṭaṃ natatuttariṃ;
analyzed: na paṭikkhipitabbā sā rogaḥ dāni na mā iti ca  tika pācittiyam vuttam dukkaṭam na tatuttarim
translated: “It should not be refused, saying, ‘I’m not sick.’”

analyzed: tatuttarinti saññissa tattha vematikassa ca
translated: The offense entailing confession is said to be three-line; There is no offense that is worse than that.🔽When he perceives it to be worse than that, And when he is unsure about it,

analyzed: na ta tuttari saññissa yehi yena pavāritaḥ
translated: When he does not perceive it to be worse than that, By whom he has been invited,

original: Tato aññehi vā bhiyyo, ācikkhitvā yathātathaṃ.
analyzed: tatas aññehi vā bhiyyas ācikkhitvā yathātatham
translated: Or by more than that, After he has told the truth,

analyzed: viññāpentassa bhikkhussa aññassa atthāya vā pana
translated: When he is asking for himself, Or for the sake of another,

original: Ñātakānamanāpatti, attano vā dhanenapi.🔽Tathā ummattakādīnaṃ, anāpatti pakāsitā;🔽Samuṭṭhānādayo sabbe, sañcarittasamā matā.
analyzed: ñātakānam anāpatti attanaḥ vā dhanena api  tathā ummattaka ādīnam anāpatti pakāsitā  samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ sabbe sañcaritta samā matā
translated: There is no offense when it is a relative, Or when it is with his own money.

original: Bhesajjakathā.🔽Uyyuttaṃ bhikkhuno senaṃ, dassanatthāya gacchato;🔽Aññatra paccayā tassa, dukkaṭaṃ tu pade pade.🔽Dassanassupacārasmiṃ, ṭhatvā pācitti passato;🔽Upacāraṃ vimuñcitvā, passantassa payogato.🔽Ārohā pana cattāro, dve dve taṃpādarakkhakā;🔽Evaṃ dvādasaposo ca, eko hatthīti vuccati.
analyzed: bhesajja kathā 🔽uyyuttam bhikkhuno senam dassana tthāya gacchataḥ 🔽aññatra paccayā tassa dukkaṭam tu pade pade 🔽dassanassupacārasmim ṭhatvā pācitti passato 🔽upacāram vimuñcitvā passantassa payogato 🔽ārohā pana cattāro dve dve 🔽evam dvādasa poso ca ekaḥ hatthī iti vuccati
translated: In the same way, there is no offense for one who is insane, etc.; The origins, etc., are all regarded as the same as in the case of trading.

analyzed: āroho eko
translated: Two are for the protection of the feet, one is for the man, the best of the three;

original: Eko sārathi yodheko, āṇirakkhā duve janā.
analyzed: ekaḥ sārathi yodha ekaḥ āṇirakkhā duve janā
translated: One is the charioteer, one is the warrior, two people are for the protection of the command.

analyzed: catu posaḥ rathaḥ vuttaḥ catu sacca vibhāvinā
translated: The chariot is said to have four wheels, by the one who has analyzed the four truths;

original: Cattāro padahatthā ca, purisā pattīti vuccati.
analyzed: cattāro pada hatthā ca purisā pattī iti vuccati
translated: The four feet and the hands are the men, they are called the infantry.

analyzed: vutta lakkhaṇa sampannā ayam pacchima koṭiyā
translated: Endowed with the characteristics that have been told, this is the last part;

analyzed: catur aṅga samāyuttā senā nāma pavuccati
translated: The army is said to be endowed with the four parts.

analyzed: hatthi ādīsu ekekam dassana tthāya gacchataḥ
translated: For one who goes for the purpose of seeing each of the elephant, etc.,

analyzed: anuyyutte pi uyyutta saññissa api ca dukkaṭam
translated: There is also an offense of wrong conduct for one who is engaged and for one who perceives one as engaged.

original: Attano ca ṭhitokāsaṃ, sampattaṃ pana passati;
analyzed: attano ca ṭhita ukāsam sampattam pana passati
translated: But if one sees one who has arrived at one’s own standing place,

analyzed: āpadāsu anāpatti tathārūpe ca paccaye
translated: There is no offense in an emergency, and in such conditions.

analyzed: uyyutta kathā
translated: The discussion of being engaged.

original: Catutthe divase attha-ṅgate sūriye arogavā;🔽Sace tiṭṭhatu senāya, nisīdatu nipajjatu.
analyzed: catutthe divase atthaṅgate sūriye arogavā  sace tiṭṭhatu senāya nisīdatu nipajjatu
translated: On the fourth day, when the sun has set, one who is healthy;🔽If one stands in the army, if one sits, if one lies down,

original: Ākāse iddhiyā seyyaṃ, pakappetu ca iddhimā;
analyzed: ākāse iddhiyā seyyam pakappetu ca iddhimā
translated: If one makes a bed in the air by supernormal power, and if one who has supernormal power covers oneself,

analyzed: hotā iva tassa tika pācittiyam siyā
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for him, there may be a serious offense.

analyzed: ūnake ca saññinaḥ
translated: If there are less than three, and one perceives it as more,

analyzed: tattha vematikassa api hoti āpatti dukkaṭam
translated: If one is unsure about it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: nikkhamma tatiyāya ca rattiyā
translated: If one leaves before dawn, and it is the third night;

analyzed: na dosaḥ puna vasantassa
translated: There is no offense if one stays again, if one is sick, if one is unable to walk,

analyzed: senāvāsa kathā
translated: The rule on staying with an army.

original: Uyyodhikaṃ balaggaṃ vā, senābyūhampi vā pana;
analyzed: uyyodhikam balaggam vā senā byūham pi vā pana
translated: If one goes to see an army, a parade of elephants, a parade of horses, or an army review,

analyzed: dassana atthāyanīkam vā hoti pācitti gacchataḥ
translated: or to see an army drawn up in battle formation, there is an offense entailing confession.

analyzed: purime pana yaḥ vutto hatthī dvādasa poriso
translated: But the one mentioned above, “an elephant is twelve human beings in size”;

analyzed: iti tena tayaḥ hatthī hattha anīkam ti dīpitam
translated: thus it is shown that three elephants are an “elephant parade”.

original: Sesesupi ca eseva, nayo ñeyyo vibhāvinā;
analyzed: ca esā iva nayaḥ ñeyyaḥ vibhāvinā
translated: And this is how it should be understood in the other cases as well.

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ samā
translated: The origins, etc., are the same as for the third offense entailing suspension.

analyzed: uyyodhika kathā
translated: The rule on army camps.

original: Aceḷakavaggo pañcamo.🔽Piṭṭhādīhi kataṃ majjaṃ, surā nāmāti vuccati;
analyzed: aceḍaka vaggo pañcamo  piṭṭha ādīhi katam majjam surā nāma ati vuccati
translated: The fifth sub-chapter on the one who is not fully admitted is finished.🔽Any alcoholic drink made from rice, etc., is called “palm-wine”.

original: Pupphādīhi kato sabbo, āsavo hoti merayaṃ.
analyzed: puppha ādīhi kato sabbaḥ āsavaḥ hoti merayam
translated: Any alcoholic drink made from flowers, etc., is called “fermented liquor”.

original: Bījato pana paṭṭhāya, pivantassubhayampi ca;🔽Payoge ca payoge ca, hoti pācitti bhikkhuno.
analyzed: bījataḥ pana paṭṭhāya pivantaḥ subhayam pi ca  payoge ca payoge ca hoti pācitti bhikkhuno
translated: But if one drinks any of these, starting from the time when the alcohol has started to form,🔽then for every mouthful there is an offense entailing confession.

analyzed: tika pācittiyam vuttam a majje majja saññinaḥ
translated: It is said that there are three offenses entailing confession

analyzed: tattha vematikassa api hoti āpatti dukkaṭam
translated: If one is unsure about it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: amajjam majja vaṇṇam ca majja gandha rasam pi ca
translated: Alcohol, what has the color of alcohol, what has the smell and taste of alcohol,

analyzed: suttakam ca
translated: Ariṭṭha, salt, and vinegar, and also drinking a beverage that contains alcohol.🔽Having put a little alcohol into a drink,

original: Vāsagāhāpanatthāya, pakkhipitvāna īsakaṃ;🔽Sūpādīnaṃ tu pākepi, anāpatti pakāsitā.
analyzed: vāsa gāhāpana atthāya pakkhipitvāna īsakam  sūpa ādīnam tu pāke pi anāpatti pakāsi tā
translated: in order to make it last longer,🔽there is no offense if one cooks rice or other food in it.

analyzed: hotā iḷaka samuṭṭhānam acittam vatthu jānanā
translated: The origin of the offense is unintentional, and the basis is known.

analyzed: idam ca akusalena iva pānataḥ loka vajjakam
translated: And this is a wrong bodily action, but not a wrong speech action, in the world.

analyzed: surā pāna kathā
translated: The discussion of drinking alcohol.🔽But if one touches a fully ordained person,

analyzed: yena kenaci aṅgena hasa adhippāyino pana
translated: with any part of the body, with the aim of making them laugh,

analyzed: phusataḥ upasampannam hoti pācitti bhikkhuno
translated: there is an offense entailing confession for a monk.

analyzed: sabbattha dukkaṭam kāya paṭibaddha ādike naye
translated: Everywhere, there is an offense of wrong conduct for using one’s body and so on.🔽And so too for touching an unordained person,

analyzed: tathā iva an upasampanne dīpitam tika dukkaṭam
translated: the three kinds of wrong conduct have been declared.

analyzed: ettha ca an upasampanna ṭhāne tiṭṭhati bhikkhunī
translated: And if a nun is standing in the place of an unordained person,

analyzed: khiḍḍa adhippāyino phusantassa ca dukkaṭam
translated: and one touches her with the aim of making her laugh, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: anāpatti nahasā adhippāyassa phusato param
translated: There is no offense if one touches with the aim of bathing,

analyzed: sati kicce phusantassa tathā ummattaka ādinaḥ
translated: or if one touches while doing a task, or if one is insane, and so on.

analyzed: aṅguli patodaka kathā
translated: The discussion of tickling.

analyzed: jale kevalam
translated: But if he does so just to sink in the water, etc.,

original: Padavāresu sabbesu, otarantassa dukkaṭaṃ.🔽Kīḷāpekkho sace hutvā, jale uparigopphake;
analyzed: padavāresu sabbesu otarantassa dukkaṭam  kīḷāpekkhaḥ sace hutvā jale upari gopphake
translated: Then for all the steps he takes, there’s an act of wrong conduct.🔽If he does so with the intention of playing,

original: Nimujjeyyapi vā bhikkhu, ummujjeyya tareyya vā.
analyzed: nimujjeyya api vā bhikkhu ummujjeyya tareyya vā
translated: Then whether he sinks in the water, rises from it, crosses over,

original: Payoge ca payoge ca, tassa pācittiyaṃ siyā;
analyzed: payoge ca payoge ca tassa pācittiyam siyā
translated: Or does so step by step, there’s an offense entailing confession for each step.

original: Antoyevodake tassa, nimujjitvāna gacchato.🔽Hatthapādapayogehi, pācittiṃ paridīpaye;
analyzed: antoyā iva udake tassa nimujjitvāna gacchataḥ  hattha pāda payogehi pācittim paridīpaye
translated: But if he sinks in the water and then goes,🔽Then for the effort of the hands and feet, he should be made to confess an offense entailing confession.

analyzed: hatthehi iva tarantassa hattha vārehi kāraye
translated: If he crosses over by using only his hands, he should be made to confess an offense of wrong conduct for each hand.

original: Yena yena panaṅgena, bhikkhuno tarato jalaṃ;
analyzed: yena yena panaṅgena bhikkhuno tarataḥ jalam
translated: But for whatever part of the body he uses to cross over the water,

analyzed: tassa tassa payogena pācittim paridīpaye
translated: For that effort he should be made to confess an offense entailing confession.

original: Taruto tīrato vāpi, pācitti patato jale;
analyzed: tarutaḥ tīrataḥ vā api pācitti patataḥ jale
translated: If he crosses over or goes to the other side, or if he falls in the water,

analyzed: tika pācittiyam vuttam tathā iva tika dukkaṭam
translated: Then there’s an offense entailing confession, and likewise an act of wrong conduct.

original: Pājentopi sace nāvaṃ, arittena phiyena vā;
analyzed: sace nāvam arittena phiyena vā
translated: If he pushes a boat with his foot or with a stick,

original: Ussārentopi tīre vā, nāvaṃ kīḷati dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: ussārentaḥ api tīre vā nāvam kīḷati dukkaṭam
translated: Or if he pulls it with his hand, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Hatthena vāpi pādena, kaṭṭhena kathalāya vā;
analyzed: hatthena vā api pādena kaṭṭhena kathalāya vā
translated: If he draws water with his hand, with his foot, with a stick, or with a gourd,

analyzed: udakam nīharantassa hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ
translated: He commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Udakaṃ kañjikaṃ vāpi, cikkhallaṃ vāpi vikkhipaṃ;
analyzed: udakam kañjikam vā api cikkhallam vā api vikkhipam
translated: If he throws water, sour, or even mud,

analyzed: kīḷantassa api bhikkhussa hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ
translated: Even if he’s just playing, there’s an offense of wrong conduct for the monk.

analyzed: vigāhitvā jalam kicce sati nimmujjana ādikam
translated: If he does it after announcing the water, if there’s a purpose, if he’s going to submerge,

analyzed: karontassa anāpatti tathā pārañca gacchato
translated: There’s no offense for one doing it, or for one going to the other side.

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ tulyā
translated: The origins, etc., are the same as for the first and last rules.

analyzed: natthi kāci visesa tā
translated: There’s no difference in the case of the following rule.

analyzed: ha sadhammakathā
translated: The rule on joking

analyzed: vuccamānaḥ sace bhikkhu paññattena iva bhikkhunā
translated: If a monk is being corrected by a monk who’s legitimately acting as an instructor,

analyzed: a kattu kāma tāyassa vacanam dhammam eva vā
translated: If he doesn’t want to do what he’s told, or if he disputes the Teaching,

analyzed: yaḥ a sikkhitu kāmaḥ iva na karoti pana ādaram
translated: If he doesn’t want to train, and he doesn’t respect the instructor,

analyzed: tassa anādariye tasmin pācittiyam udīraye
translated: Then for disrespect there is an offense entailing confession.

analyzed: tika pācittiyam vuttam tika atītena satthunā
translated: It’s said that there are three offenses entailing confession,

analyzed: tathā iva an upasampanna an ādare tika dukkaṭam
translated: And three offenses of wrong conduct for disrespecting one who hasn’t completed the proper training.

analyzed: suttena iva abhidhammena a paññattena bhikkhunā
translated: If he’s corrected by one who hasn’t recited the Monastic Code or the Teaching,

analyzed: dukkaṭam sāmaṇerena vuttassa ubhayena api
translated: There’s an offense of wrong conduct for a novice monk, and for both if he’s corrected by a monk.

analyzed: gāhaḥ amhākam tu paveṇiyā
translated: “This is the opinion of our teachers,

analyzed: āgataḥ ti bhaṇantassa na dosummattaka ādinaḥ
translated: If he says, “He’s come,” there’s no offense for one who’s angry, or who thinks there’s a reason for urgency, or who’s confused, or who’s the first offender.

analyzed: ettha na iva gahetabbaḥ gārayha ācari yuggahaḥ
translated: Herein, the teacher’s taking up of the accusation should not be accepted;

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ
translated: The origins, etc., are the same as for the offense entailing confession for groundless accusation.

analyzed: anādariya kathā
translated: The discussion of disrespectful talk.

analyzed: bhaya sañjanana tthāya rūpa ādim upasaṃhare
translated: If, for the purpose of frightening someone, one shows a form, etc.,

analyzed: bhayānakam katham vā api katheyya para santike
translated: or tells a frightening story in the presence of another person,

original: Disvā vā pana taṃ sutvā, mā vā bhāyatu, bhāyatu;
analyzed: disvā vā pana tam sutvā mā vā bhāyatu bhāyatu
translated: whether or not the other person sees or hears it, whether or not he is frightened,

original: Itarassa tu bhikkhussa, hoti pācitti taṅkhaṇe.
analyzed: itarassa tu bhikkhussa hoti pācitti taṅkhaṇe
translated: then the other monk commits an offense entailing confession at the very moment.🔽The origin, etc., are the same as for the third offense entailing confession.

analyzed: tika pācittiyam vuttam tathā iva tika dukkaṭam
translated: The same applies to the third offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: sāmaṇeram gahaṭṭham vā bhiṃsāpentassa bhikkhunaḥ
translated: If a monk frightens a novice monk or a lay follower,

analyzed: na bhiṃsā petu kāmassa an āpatta ādi kamminaḥ
translated: but he does not intend to frighten, and he is not aiming at anything,

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādi sabbam pi anantara samam matam
translated: then the origins, etc., are the same as for the preceding offense.

analyzed: bhiṃsāpana kathā
translated: The discussion of frightening.

original: Jotiṃ tappetukāmo ce, jalāpeyya jaleyya vā;
analyzed: jotim tad petu kāmaḥ ce jalāpeyya jaleyya vā
translated: If one lights a fire, or one has it lit, for the purpose of warming oneself,

original: Ṭhapetvā hoti pācitti, tathārūpaṃ tu paccayaṃ.
analyzed: ṭhapetvā hoti pācitti tathārūpam tu paccayam
translated: then there is an offense entailing confession, except if one uses a suitable implement.

original: Sayaṃ samādahantassa, yāva jālā na jāyati;
analyzed: sayam samādahantaḥ sa yāva jālā na jāyati
translated: As long as the flame does not appear,

analyzed: sabba payogesu hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ
translated: there is an offense of wrong conduct for every effort in lighting it.

analyzed: jāluṭṭhāne pana āpatti pācitti paridīpitā
translated: In a place for bathing, an offense entailing confession is specified;

analyzed: jālāpentassa aññena hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ
translated: If one has someone else make a net, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: gilānassa gilānaḥ ti saññissa vimatissa vā
translated: If one is sick, if one perceives oneself as sick, or if one is unsure of it,

analyzed: alātam ukkhipantassa a vijjhātam tu dukkaṭam
translated: If one raises a firebrand, there is an offense of wrong conduct if it is not recognized.

analyzed: vijjhātam yathā vatthuka tā matā
translated: If it is recognized and it catches fire, the offense is determined according to the object.

original: Anāpatti gilānassa, kataṃ aññena vā pana.
analyzed: anāpatti gilānassa katam aññena vā pana
translated: There is no offense if one is sick; if it is done by another;

analyzed: visibbentassa aṅgāram padīpujjālana ādike
translated: If one is having embers removed, or if one lights a lamp or a torch,

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ sabbe sañcaritta samā matā
translated: All the origins, etc., are treated like in the case of the offense entailing acknowledgment for indecent behavior.

analyzed: joti samādahana kathā
translated: The rule on making a fire

original: Apuṇṇe addhamāsasmiṃ, dese ce majjhime pana;
analyzed: a puṇṇe addha māsasmin dese ce majjhime pana
translated: If one has not completed the rainy-season residence, and if it is the middle period,

analyzed: nhāyissāmi iti cuṇṇam vā mattikam vā api gomayam
translated: if one makes a sauna, or if one makes a clay or cow-dung plaster,

analyzed: abhisaṅkharato sabba payogesu pi dukkaṭam
translated: there is an offense of wrong conduct for every effort.🔽When the bathing is finished,

analyzed: nhānassa pariyosāne hoti pācitti bhikkhuno
translated: there is an offense entailing confession for the monk.

analyzed: atireka ddha māsūna saññinaḥ vimatissa vā
translated: If one perceives it as less than a half-month, or if one is unsure of it,

original: Dukkaṭaṃ atirekaddha- māse ca samayesu ca.
analyzed: dukkaṭam māse ca samayesu ca
translated: there is an offense of wrong conduct for more than a half-month and for the proper time.

analyzed: nhāyantassa anāpatti nadī pāram pi gacchato
translated: There is no offense if one is bathing; if one is crossing a river;

analyzed: vālikam katāvāṭesu vā tathā
translated: Having stirred up the water, or in the same way in a dug-out pond,

analyzed: paccantime pi vā dese sabbesam āpadāsu pi
translated: Or in a border country, or in all cases of misfortune,

analyzed: idam eḷaka lomena samuṭṭhāna ādinā samam
translated: This is the same as the origin, etc., of the Eḷaka rule.

analyzed: nhāna kathā
translated: The discussion of bathing.

original: Cīvaraṃ yaṃ nivāsetuṃ, sakkā pārupitumpi vā;
analyzed: cīvaram yam nivāsetum sakkā vā
translated: The robe that can be worn, or that can be put on,

analyzed: channam aññataram bhikkhu rajitvā yattha katthaci
translated: A monk should dye it anywhere, in one of the three colors.

analyzed: padese kaṃsa nīlena patta nīlena vā pana
translated: In a place with red ocher, or with yellow ocher,

original: Yena kenaci kāḷena, kaddamenapi vā tathā.
analyzed: yena kenacid kāḷena kaddamena api vā tathā
translated: Or with any kind of black, or in the same way with mud,

analyzed: maṅgulassa mayūrassa
translated: The size of a partridge’s back,

analyzed: a katvā kappiyam bindum pācitti paribhuñjataḥ
translated: Without making a permissible mark, if he uses it, there is an offense entailing confession.

original: Pāḷikaṇṇikakappo vā, na ca vaṭṭati katthaci;🔽Ekaṃ vāpi anekaṃ vā, bindu vaṭṭati vaṭṭakaṃ.
analyzed: pāḷikaṇṇika kappaḥ vā na ca vaṭṭati katthaci  ekam vā api anekam vā bindu vaṭṭati vaṭṭakam
translated: A border or a corner is not permissible anywhere.🔽One or many, a mark or a dot is permissible.

analyzed: ādinne pi an ādinna saññinaḥ vimatissa ca
translated: If he has received it, but perceives it as not received, or if he is unsure,

analyzed: dukkaṭam muninā vuttam anāpatti pakāsitā
translated: The one with vision has said that there is an offense of wrong conduct. He has declared that there is no offense.

original: Kappe naṭṭhepi vā saddhiṃ, tena saṃsibbitesu vā;🔽Kriyākriyamidaṃ vuttaṃ, samuṭṭhāneḷakūpamaṃ.
analyzed: kappe naṭṭhe api vā saddhim tena saṃsibbitesu vā  kriyā akriyam idam vuttam samuṭṭhāna iḷaku upamam
translated: Even if the rule is lost, or if it is mixed with that,🔽This is said to be the action and non-action, the same as the origin, the Eḷaka rule.

analyzed: dubbaṇṇa karaṇa kathā
translated: The discussion of the discolored robe.

original: Vikappanā duve vuttā, sammukhāsammukhātipi;🔽Sammukhāya vikappento, bhikkhussekassa santike.
analyzed: vikappanā duve vuttā  sammukhāya vikappentaḥ bhikkhussa ekassa santike
translated: Two kinds of assigning are spoken of: face-to-face and not face-to-face.

analyzed: ekattam bahu bhāvam vā vā
translated: When assigning face-to-face, he should know the number of robes and whether they are many or few, whether they are far or near,

analyzed: tu jānitvā yathā vacana yogataḥ
translated: and he should know the words of the rule.

original: “Imāhaṃ cīvaraṃ tuyhaṃ, vikappemī”ti niddise;🔽Kappatettāvatā kāmaṃ, nidhetuṃ, na ca kappati.
analyzed: imā aham cīvaram tuyham vikappemi iti niddise  kappatet tāvatā kāmam nidhetum na ca kappati
translated: “I assign this robe to you” he should say.🔽It is allowable to keep it until then, but it is not allowable to use it.

analyzed: paribhoga ādikam tena pana
translated: But if it is used, etc., it is not allowable to assign it back to him.

analyzed: tena paccuddhaṭeya iva paribhoga ādi vaṭṭati
translated: But if it is assigned back to him, it is allowable to use it, etc.

analyzed: santakam pana mayham tvam paribhuñja pariccaja
translated: “But I will use it, I will wear it, I will make it into a requisite,”

analyzed: yathāpaccayam karohi iti vutte paccuddhaṭam siyā
translated: if he says this, it is allowable to assign it back to him.

analyzed: aparā sammukhā vuttā bhikkhussa ikassa santike
translated: Another kind of face-to-face is spoken of: in the presence of a single monk.

original: Yassa kassaci nāmaṃ tu, gahetvā sahadhamminaṃ.
analyzed: yassa kassaci nāmam tu gahetvā sahadhamminam
translated: After taking the name of anyone who is in accordance with the rule,

analyzed: cīvaram tissa bhikkhuno tissa theriyā
translated: “I assign this robe to the monk so-and-so, to the senior nun so-and-so,”

analyzed: vikappemi iti vattabbam vattabbam puna tena api
translated: he should say this, and it should be said back to him.

original: “Tissassa bhikkhuno vā tvaṃ, tassā tissāya theriyā;
analyzed: tissassa bhikkhuno vā tvam tassā tissāya theriyā
translated: “To the monk so-and-so, to the senior nun so-and-so,”

analyzed: santakam paribhuñjāhi vissajjehi iti vā tathā
translated: “Use what’s left over or give it away.”

analyzed: tato pabhuti sabbam pi paribhoga ādi vaṭṭati
translated: From then on, all of it is allowable to use and so on.

analyzed: evam parammukhāya api vattabbam eka santike
translated: In this way, it should be said to one person at a time, even if it’s done indirectly.

analyzed: imā aham cīvaram tuyham vikappatthāya dammi iti
translated: “I give this robe to you for the purpose of assigning it,”

original: Puna tenapi vattabbaṃ, “ko te mitto”ti bhikkhunā.
analyzed: puna tena api vattabbam kaḥ te mittaḥ ti bhikkhunā
translated: and he should be asked in return, “Who is your friend?”

analyzed: itarena api vattabbam tissaḥ tissā ati vā puna
translated: He should then say, “Tissa,”

analyzed: vattabbam bhikkhunā tena idam tissassa santakam
translated: and the monk should say, “This belongs to Tissa.🔽Use what belongs to Tissa,

original: Tissāya theriyā vā tvaṃ, santakaṃ paribhuñja vā;
analyzed: tissāya theriyā vā tvam santakam paribhuñja vā
translated: or give it away.”

original: Vissajjehī”ti vā vutte, hoti paccuddhaṭaṃ puna.
analyzed: vissajjehi iti vā vutte hoti paccuddhaṭam puna
translated: If he says, “I give it back,” it’s then given back.🔽But in these two cases,

original: Iccetāsu pana dvīsu, yāya kāyaci cīvaraṃ;
analyzed: iccā itāsu pana dvīsu yāya kāyaci cīvaram
translated: after assigning a robe in any way,

analyzed: vikappetvā sadhammesu yassa kassaci pañcasu
translated: to anyone of the five kinds of people who are in accordance with the rule,🔽or to one who hasn’t given back,

original: Apaccuddhārakaṃ vāpi, avissāsena tassa vā;🔽Yena taṃ vinayaṃ kammaṃ, kataṃ panidha bhikkhunā.
analyzed: a paccuddhārakam vā api avissāsena tassa vā  yena tam vinayam kammam katam bhikkhunā
translated: or to one who hasn’t given it out of trust,🔽the monk who has done the legal procedure

analyzed: cīvaram paribhuñjeyya hoti pācitti bhikkhuno
translated: may use that robe. There’s an offense of wrong conduct for the monk.

analyzed: tat ca iva adhiṭṭhahantassa vissajjantassa dukkaṭam
translated: If he claims it, or gives it away, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: paccuddhāraka vatthesu a paccuddhāra saññinaḥ
translated: In the case of the things that are to be relinquished, if he perceives them as not to be relinquished,

analyzed: tattha vematikassa api hoti āpatti dukkaṭam
translated: then there’s an offense of wrong conduct for one who is unsure.

analyzed: paccuddhāraṇa saññissa vissāsā paribhuñjato
translated: If he perceives them as to be relinquished, but he uses them on trust,

analyzed: anāpatti samuṭṭhānam kathinena ādinā samam
translated: then there’s no offense, as in the case of the rainy-season bathing cloth.

analyzed: vikappana kathā
translated: The discussion of the rainy-season residence.🔽A bowl or a robe that is to be relinquished,

original: Adhiṭṭhānupagaṃ pattaṃ, cīvaraṃ vāpi tādisaṃ;🔽Tathā sūcigharaṃ kāya-bandhanaṃ vā nisīdanaṃ.
analyzed: adhiṭṭhāna upagam pattam cīvaram vā api tādisam  tathā sūcigharam kāya bandhanam vā nisīdanam
translated: as well as a needle case, a belt, a sitting mat, or a sheet,

original: Apanetvā nidhentassa, hasāpekkhassa kevalaṃ;🔽Hoti pācittiyaṃ aññaṃ, āṇāpentassa dukkaṭaṃ.🔽Tenāpanihite tassa, pācittiṃ paridīpaye;
analyzed: apanetvā nidhentassa hasa apekkhassa kevalam  hoti pācittiyam aññam āṇāpentassa dukkaṭam  tena apanihite tassa pācittim paridīpaye
translated: if he stores it away without relinquishing it, just out of fun,🔽then there’s an offense entailing confession for the other. If he tells him to do it, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If he stores it away after relinquishing it to him,

analyzed: vuttam anupasampanna santake tika dukkaṭam
translated: then the offense entailing confession is explained.🔽It’s said that there are three offenses of wrong conduct in regard to those who are not fully ordained.

analyzed: vinā vutta ppakārāni patta ādīni tatas pana
translated: Apart from the bowl and the other things mentioned above,🔽if he stores away anything else without relinquishing it,

analyzed: aññam apanidhentassa hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ
translated: there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: sabbesu anupasampanna santakesu pi dukkaṭam
translated: In regard to all those who are not fully ordained, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.🔽There’s no offense if it’s not stored away properly,

analyzed: dunnikkhittam anāpatti paṭisāmayataḥ pana
translated: but it’s relinquished.

analyzed: tathā dhamma katham katvā dassāmi iti nidheti ce
translated: If, after giving a talk on the Dhamma, he stores it, thinking, ‘I’ll give it away,’

analyzed: a vihesetu kāmassa a kīḍassa ādi kamminaḥ
translated: If he does so without the intention of stealing, and he does not play with it,

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ tulyāḥ dutiya ntima vatthunā
translated: The origins, etc., are the same as for the second offense entailing suspension.

analyzed: idam akusalena iva sa cittam ca ti vedanam
translated: This offense is only originated by akusala, and it has three kinds of feelings.

analyzed: cīvara apanidhāna kathā
translated: The discussion of storing robe-cloth.

analyzed: surā pāna vaggaḥ chaṭṭhaḥ
translated: The sixth sub-chapter on drinking alcohol is finished.

analyzed: tiracchāna gatam pāṇam mahantam vā
translated: If a monk kills a living being that is not human, whether large or small,

analyzed: hoti pācittiya āpatti mārentassassa bhikkhuno
translated: he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Appāṇe pāṇasaññissa, vimatissubhayattha ca;🔽Dukkaṭaṃ tu anāpatti, asañcicca ajānato.
analyzed: appāṇe pāṇa saññissa vimatiḥ ubhayattha ca  dukkaṭam tu anāpatti asañcit ca a jānataḥ
translated: If it is without breath, but he perceives it to be with breath, if he is unsure about whether it is without breath, or if he perceives it to be with breath,🔽there is an offense of wrong conduct. There is no offense if it is unintentional, if he is not thinking,

analyzed: na ca māretu kāmassa tathā ummattaka ādinaḥ
translated: if he does not want to kill, if he is insane, if he is the first offender.

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ tulyā
translated: The origins, etc., are the same as for the third offense entailing suspension.

analyzed: sañcicca pāṇa kathā
translated: The discussion of intentionally killing a living being.

analyzed: sappāṇakam jalam jānam pācitti paribhuñjataḥ
translated: If a monk drinks water containing living beings that he knows are there, he commits an offense entailing confession.

analyzed: payoga bahu tā ayassa pācittibahu tā siyā
translated: If he drinks a lot, he commits a number of offenses entailing confession.

analyzed: ekena iva payogena a vicchijja sace pana
translated: But if he drinks in a single action without interruption,

analyzed: pivataḥ patta pūram pi ekam pācittiyam siyā
translated: even if he drinks a bowlful, he commits one offense entailing confession.

original: Tādisenudakenassa, āviñchitvāna sāmisaṃ;🔽Dhovato pana pattaṃ vā, nibbāpentassa yāguyo.🔽Hatthena taṃ uḷuṅkena, gahetvā nhāyatopi vā;
analyzed: tādisena udakena assa āviñchitvāna sa āmisam  dhovataḥ pana pattam vā nibbāpentassa yāguyaḥ  hatthena tam uḷuṅkena gahetvā nhāyataḥ api vā
translated: If he does this with water that contains life, and he touches it with his body,🔽Or if he washes a bowl, or cools a drink,🔽Or if he bathes while holding it with his hand or with a cloth,

original: Payoge ca payoge ca, pācitti paridīpitā.
analyzed: payoge ca payoge ca pācitti paridīpitā
translated: Then for every effort, an offense entailing confession is specified.

analyzed: appāṇake pi sappāṇa saññissa ubhayattha api
translated: Even if it does not contain life, but he perceives that it does, in both cases,

analyzed: vimatissa api bhikkhussa hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ
translated: And if he is unsure, the monk commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: sappāṇe api ca appāṇe appāṇam iti saññinaḥ
translated: If it contains life, but he does not perceive that it does,

original: Na doso “paribhogena, na marantī”ti jānato.🔽Patanaṃ salabhādīnaṃ, ñatvā suddhena cetasā;🔽Padīpujjalanañcettha, ñatvā sappāṇabhāvataṃ.
analyzed: na dosaḥ paribhogena na maranti iti jānataḥ  patanam salabha ādīnam ñatvā suddhena cetasā  ñatvā
translated: There is no offense if he knows, “It will not die through my using it.”🔽If he knows that insects and so on will fall into the water, and he uses it with a pure mind,🔽And if he knows that there is life in the fire that he lights,

analyzed: bhuñjataḥ jala saññāya ñeyyā paṇṇatti vajja tā
translated: Then if he eats while perceiving the liquid as liquid,🔽The offense should be understood according to the rule.

original: Siñcane siñcanaṃ vuttaṃ, paribhoge idaṃ pana.🔽Ayameva visesoti, tassa ceva panassa ca;
analyzed: siñcane siñcanam vuttam paribhoge idam pana  ayam eva visesaḥ ti tassa ca iva panassa ca
translated: The sprinkling is in the sprinkling, but this is in the using.🔽This is the difference between the two.

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ
translated: The origins, etc., are the same as for stealing.

analyzed: sappāṇaka kathā
translated: The discussion of containing life.

analyzed: nihatam tu yathādhammam kicca adhikaraṇam puna
translated: Having settled a legal issue according to the rule,

analyzed: nihātabbanti pācitti ukkoṭentassa bhikkhuno
translated: The offense entailing confession is for the monk who is the one who is pressing.

analyzed: akatam dukkatam kammam kātabbam punadeviti
translated: “The legal procedure that was done badly should be done again.”

original: Vadatā pana taṃ kammaṃ, uccāletuṃ na vaṭṭati.
analyzed: vadatā pana tam kammam uccāletum na vaṭṭati
translated: But when he says this, the procedure is not to be lifted.🔽If, when the procedure has been done,

original: Sace vippakate kamme, paṭikkosati taṃ puna;
analyzed: sace vippakate kamme paṭikkosati tam puna
translated: he objects to it again,

analyzed: saññāpetvā ava kātabbam na kātabbam pana aññathā
translated: it should be done after getting his consent; it should not be done otherwise.🔽But if, in a procedure that is illegitimate,

analyzed: adhamme pana kammasmiṃ dhamma kammanti saññinaḥ
translated: those who perceive it as legitimate

original: Vimatissubhayatthāpi, hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ.🔽“Adhammena ca vaggena, na ca kammārahassa vā;
analyzed: vimatiḥ ubhayatthā api hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ  adhammena ca vaggena na ca vā
translated: are doubtful about the purpose, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽But if he knows that “The procedure🔽was illegitimate and done by an incomplete assembly, and it was done against one who deserves to be sent back to the beginning,”

original: Kata”nti jānato natthi, doso ukkoṭane pana.🔽Tathā ummattakādīna-manāpatti pakāsitā;
analyzed: katanti jānataḥ natthi doso ukkoṭane pana  tathā ummattaka ādīnam anāpatti pakāsitā
translated: there is no offense in pressing it.🔽So too, there is no offense for one who is insane, etc.;

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ
translated: the origin stories, etc., are the same as for the offense entailing confession for abusive speech.

analyzed: ukkoṭana kathā
translated: The discussion of pressing

original: Saṅghādisesaṃ duṭṭhullaṃ, āpattiṃ bhikkhuno pana;🔽Ñatvā chādayato tassa, pācitti pariyāputā.
analyzed: saṅgha ādisesam duṭṭhullam āpattim bhikkhunaḥ pana  ñatvā chādayataḥ tassa pācitti
translated: If a monk, knowing that a monk🔽has committed a heavy offense entailing suspension, conceals it,🔽his offense entailing confession is ended.

analyzed: nikkhipitvā dhuram tassa paṭicchādana hetukam
translated: If he puts down the burden🔽because of the concealment,🔽and then tells another,

original: Āroceti sacaññassa, sopi aññassa vāti hi.
analyzed: āroceti sacaññassa so pi aññassa vāti hi
translated: that other should also tell another.

original: Evaṃ satampi bhikkhūnaṃ, sahassampi ca tāva taṃ;
analyzed: evam satam pi bhikkhūnam sahassam pi ca tāva tam
translated: Even if there are a thousand monks like this,

original: Āpajjateva āpattiṃ, yāva koṭi na chijjati.
analyzed: āpajjatā iva āpattim yāva na chijjati
translated: As long as the root is not cut, they will still commit an offense.

analyzed: mūlena ārocitassa iva dutiyassa pakāsite
translated: When the second one is confessed after the first one has been admitted,

analyzed: tatiyena vuccati
translated: And the third one turns back, it is said that the root is cut.

analyzed: duṭṭhullāya ca duṭṭhalla saññī pācittiyam phuse
translated: If it is a grave offense and he perceives it as such, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Itaresu pana dvīsu, dukkaṭaṃ paridīpitaṃ.🔽Aduṭṭhullāya sabbattha, niddiṭṭhaṃ tikadukkaṭaṃ;
analyzed: itaresu pana dvīsu dukkaṭam paridīpitam  a duṭṭhullāya sabbattha niddiṭṭham tika dukkaṭam
translated: But in the other two cases, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽In all cases of a minor offense, the three kinds of wrong conduct are given.

analyzed: sabbattha anupasampanna vāresu pi ca dukkaṭam
translated: And in all cases of one who is not fully ordained, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: saṅghassa bhedana ādīni bhavissanti iti vā pana
translated: If he thinks, “There will be schism in the Sangha,”

original: Na ca chādetukāmo vā, sabhāgaṃ vā na passati.
analyzed: na ca chādetu kāmaḥ vā sa bhāgam vā na passati
translated: Or if he does not want to conceal it, or if he does not see anyone who shares the view,

analyzed: paññāyissati kammena sakena āyanti kakkhaḷaḥ
translated: Or if he thinks, “It will be known through the legal procedure itself,” or if he is harsh,

analyzed: an āroceti ce doso natthi ummattaka ādino
translated: If he does not inform, there is no offense. There is no offense if he is insane, etc.

original: Dhuranikkhepatulyāva, samuṭṭhānādayo nayā;🔽Kāyakammaṃ vacīkammaṃ, akriyaṃ dukkhavedanaṃ.
analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ nayā  kāya kammam vacī kammam akriyam dukkha vedanam
translated: The origin stories are the same as for the offense entailing demotion.

analyzed: duṭṭhulla kathā 🔽ūnavīsati vassam yaḥ kareyya upasampadam
translated: It is bodily action and verbal action. It is not inactivated by death. It is suffering when there is no confession.

original: Tassa pācittiyaṃ hoti, sesānaṃ hoti dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: tassa pācittiyam hoti sesānam hoti dukkaṭam
translated: There’s an offense entailing confession for the one who gives the full ordination, and an offense of wrong conduct for the rest.

analyzed: upasampāditaḥ ca isaḥ jānatā vai a jānatā
translated: Whether he knows or not,

analyzed: hotā iva an upasampannaḥ kātabbaḥ punar eva saḥ
translated: he is not fully ordained, and he should be made to do it again.🔽If he lies about his age,

analyzed: dasa vassa ccaya inassa upajjhāyassa ce sataḥ
translated: or if he has a preceptor,

analyzed: upasampādane doso aññesam natthi koci pi
translated: there’s an offense in giving the full ordination, but not for anyone else.

original: Muñcitvā pana taṃ bhikkhuṃ, gaṇo ce paripūrati;
analyzed: muñcitvā pana tam bhikkhum gaṇo ce paripūrati
translated: But if the group is complete after that monk has been dismissed,

original: Honti te sūpasampannā, na doso koci vijjati.
analyzed: honti te su upasampannāḥ na dosaḥ koci vijjati
translated: they are fully ordained, and there’s no offense for anyone.

original: Upajjhāyo sace hutvā, gaṇaṃ ācariyampi vā;
analyzed: upajjhāyo sace hutvā gaṇam vā
translated: If the preceptor or the teacher

original: Pariyesati pattaṃ vā, sammannati ca māḷakaṃ.
analyzed: pariyesati pattam vā sammannati ca māḷakam
translated: searches for a bowl or a robe, or approves of one that’s been searched for,

analyzed: upasampādayissāmi iti sabbesu tassa hi
translated: or if he says, “I’ll give the full ordination,”🔽then there’s an offense of wrong conduct for all of them

original: Ñattiyā ca tathā dvīsu, kammavācāsu dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: ñattiyā ca tathā dvīsu kamma vācāsu dukkaṭam
translated: at the motion and at the two announcements of the legal procedure.🔽At the end of the recitation of the Monastic Code,

analyzed: kamma vācāya osāne pācitti paridīpitā
translated: an offense entailing confession is specified

analyzed: ūnavīsati saññissa paripuṇṇe pi puggale
translated: for one who perceives a person as less than twenty years old, even if he’s complete.🔽If he’s unsure or if he perceives him as less than twenty years old,

analyzed: vimatiḥ ubhayatthā api hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ
translated: there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: paripuṇṇo ti saññissa ubhayattha na dosa tā
translated: If he perceives him as complete, there’s no offense in either case.🔽The same applies if he’s insane,

analyzed: tathā ummattakassa api ādikammika bhikkhunaḥ
translated: or if he’s the first offender.

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ
translated: The origins, etc., are the same as for taking what is not given.

analyzed: ūnavīsati kathā
translated: The twenty-first section for recitation on the offense entailing confession for traveling by appointment with a woman.

original: Theyyasatthena jānanto, saṃvidhāya sace pana;🔽Maggaṃ gacchati saddhiṃ yo, tassa pācittiyaṃ siyā.
analyzed: theyyasatthena jānantaḥ saṃvidhāya sace pana  maggam gacchati saddhim yaḥ tassa pācittiyam siyā
translated: If he knows that a woman is traveling by appointment,🔽And if he travels with her, he commits an offense entailing confession.🔽The explanation of the offense entailing confession for traveling by appointment with a woman🔽is finished.

original: Gamane saṃvidhāne ca, vattabbo yo vinicchayo;
analyzed: gamane saṃvidhāne ca vattabbaḥ yaḥ vinicchayaḥ
translated: The explanation of the offense entailing confession for traveling by appointment with a woman

original: So ca bhikkhunivaggasmiṃ, vuttattā na ca uddhaṭo.
analyzed: saḥ ca bhikkhuni vaggasmiṃ vutta ttā na ca uddhaṭaḥ
translated: is finished.

analyzed: maggāṭa vivisaṅkete yathāvatthukam eva tu
translated: The explanation of the offense entailing confession for traveling by appointment with a woman

analyzed: tiṭṭheyi upassutim sotum tassa pācittiyam siyā
translated: Of monks who are arguing, he commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If he goes there thinking,

original: “Yaṃ ime tu bhaṇissanti, taṃ sossāmī”ti gacchato;
analyzed: yam ime tu bhaṇissanti tam sossāmi iti gacchataḥ
translated: “I will listen to what they say,”

original: Codetukāmatāyassa, dukkaṭaṃ tu pade pade.🔽Purato gacchato sotuṃ, ohīyantassa dukkaṭaṃ;
analyzed: dukkaṭam tu pade pade  puratas gacchato sotuṃ ohīyantassa dukkaṭam
translated: then for every step he is approaching, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If he is walking in front and listening,🔽then for every step he is walking, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: turitam vā api ayam eva vinicchayaḥ
translated: And if he is walking quickly,🔽the same applies.

analyzed: ṭhita ukāsam pana āgantvā yadi mantenti attanaḥ
translated: But if he goes to a place where they are standing and talking,

analyzed: vā ettha vā
translated: and he either clears his throat or announces his presence,

analyzed: tassa ivam akarontassa pācitti savane siyā
translated: If he does not do it, there is an offense entailing confession for the one who hears.

analyzed: tika pācittiyam vuttam sese ca tika dukkaṭam
translated: The offense entailing confession is stated in the triad, and in the rest there is a serious offense in the triad.

analyzed: imesam vacanam sutvā oramissanti gacchataḥ
translated: “Having heard their statement, he goes away, thinking, ‘I’ll cross-examine them,’”

analyzed: tathā ummattaka ādīnam anāpatti pakāsitā
translated: and so too for one who is insane, etc. there is no offense.

analyzed: theyya sattha samuṭṭhānam idam hoti kriyākriyam
translated: This originates from a criminal or a teacher, and it is both a doing and a non-doing.

analyzed: kāya kammam vacī kammam sa dosam dukkha vedanam
translated: It is bodily action and verbal action; it has resentment as its source, and suffering as its outcome.

analyzed: upassuti kathā
translated: The discussion of overhearing.

original: Dhammikānaṃ tu kammānaṃ, chandaṃ datvā sace pana;
analyzed: dhammikānam tu kammānam chandam da tvā sace pana
translated: But if, after giving consent to legitimate legal procedures, he then criticizes them,

original: Pacchā khīyati pācitti, vācato vācato siyā.
analyzed: pacchā khīyati pācitti vācatas vācatas siyā
translated: there is an offense entailing confession for every statement.

analyzed: adhamme pana kammasmiṃ dhamma kammanti saññinaḥ
translated: But if, regarding illegitimate legal procedures, he perceives them as legitimate,

analyzed: vimatiḥ ubhayatthā api hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ
translated: and he criticizes them because he is unsure or because he is afraid, there is a serious offense.

analyzed: adhammena ca vaggena ca
translated: “If, regarding illegitimate legal procedures done by an incomplete assembly, or if, regarding legitimate legal procedures done by a complete assembly, he perceives them as legitimate,

original: Ime kammaṃ karontī”ti, ñatvā khīyati tassa ca.
analyzed: ime kammam karonti iti ñatvā khīyati tassa ca
translated: and he criticizes them, there is an offense entailing suspension for him.”

analyzed: tathā ummattaka ādīnam anāpatti pakāsitā
translated: And so too for one who is insane, etc. there is no offense.

analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ
translated: The origins are the same as for the last offense entailing suspension.

analyzed: kamma paṭibāhana kathā
translated: The discussion of blocking a legitimate legal procedure.

analyzed: yāvaḥ ārocitam vatthu a vinicchitam eva vā
translated: As long as the case has been announced, or it has not been decided,

original: Ṭhapitā ñatti vā niṭṭhaṃ, kammavācā na gacchati.
analyzed: ṭhapitā vā niṭṭham kamma vācā na gacchati
translated: Or a motion has been put forward, or the announcement has not been completed,

original: Etasmiṃ antare kammaṃ, kopetuṃ parisāya hi;🔽Hatthapāsaṃ jahantassa, hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: etasmin antare kammam parisāya hi  hattha pāsam jahantassa hoti āpatti dukkaṭam
translated: In the middle of this, if a monk leaves the hearing,🔽He commits an offense of wrong conduct as soon as he leaves arm’s reach.

original: Adatvā jahite chandaṃ, tassa pācittiyaṃ siyā;🔽Dhammakamme adhamme ca, vimatissa ca dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: a datvā jahite chandam tassa pācittiyam siyā  dhamma kamme adhamme ca vimatissa ca dukkaṭaṃ
translated: If he leaves without giving his consent, he commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, or if he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: adhamme pi ca kammasmim dhamma kammanti saññinaḥ
translated: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate,

original: “Saṅghassa bhaṇḍanādīni, bhavissantī”ti saññino.🔽Gilāno vā gilānassa, karaṇīye na dosatā;
analyzed: saṅghassa bhaṇḍana ādīni bhavissanti iti saññinaḥ  gilānaḥ vā gilānassa karaṇīye na dosa tā
translated: If he perceives that there will be quarreling, etc., in the Sangha,🔽If he is sick, or if he is doing it for someone who is sick, there is no offense.

analyzed: na ca kopetu kāmassa kammam passāvana ādinā
translated: If he does not leave because he wants to cause the legal procedure to fail,

original: Pīḷitassāgamissāmi, iccevaṃ gacchatopi vā;🔽Samaṃ samanubhāsena, samuṭṭhānaṃ kriyākriyaṃ.
analyzed: pīḍitassa āgamissāmi iti evam gacchataḥ pi vā  samam samanubhāsena samuṭṭhānam kriyākriyam
translated: If he thinks, “I’ll go and then return,”

original: Chandaṃ adatvā gamanakathā.🔽Samaggena ca saṅghena, saddhiṃ datvāna cīvaraṃ;
analyzed: chandam a da tvā gamana kathā  samaggena ca saṅghena saddhim da tvāna cīvaram
translated: If he leaves after giving his consent, the origin, the action, and the non-action are the same as for the offense entailing confession for not getting permission to leave.🔽The rule on not getting permission to leave🔽If a monk has given his robe to a monk who is in agreement with the Sangha,

original: Sammatassa hi bhikkhussa, pacchā khīyati yo pana.
analyzed: sammatassa hi bhikkhussa pacchā khīyati yaḥ pana
translated: But then regrets it,

analyzed: tassa vācāya vācāya pācitti paridīpitā
translated: For every statement, an offense entailing confession is declared.

original: Tikapācittiyaṃ dhamma- kamme vuttaṃ tu cīvaraṃ.
analyzed: tika pācittiyam dhamma kamme vuttam tu cīvaram
translated: The robe that is mentioned in the Monastic Law, in the three rules entailing confession,

analyzed: ṭhapetvā añña parikkhāram da tvā khīyati dukkaṭam
translated: Except for the other requisites, when given, there is an offense of wrong conduct for the one who uses it.

original: Saṅghenāsammatassāpi, cīvaraṃ aññameva vā.🔽Tathevānupasampanne, sabbatthāpi ca dukkaṭaṃ;
analyzed: saṅghena a sammatassa api cīvaram aññam eva vā  tathā iva anupasampanne sabbattha api ca dukkaṭam
translated: Even if one is not approved by the Sangha, one should give the robe or something else.🔽In the same way, to one who is not fully ordained, everywhere, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Chandādīnaṃ vaseneva, karontañca sabhāvato.🔽Khīyantassa anāpatti, tathā ummattakādino;
analyzed: chanda ādīnam vasena iva karontam ca sabhāvataḥ  khīyantassa anāpatti tathā ummattaka ādinaḥ
translated: For the one who does it because of desire, etc., there is an offense in its entirety.🔽There is no offense for the one who uses it after giving it away, and in the same way for one who is insane, etc.

analyzed: amūlaka samā ñeyyā samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ nayā
translated: The origins, etc., should be understood in the same way as for the undeclared offenses.

analyzed: dubbala kathā
translated: The discussion of the weak.

analyzed: idam tiṃsaka kaṇḍasmiṃ antimena ca sabbathā
translated: In the chapter on the group of thirty, and at the end,

analyzed: tulyam dvādasamam sabbam ayam eva visesa tā
translated: all is the same as the twelfth. This is the only difference.

analyzed: tattha nissaggiyam vuttam attanaḥ pariṇāmanā
translated: There, it is said that there is an offense entailing relinquishment for one who dedicates to oneself.

analyzed: idha suddhika pācitti puggale pariṇāmanā
translated: Here, there is a pure offense entailing confession for one who dedicates to a person.

analyzed: pariṇāmana kathā
translated: The discussion of dedicating.

analyzed: sahadhammika vaggaḥ aṭṭhamaḥ
translated: The eighth sub-chapter on those who are not in accordance with the Teaching is finished.

analyzed: a nikkhante ce rājasmin a nikkhantāya deviyā
translated: If the king has not left, and the queen has not left,

analyzed: sayanīya gharā tassa ummāram yaḥ atikkame
translated: if one crosses the threshold of the bedchamber,

original: Dukkaṭaṃ paṭhame pāde, pācitti dutiye siyā;
analyzed: dukkaṭam paṭhame pāde pācitti dutiye siyā
translated: For the first foot, there’s an offense of wrong conduct; for the second, it becomes an offense entailing confession.

original: Deviyā vāpi rañño vā, sace na viditāgamo.
analyzed: deviyā vā api rañño vā sace na vidita āgamaḥ
translated: If it’s not known that it’s for the queen or the king.

analyzed: paṭisaṃvidite na iva paṭisaṃvidita saññinaḥ
translated: If it’s not determined, but he perceives it as such,

original: Tattha vematikassāpi, dukkaṭaṃ paridīpitaṃ.🔽Paṭisaṃviditasaññissa, neva ca khattiyassa vā;
analyzed: tattha vematikassa api dukkaṭam paridīpitam  paṭisaṃvidita saññissa na iva ca khattiyassa vā
translated: then for one who is unsure, wrong conduct is declared.🔽If it’s determined, but it’s not a noble,🔽or it’s not one consecrated with the noble consecration,

analyzed: na khattiya abhisekena abhisittassa vā pana
translated: or it’s not one consecrated with the royal consecration,

analyzed: nikkhante vā
translated: or if both have left, or if it’s been lost,

analyzed: na kriyākriyam
translated: then for one who is angry, etc., there is no determining of the robe-making ceremony.

analyzed: antepura kathā
translated: The discussion of the inner palace.

analyzed: rajatam jātarūpam vā uggaṇhantassa attanaḥ
translated: If he makes gold or silver enter for himself,

analyzed: tassa nissaggiya āpatti uggaṇhāpayataḥ pi vā
translated: then there’s an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for making it enter.

analyzed: gaṇa puggala saṅghānam nava kammassa cetiye
translated: If he makes it enter for a group, an individual, the Sangha, a novice, or a shrine,

analyzed: uggaṇhāpayataḥ hoti dukkaṭam gaṇhataḥ api vā
translated: then there’s an offense of wrong conduct for making it enter or for receiving it.

analyzed: avasesam ca mutta ādi ratanam vā
translated: And for the rest, such as crystal, etc., if he makes it enter for himself,

analyzed: saṅgha ādīnam pi atthāya uggaṇhantassa dukkaṭam
translated: or for the benefit of the Sangha, etc., then there’s an offense of wrong conduct for making it enter.🔽If it’s a legitimate object,

original: Sace kappiyavatthuṃ vā, vatthuṃ vāpi akappiyaṃ;
analyzed: sace kappiya vatthum vā vatthum vā api a kappiyam
translated: or if it’s an illegitimate object,

analyzed: tāla paṇṇam pi vā hotu mātu kaṇṇa pilandhanam
translated: Whether it’s a palm leaf or a mother-of-pearl dish,

analyzed: bhaṇḍāgārika sīsena yam kiñci gihi santakam
translated: Whatever belongs to a householder, even if it’s the head of the storehouse,

analyzed: tassa pācittiya āpatti paṭisāmayato pana
translated: There’s an offense entailing confession for storing it.

analyzed: idam ṭhapetvā dehi iti vuttena pana kenacid
translated: But if someone says, “Please put this aside,”

original: “Na vaṭṭatī”ti vatvā taṃ, na nidhetabbameva tu.
analyzed: na vaṭṭati iti vatvā tam na nidhetabbam eva tu
translated: and you say, “It’s not allowable,” you shouldn’t store it.

analyzed: ṭhapehi iti ca pātetvā sace gacchati puggalo
translated: But if you put it aside and the person leaves,

original: Palibodho hi nāmeso, ṭhapetuṃ pana vaṭṭati.
analyzed: palibodhaḥ hi nāma iso ṭhapetum pana vaṭṭati
translated: because it’s an obstacle, it’s allowable to put it aside.

analyzed: anuññāte pana ṭṭhāne uggahetvā anādarā
translated: But if you don’t respect the instruction to put it aside in an allowable place,

original: Sammā anikkhipantassa, hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ.🔽Anuññāte panaṭṭhāne, gahetvā ratanaṃ pana;🔽Nikkhipantassa vā sammā, bhaṇḍaṃ ratanasammataṃ.
analyzed: sammā a nikkhipantassa hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ  anuññāte pana ṭṭhāne gahetvā ratanam pana  nikkhipantassa vā sammā bhaṇḍam ratana sammatam
translated: and you don’t put it away properly, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.🔽But if you put aside a valuable thing in an allowable place,🔽and you put it away properly, or if you put aside an article that’s regarded as valuable,

analyzed: gaṇhantassa ca vissāsam tāvakālikam eva ca
translated: or if you receive it in trust, or if it’s only for a short time,

analyzed: na dosummattaka ādīnam  ratana kathā
translated: or if you’re not aiming at theft, and so on, or if it’s the outcome of trading,🔽The discussion of valuable things is finished.

analyzed: majjhaṇha samayā uddham aruṇuggamataḥ pure
translated: From midday until sunrise the next morning,

analyzed: etasmin antare kālaḥ vikālaḥ ti pavuccati
translated: this period is called “the night” and “the wrong time”.

analyzed: santam bhikkhumanāpucchā vikāle paccayam vinā
translated: When it is a monk, when there is no asking, when it is the wrong time, when there is no reason,

original: Parikkhittassa gāmassa, parikkhepokkame pana.🔽Aparikkhittagāmassa, upacārokkamepi vā;
analyzed: parikkhittassa gāmassa parikkhepa ukkame pana  a parikkhitta gāmassa upacāra ukkame pi vā
translated: When it is a village with an agreed boundary, when crossing the boundary,🔽When it is a village without an agreed boundary, when crossing the area of influence,

original: Dukkaṭaṃ paṭhame pāde, pācitti dutiye siyā.
analyzed: dukkaṭam paṭhame pāde pācitti dutiye siyā
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct when the first foot is lifted, and an offense entailing confession when the second foot is lifted.

original: Atha sambahulā gāmaṃ, vikāle pavisanti ce;
analyzed: atha sambahulāḥ gāmam vikāle pavisanti ce
translated: If a number of monks enter a village without asking permission,

analyzed: āpucchitvā ava gantabbam aññam aññam na ca aññathā
translated: they should enter together, and not otherwise.

original: Gacchanti ce tato aññaṃ, tato aññanti vaṭṭati;
analyzed: gacchanti ce tatas aññam tatas aññanti vaṭṭati
translated: If they go to another village from that one, it is allowable;

original: Puna āpucchane kiccaṃ, natthi gāmasatepi ca.
analyzed: punar āpucchane kiccam natthi ca
translated: but there is no need to ask permission again, even for a hundred villages.

analyzed: ussāham vihāra atthāya niggatā
translated: If they have relaxed their effort and have gone out for the purpose of staying in a monastery,

original: Pavisanti sace aññaṃ, pucchitabbaṃ tu antarā.🔽Katvā kulaghare bhatta- kiccaṃ aññattha vā pana;
analyzed: pavisanti sace aññam pucchitabbam tu antarā  katvā kulaghare bhatta kiccam aññattha vā pana
translated: but if they enter another village, they should ask permission on the way.🔽If they have done a duty in a family or elsewhere,

original: Sace caritukāmo yo, sappibhikkhāya vā siyā.
analyzed: sace caritu kāmaḥ yaḥ sappi bhikkhāya vā siyā
translated: or if they wish to wander for alms or for rice porridge,

original: Āpucchitvāva gantabbaṃ, passe ce bhikkhu labbhati;
analyzed: āpucchitvā ava gantabbam passe ce bhikkhu labbhati
translated: they should go after asking permission, if they see a monk;

original: Asante pana natthīti, gantabbaṃ tu yathāsukhaṃ.
analyzed: asante pana natthi iti gantabbam tu yathāsukham
translated: but if there is none, there is no offense, and they may go as they like.

original: Otaritvā mahāvīthiṃ, bhikkhuṃ yadi ca passati;
analyzed: otaritvā mahā vīthim bhikkhum yadi ca passati
translated: If, after descending to the main road, they see a monk,

analyzed: na atthi āpucchane kiccam caritabbam yathāsukham
translated: There’s no need to inform, One may go as one likes.

analyzed: gāma majjhena maggena gacchantassa iva bhikkhunaḥ
translated: If a monk is walking on a path Through the middle of a village,

analyzed: carissāmi iti uppanne tela bhikkhāya mānase
translated: And the thought occurs to him, “I’ll go for alms,”

original: Āpucchitvāva gantabbaṃ, passe ce bhikkhu vijjati;
analyzed: āpucchitvā ava gantabbam passe ce bhikkhu vijjati
translated: He should inform, if he sees a monk.

original: Anokkamma carantassa, maggā āpucchanena kiṃ?🔽Tikapācittiyaṃ, kāle, vikāloyanti saññino;
analyzed: an ukkamma carantassa maggāḥ āpucchanena kim  tika pācittiyam kāle vikāloyanti saññinaḥ
translated: What’s the point of informing about the path For one who goes without informing?🔽There’s an offense entailing confession for doing it at the wrong time, If one perceives it as the wrong time.

analyzed: kāle vematikassa api hoti āpatti dukkaṭam
translated: There’s an offense of wrong conduct for one who is unsure, If one perceives it as the right time.

original: Āpucchitvāva santaṃ vā, anāpucchā asantakaṃ;🔽Kicce accāyike vāpi, pavisantassa bhikkhuno.🔽Gacchato antarārāmaṃ, bhikkhunīnaṃ upassayaṃ;
analyzed: āpucchitvā ava santam vai an āpucchāḥ asantakam  kicce accāyike vā api pavisantassa bhikkhuno  gacchataḥ antarārāmam bhikkhunīnam upassayam
translated: One should inform if there is, And without informing if there isn’t.🔽For a monk who is entering For an important duty,🔽Or for one who is going to a monastery, To a dwelling for nuns,

analyzed: tathā āsana sālam vā titthiyānam upassayam
translated: Or to a sitting hall, Or to a dwelling for monastics of another religion,

analyzed: siyā gāmena maggaḥ ce an āpatta āpadā supi
translated: If the path is through a village, There’s no offense even without informing.

original: Samuṭṭhānādayo sabbe, kathinena samā matā.🔽Na kevalamanāpucchā, abandhitvā ca bandhanaṃ;
analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ādayo sabbe kathinena samā matā  na kevalam anāpucchā a bandhitvā ca bandhanam
translated: The origins, etc., are all the same as for the kaṭhina cloth.🔽Not only for one who doesn’t inform, But also for one who doesn’t fasten a strap,

analyzed: saṅghāṭim
translated: Or for one who doesn’t put on the outer robe, There’s an offense of wrong conduct for going.

analyzed: vikāla gāma ppavesana kathā
translated: The discussion of entering at the wrong time.

analyzed: aṭṭhi danta mayam sūci gharam vā api visāṇa jam
translated: A needle case made of bone or ivory or horn,

original: Kārāpane ca karaṇe, bhikkhuno hoti dukkaṭaṃ.🔽Lābhe bhedanakaṃ tassa, pācittiyamudīritaṃ;🔽Aññassatthāya karaṇe, tathā kārāpanepi ca.
analyzed: kārāpane ca karaṇe bhikkhunaḥ hoti dukkaṭam  lābhe bhedanakam tassa pācittiyam udīritam  aññassa atthāya karaṇe tathā kārāpane pi ca
translated: In making it or having it made, there is an offense of wrong conduct for a monk.

original: Aññena ca kataṃ laddhā, dukkaṭaṃ paribhuñjato;🔽Anāpattāraṇike vidhe, gaṇṭhikañjanikāsupi.🔽Dakapuñchaniyā vāsi-jaṭe ummattakādino;🔽Samuṭṭhānādayo nayā, sañcarittasamā matā.🔽Sūcigharakathā.🔽Navaṃ mañcampi pīṭhaṃ vā, kārāpentena bhikkhunā;🔽Aṭṭhaṅgulappamāṇena, sugataṅgulato pana.🔽Kārāpetabbamevaṃ tu, ṭhapetvā heṭṭhimāṭaniṃ;🔽Sacchedā tassa pācitti, tamatikkamato siyā.
analyzed: aññena ca katam laddhā dukkaṭam paribhuñjato  an āpatta āraṇike vidhe gaṇṭhi kañjanikā supi  daka puñchaniyā vāsi jaṭe ummattaka ādinaḥ  samuṭṭhāna ādayaḥ nayā sañcaritta samā matā  sūcighara kathā  navam mañcam pi pīṭham vā kārāpentena bhikkhunā  aṭṭha aṅgula ppamāṇena sugata ṅgulato pana  kārāpetabbam evam tu ṭhapetvā heṭṭhima aṭanim  sa chedā tassa pācitti tam atikkamataḥ siyā
translated: If he exchanges it for something else, it is said that there is an offense entailing confession.

analyzed: aññassa atthāya karaṇe tathā kārāpane pi ca
translated: In having it made for the benefit of another, and in having it made for himself,

original: Aññena ca kataṃ laddhā, dukkaṭaṃ paribhuñjato.
analyzed: aññena ca katam laddhā dukkaṭam paribhuñjato
translated: And if he gets one made by another, there is an offense of wrong conduct in using it.

analyzed: anāpatti pamāṇena karontassa appamāṇikam

analyzed: labhitvā tassa pādesu chinditvā paribhuñjataḥ
