analyzed: kopetum dhammikam kammam paṭikkoseyya dukkaṭam
translated: To make angry, a legitimate transaction, To cancel, a wrong-doing;

analyzed: chandam vā kāyasāmaggim a dentassa api dukkaṭam
translated: Or not to give consent, or to be physically present, Is also a wrong-doing.

original: Hoti pañcavidho saṅgho, catuvaggādibhedato;🔽So ca kattabbakammassa, vasena paridīpito.
analyzed: pañcavidhaḥ saṅghaḥ catu vagga ādi bhedataḥ  so ca kattabba kammassa vasena paridīpitaḥ
translated: There is a fivefold Saṅgha, Classified as a group of four, and so on;🔽And that is demonstrated By means of the transactions that may be done.

analyzed: pavāraṇam tathā abbhānam kammañca upasampadam
translated: The invitation ceremony, the lifting of the invitation ceremony, And the transaction of the full ordination;

original: Ṭhapetvā catuvaggena, akattabbaṃ na vijjati.🔽Pañcavaggena abbhānaṃ, majjhadesūpasampadaṃ;
analyzed: ṭhapetvā catuvaggena a kattabbam na vijjati  pañcavaggena abbhānam majjhadesu upasampadam
translated: Except for the full ordination, which may not be done By a group of less than ten, the rest may be done by a group of four.🔽The lifting of the invitation ceremony, and the full ordination In the Middle Land,

original: Dasavaggena abbhānaṃ, vinā sabbaṃ tu vaṭṭati.🔽Kammaṃ vīsativaggena, na kattabbaṃ na kiñcipi;
analyzed: dasa vaggena abbhānam vinā sabbam tu vaṭṭati  kammam vīsati vaggena na kattabbam na kiñcipi
translated: May be done by a group of five. All the rest may be done by a group of ten.🔽A transaction by a group of twenty May not be done at all.

analyzed: ūne na adhike atireka tā
translated: To inform of less than the required number is an offense of wrong-doing; To inform of more than the required number is invalid.

original: Cattāro pakatattāva, kammappattāti dīpitā;🔽Catuvaggena kattabbe, sesesu ca ayaṃ nayo.
analyzed: cattāro kamma ppattā ati dīpitā  catu vaggena kattabbe sesesu ca ayam nayaḥ
translated: Four are declared to be competent, And fit to do transactions;🔽In a transaction that may be done by a group of four, And in the rest, this is the method.

analyzed: catu vagga ādi kattabbam katvā a saṃvāsa puggalam
translated: Having done a transaction that may be done By a group of four, and so on, with a person who is not in communion,

analyzed: gaṇapūram karontassa katam kuppati dukkaṭam
translated: And then making up the quorum, It is invalid, and there is a wrong-doing.

analyzed: parivāsa ādi kamme pi tatraṭṭham gaṇapūrakam
translated: In the case of the trial period, and so on, One who is present in the quorum,

original: Katvā pana karontānaṃ, tathā, sesaṃ tu vaṭṭati.
analyzed: katvā pana karontānam tathā sesam tu vaṭṭati
translated: But when they do, it is allowable to do the rest in the same way.

analyzed: uposatha khandhaka kathā
translated: The discussion of the chapter on the observance day is finished.

analyzed: vassūpanāyika khandhaka kathā
translated: The chapter on entering for the rainy-season residence🔽There are two rainy-season residences,

analyzed: purimā pacchimā ca ati duve
translated: The first and the last;

analyzed: ālayaḥ vā vacībhedaḥ kattabbaḥ upagacchatā
translated: The dwelling place, or a schism in the Sangha,🔽Should be known by one who enters.

analyzed: vassūpagamanam vā api an upagacchataḥ
translated: Or else, if one who knows🔽Does not enter for the rainy-season residence,🔽Or if one who has completed the rainy-season residence

analyzed: vā carantassa api dukkaṭam
translated: Walks forth, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽In a hollow tree, under a roof-cover,

analyzed: rukkhassa su sire chatte cāṭi chava kuṭīsu vā
translated: In a hut of leaves, or out in the open—

original: Ajjhokāsepi vā vassaṃ, upagantuṃ na vaṭṭati.🔽Vassacchede anāpatti, antarāyo sace siyā;
analyzed: ajjhokāse pi vā vassam upagantum na vaṭṭati  vassa chede anāpatti antarāyaḥ sace siyā
translated: It is not allowable to enter for the rainy-season residence in any of these.🔽There is no offense if there is an obstruction;

analyzed: chinna vassassa bhikkhussa vāritā ava pavāraṇā
translated: The invitation of a monk who has broken the rainy-season residence is suspended.

analyzed: mātā pitūnam pana dassana attham  pañcannam atthe sahadhammikānam
translated: In order to see one’s mother and father,🔽In order to see the five sick monks,

analyzed: daṭṭhum gilānam tad upaṭṭhakānam
translated: In order to see a sick monk or his attendant,

analyzed: bhatta ādi na isam pariyesana attham  tathā anabhiratam gantvā
translated: In order to search for food, etc. for them.🔽Having gone to one who is not pleased,🔽To settle a dispute that has arisen,

original: Diṭṭhiṃ vā tassa kukkuccaṃ, vinodessāmahanti vā.
analyzed: diṭṭhim vā tassa kukkuccam vinodessāmahanti vā
translated: To dispel his view or his uncertainty.

analyzed: evam satta aha kiccena bhikkhunā vinayaññunā
translated: Thus, one who is skilled in the Monastic Law, who can settle a legal issue within seven days,

original: Apesitepi gantabbaṃ, pageva pahite pana.🔽Vassaṃ upagatenettha, animantitabhikkhunā;
analyzed: apesite pi gantabbam pagā iva pahite pana  vassam upagatena ittha a nimantita bhikkhunā
translated: “If a monk who knows the Monastic Law Has business for seven days, He may go even if he’s not appointed, And all the more if he is appointed.

original: Dhammassa savanatthāya, gantuṃ pana na vaṭṭati.
analyzed: dhammassa savana tthāya gantum pana na vaṭṭati
translated: “If a monk who has entered the rains residence Is invited by a monk, He may not go to listen to the Teaching, Even if he’s invited.

analyzed: asukam nāma divasam sannipātaḥ bhavissati
translated: “On such-and-such a day there will be a gathering,”

original: Iccevaṃ katikā pubbaṃ, katā ce pana vaṭṭati.
analyzed: icca evam katikā pubbam katā ce pana vaṭṭati
translated: If such a prior agreement has been made, then it’s allowable.

analyzed: dhovissāmi rajissāmi na vaṭṭati
translated: “I’ll wash, I’ll sew, I’ll make a robe,” it’s not allowable;

analyzed: pahiṇanti ca vaṭṭati
translated: But if the teacher or preceptor sends him, it’s allowable.

analyzed: uddesa ādīnam atthāya gantum nā iva ca vaṭṭati
translated: “To go for the purpose of recitation, etc., is not allowable;

analyzed: garūnam dassana tthāya gantum labhati puggalaḥ
translated: But a person may go to see his preceptors.

analyzed: sace ācariyaḥ ajja mā gacchāhi iti bhāsati
translated: If the teacher says, ‘Don’t go today,’

analyzed: ratti chede paridīpitā
translated: It’s been declared that there’s no offense if the night is interrupted.

analyzed: yassa kassaci ñātissa upaṭṭhāka kulassa vā
translated: “If he goes to see a relative Or a family that supports him,

analyzed: gacchataḥ dassana tthāya ratti chede ca dukkaṭam
translated: And the night is interrupted, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: āgamissāmi ajjā iva gantvā aham gāmakanti ca
translated: ‘I’ll go today to the village to visit,’

original: Sace pāpuṇituṃ gacchaṃ, na sakkoteva vaṭṭati.🔽Vaje satthepi nāvāyaṃ, tīsu ṭhānesu bhikkhuno;
analyzed: sace pāpuṇitum gaccham na vaṭṭati  vaje satthe pi nāvāyam tīsu ṭhānesu bhikkhuno
translated: If he goes to reach it, it is not allowable for him to stay there.🔽In a vehicle, on a ship, in three places,

analyzed: vassa chede anāpatti pavāretum ca vaṭṭati
translated: The monk has no offense for breaking the rainy season residence, and it is allowable for him to do the invitation ceremony.

analyzed: sati paccaya vekalle sarīra āphāsu tāya vā
translated: If there is a reason for leaving, or if he is ill,

analyzed: esa iva antarāyaḥ ti vassam chetvā api pakkame
translated: This is indeed an obstacle, and he may go away after breaking the rainy season residence.

original: Yena kenantarāyena, vassaṃ nopagato hi yo;
analyzed: yena kena antarāyena vassam na upagataḥ hi yaḥ
translated: Whoever does not enter the rainy season residence because of an obstacle,

analyzed: dutiyā upagantabbā chinna vassena vā pana
translated: Must enter it a second time, or else he is one who has broken the rainy season residence.

original: Vassaṃ anupagantvā vā, tadaheva ca gacchati;
analyzed: an upagantvā vā tat aha iva ca gacchati
translated: If he does not enter the rainy season residence, or if he goes away on the same day,

original: Bahiddhā eva sattāhaṃ, upagantvāpi vā pana.
analyzed: bahiddhā eva sattāham upagantvā api vā pana
translated: Or if he goes away after seven days, or if he goes away after entering it,

original: Vītināmeti ce tassa, purimāpi na vijjati;
analyzed: ce tassa purimā api na vijjati
translated: If he spends the rainy season, there is no offense for the first,

original: Paṭissave ca bhikkhussa, hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: paṭissave ca bhikkhussa hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ
translated: But there is an offense of wrong conduct for the monk who gives his consent.

original: Vassaṃ panupagantvā ca, uṭṭhāpetvā na cāruṇaṃ;
analyzed: vassam ca uṭṭhāpetvā na ca aruṇam
translated: But if he enters the rainy season residence, and then leaves without taking it down,

original: Gacchato pana sattāha-karaṇeneva bhikkhuno.🔽Antoyeva ca sattāhaṃ, nivattantassa tassa tu;
analyzed: gacchataḥ pana satta aha karaṇena iva bhikkhuno  ca sattāham nivattantassa tassa tu
translated: If he goes away after seven days,🔽But if he returns within seven days,

original: Anāpattīti ko vādo, vasitvā bahi gacchato.
analyzed: anāpatti iti kaḥ vādaḥ vasitvā bahi gacchataḥ
translated: What need is there to say that there is no offense for him if he stays outside and then returns?

original: “Vasissāmīdha vassa”nti, ālayo yadi vijjati;🔽Nopetasatiyā vassaṃ, tena senāsanaṃ pana.
analyzed: vasissāmi idha vassanti ālayaḥ yadi vijjati  na upeta satiyā vassam tena senāsanam pana
translated: “I’ll stay here for the rainy season,” if there’s a dwelling place,🔽but not if he’s not determined to stay for the rainy season.

original: Gahitaṃ suggahitaṃ hoti, chinnavasso na hoti so;
analyzed: gahitam su gahitam hoti chinna vassaḥ na hoti so
translated: If he takes it, it’s properly taken, and he hasn’t entered the rains residence.

original: Labhateva pavāretuṃ, na doso koci vijjati.
analyzed: labhatā iva pavāretum na dosaḥ koci vijjati
translated: He may do the invitation ceremony, and there’s no offense at all.

analyzed: imasmin vihāre temāsam imam vassam upemi ti
translated: “I’ll stay in this dwelling for three months, for this rainy season,”

original: Nicchārite ca tikkhattuṃ, vassaṃ upagato siyā.
analyzed: nicchārite ca tikkhattum vassam upagataḥ siyā
translated: and he’s entered the rains residence three times.

original: Ādiṃ tu navamiṃ katvā, gantuṃ vaṭṭati bhikkhuno;
analyzed: ādim tu navamim katvā gantum vaṭṭati bhikkhuno
translated: Starting from the ninth day, it’s allowable for a monk to go;

original: Āgacchatu ca pacchā so, mā vā doso na vijjati.
analyzed: āgacchatu ca pacchā saḥ mā vā dosaḥ na vijjati
translated: and he may return later, but there’s no offense at all.

analyzed: vassūpanāyika khandhaka kathā
translated: The section on the rainy season residence is finished.

analyzed: pavāraṇa khandhaka kathā
translated: The section on the invitation ceremony

analyzed: cātuddasī pañcadasī sāmaggī ca pavāraṇā
translated: The invitation ceremony on the fourteenth, the fifteenth, and the invitation ceremony of unity,

original: Tevācī dvekavācī ca, saṅghe ca gaṇapuggale.
analyzed: tevācī dve kavācī ca saṅghe ca gaṇa puggale
translated: The invitation ceremony with one announcement, the invitation ceremony with three announcements, in the Sangha, in a group, and in the presence of an individual—

original: Etā pana munindena, vuttā nava pavāraṇā;🔽Tīṇi kammāni muñcitvā, anteneva pavāraye.🔽Pubbakiccaṃ samāpetvā, pattakalle samānite;
analyzed: etā pana munindena vuttā nava pavāraṇā  tīṇi kammāni muñcitvā antena iva pavāraye  pubba kiccam samāpetvā patta kalle samānite
translated: These nine kinds of invitation ceremony were spoken by the Lord of the sages.🔽Except for the three legal procedures, one should do the invitation ceremony with the last one.🔽After completing the preliminary duties, when the right time has arrived,

original: Ñattiṃ ṭhapetvā saṅghena, kattabbā hi pavāraṇā.
analyzed: ñattim ṭhapetvā saṅghena kattabbā hi pavāraṇā
translated: the invitation ceremony should be done by the Sangha, except for the motion.

analyzed: pavārentesu theresu nisīdeyya navo pana
translated: When the senior monks have invited, the junior should sit down.

original: Sayaṃ yāva pavāreyya, tāva ukkuṭikañhi so.
analyzed: sayam yāva pavāreyya tāva ukkuṭikan hi saḥ
translated: He should invite as long as he likes, but he should be cross-legged.

original: Ñattiṃ vatvā pavāreyyuṃ, cattāro vā tayopi vā;
analyzed: ñattim vatvā pavāreyyum cattāraḥ vā vā
translated: They should invite after having made the announcement, either four or three.

analyzed: pubba kiccam samāpetvā ekāvāse vasanti ce
translated: Having completed the preliminary duties, they live in a monastery with one another.

original: Aññamaññaṃ pavāreyyuṃ, vinā ñattiṃ duve janā;
analyzed: aññam aññam pavāreyyum vinā ñattim duve janā
translated: They should invite one another, two people without a motion.

analyzed: adhiṭṭheyya pana ekaḥ api sesā saṅgha pavāraṇā
translated: But one should determine, the rest is the invitation of the Sangha.

analyzed: pavārite ca saṅghasmim kareyya anāgataḥ pana
translated: And when the Sangha has invited, one who has come later

analyzed: a vuṭṭhaḥ chinna vassaḥ vā pārisuddhi uposatham
translated: should do the observance-day ceremony of purity if he has not left or has completed the rainy season.

original: Pañca yasmiṃ panāvāse, cattāro vā tayopi vā;
analyzed: pañca yasmin cattāraḥ vā vā
translated: But in a residence where there are five, four, or three,

analyzed: ekekassa haritvāna samaṇā te pavāraṇam
translated: the monks should invite, each one going to another.

original: Aññamaññaṃ pavārenti, sace āpatti dukkaṭaṃ;🔽Sesaṃ uposathe vutta-nayenidha naye budho.
analyzed: aññam aññam pavārenti sace āpatti dukkaṭam  sesam uposathe naye budhaḥ
translated: If they invite one another, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.🔽The rest is to be conducted according to the method given for the observance day.

analyzed: pārisuddhi ppadānena sucim
translated: By means of the purity announcement, one should purify oneself.

analyzed: chanda dānena saṅghassa sabbam sādheti nattano
translated: By means of the announcement of consent, one accomplishes everything for oneself.

analyzed: tasmā pana ubhinnam pi
translated: Therefore, for the success of the duties of both, here,

analyzed: pārisuddhi pi dātabbā chandam dentena bhikkhunā
translated: And the purity should be given to him.🔽If he gives his consent, the purity of many

analyzed: chanda ekena bahūnam pi
translated: Should be given to him.🔽Consent given in succession

analyzed: chandaḥ na gacchati
translated: Does not purify.🔽If he takes consent, purity,

original: Chandaṃ vā pārisuddhiṃ vā, gahetvā vā pavāraṇaṃ;
analyzed: chandam vā pārisuddhim vā gahetvā vā pavāraṇam
translated: Or the invitation ceremony,

analyzed: sāmaṇera ādi bhāvam vā paṭijāneyya hārako
translated: Or if he admits to being a novice monk, etc., he has taken it.🔽If he does not reach the Sangha,

original: Sace so saṅghamappatvā, vibbhameyya mareyya vā;
analyzed: sace saḥ saṅgham ap patvā vibbhameyya mareyya vā
translated: But disrobes or dies,

original: Nāhaṭañceva taṃ sabbaṃ, patvā cevaṃ siyāhaṭaṃ.
analyzed: nāhaṭam ca iva tat sabbam patvā ca ivam siyāhaṭam
translated: Then it is as if it was not taken.🔽But if he reaches the Sangha, but is heedless,

original: Saṅghaṃ patvā pamatto vā, sutto vā khittacittako;
analyzed: saṅgham patvā pamattaḥ vā suttaḥ vā khitta cittakaḥ
translated: Asleep, or distracted,

original: Nāroceti anāpatti, hoti sañcicca dukkaṭaṃ.🔽Ye te vipassanāyuttā, rattindivamatanditā;
analyzed: na āroceti anāpatti hoti sañcid ca dukkaṭam  ye te vipassanā yuttāḥ
translated: And does not announce it, there is no offense. But if he does it on purpose, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽Those who are devoted to insight,🔽Who are diligent throughout the day and night,

analyzed: pubbaratta apararattam vipassana parāyaṇā
translated: Who are intent on insight🔽In the first and last periods of the night,

original: Laddhaphāsuvihārānaṃ, siyā na parihāniti;🔽Pavāraṇāya saṅgāho, vutto kattikamāsake.
analyzed: siyā na parihāniti  pavāraṇāya saṅgāhaḥ vutto kattika māsake
translated: And who have attained ease, do not fall away.🔽The invitation ceremony is included🔽In the month of Kattika.

analyzed: pavāraṇa khandhaka kathā
translated: The discussion of the chapter on the invitation ceremony is finished.

analyzed: camma khandhaka kathā
translated: The chapter on leather🔽The skin of the black antelope

analyzed: eḷaka aja migānam tu cammam vaṭṭati bhikkhunaḥ
translated: Is allowable for a monk,

analyzed: rohita iṇi kuraṅgānam
translated: Of the red deer, the spotted deer, And of the mother of the spotted deer.

analyzed: ṭhapetvā cammam etesam aññam dukkaṭa vatthukam
translated: Excepting their hides, all the rest Of the things that are prohibited are wrong.

analyzed: thavika upāhane sabbam cammam
translated: All the hides of human beings are allowable for shoes.

analyzed: vaṭṭanti majjhime dese na guṇaṅguṇa upāhanā
translated: In the Middle Country shoes with turned-up tips are not allowable,

analyzed: vaṭṭanti antoārāme sabbattha api ca rogino
translated: But in the border countries they are allowable everywhere, And also for the sick anywhere.

analyzed: puṭa khallaka baddhā ca tathā iva pāli guṇṭhimā
translated: And also those bound with strips of cloth, And also those with strips of cloth round the ankles,

analyzed: tūla puṇṇāḥ na vaṭṭanti sabba nīla ādayaḥ api ca
translated: Those stuffed with cotton are not allowable, Nor those all black, and so on.

analyzed: citrā upāhanā
translated: Shoes with variegated patterns, and those with a border like a ram’s horn,

original: Na ca vaṭṭanti morassa, piñchena parisibbitā.
analyzed: na ca vaṭṭanti morassa piñchena parisibbitā
translated: And those covered with peacock’s tail feathers are not allowable.

analyzed: majjāraka āḷaka ulūka sīha byagghudda dīpinam
translated: Those made of the skin of the spotted antelope, the black antelope, the kolūpa deer, the lion, the tiger, the leopard,

original: Ajinassa ca cammena, na vaṭṭati parikkhaṭā.
analyzed: ajinassa ca cammena na vaṭṭati parikkhaṭā
translated: And the ruru deer are not allowable when they have been made up.

original: Puṭādiṃ apanetvā vā, chinditvā vāpi sabbaso;
analyzed: puṭa ādim apanetvā vā chinditvā vā api sabbaso
translated: Or having removed the lining, Or having cut it all up,

original: Vaṇṇabhedaṃ tathā katvā, dhāretabbā upāhanā.🔽Sabbāpi pana dhāretuṃ, na ca vaṭṭanti pādukā;
analyzed: vaṇṇa bhedam tathā katvā dhāretabbā upāhanā  sabbā api pana dhāretum na ca vaṭṭanti pādukā
translated: And having made it a different colour, The shoes should be kept.🔽But all shoes with soles are not allowable to wear,

analyzed: ṭhapetvā tattha passāva vacca ācamana pādukā
translated: Excepting the shoes for passing urine, the shoes for defecation, and the shoes for washing the feet.

analyzed: pallaṅkam uccāsayana saññitam
translated: A couch and a chair, and what is called a high couch,

analyzed: atikkanta pamāṇam tu sevamānassa dukkaṭam
translated: If used when they exceed the right measure, there is an offense of wrong-doing.

original: Gonakaṃ kuttakaṃ cittaṃ, paṭikaṃ paṭalikampi ca;🔽Ekantalomiṃ vikatiṃ, tūlikaṃ uddalomikaṃ.🔽Kaṭṭissaṃ pana koseyyaṃ, hatthiassarathattharaṃ;🔽Kadalimigapavara-paccattharaṇakampi ca.🔽Heṭṭhā rattavitānassa, dvidhā rattūpadhānakaṃ;🔽Akappiyamidaṃ sabbaṃ, dukkaṭaṃ paribhuñjato.🔽Heṭṭhā akappiye paccatthare sati na vaṭṭati;🔽Uddhaṃ setavitānampi, tasmiṃ asati vaṭṭati.

translated: A woolen, a cotton, a linen, a silk, a wool-cotton, a wool-silk,

analyzed: āsandim pana pallaṅkam ṭhapetvā tūlikam pi ca  sesam pana ca sabbam pi labhate gihi santakam  dhamma āsane anāpatti bhattagge pi nisīdituṃ  bhūmattharaṇake tattha sayitum pi ca vaṭṭati  camma khandhaka kathā

analyzed: vuttā gahapatissā api
translated: And the house of a householder who has been asked, And the one who has been agreed upon by the owners,

analyzed: gonisādī iti kappiyāḥ catasso honti bhūmiyaḥ
translated: And the one who is suitable for a cowherd, and so on: These are the four kinds of suitable grounds.

original: Saṅghassa santakaṃ gehaṃ, santakaṃ bhikkhunopi vā;
analyzed: saṅghassa santakam geham santakam bhikkhuno api vā
translated: A house belonging to the Sangha, Or to a bhikkhunī,

analyzed: kappiyam pana kattabbam sahaseyya ppahonakam
translated: Is suitable for work, And for sleeping in.

analyzed: ṭhapetvā bhikkhu maññehi dinnam kappiya bhūmiyā
translated: Except for a bhikkhu’s dwelling, Which has been given on a suitable ground,

analyzed: atthāya santakam tesam geham gahapate vidam
translated: For the benefit of those who are staying there, This house belongs to the householder.

original: Sā hi sammutikā nāma, yā hi saṅghena sammatā;🔽Kammavācamavatvā vā, vaṭṭatevāpalokanaṃ.
analyzed: sā hi sammutikā nāma yā hi saṅghena sammatā  vā
translated: Because it is agreed upon, It is called “agreed upon”.

analyzed: paṭhama iṭṭhaka pāsāṇa thambha ādi ṭṭhapane pana
translated: After the announcement of the legal procedure, Or after the announcement of the motion, it is also allowable.

original: “Kappiyakuṭiṃ karomā”ti, vadantehi samantato.🔽Ukkhipitvā ṭhapentesu, āmasitvā paresu vā;
analyzed: kappiya kuṭim karoma ati vadantehi samantataḥ  ukkhipitvā ṭhapentesu āmasitvā paresu vā
translated: If they say, “We’re making a suitable hut,”🔽And they lift up and put down the first brick, Or the first stone, or the first post,

analyzed: sayam eva ukkhipitvā vā ṭhapeyyuḥ sā avanantikā
translated: Or if they lift it up themselves, And put it down on the agreed upon ground,

analyzed: iṭṭhaka ādi patiṭṭhānam bhikkhūnam vadatam pana
translated: Or if they put down the foundation of bricks, And so on, while the bhikkhus are speaking,

analyzed: vācāya pariyosānam sama kālam tu vaṭṭati
translated: The end of the announcement, And the placing, are allowable at the same time.

analyzed: ārāmaḥ a parikkhittaḥ sakalaḥ vā
translated: A monastery that is not enclosed, Or most of it,

analyzed: duvidhaḥ api ca viññūhi gonisādī iti vuccati
translated: The two kinds are called “cow-pen” and so on by the wise.

original: Etā pana catassopi, honti kappiyabhūmiyo;🔽Ettha pakkañca vutthañca, sabbaṃ vaṭṭati āmisaṃ.🔽Ussāvanantikā yā sā, thambhādīsu adhiṭṭhitā;
analyzed: etāḥ pana catasso api honti kappiya bhūmiyaḥ  ettha pakkam ca vuttham ca sabbam vaṭṭati āmisam  ussāvana ntikā yā sā thambha ādīsu adhiṭṭhitā
translated: But all four are allowable sites,🔽And there all food is allowable, cooked or stored.🔽That which is called “with prior announcement” is determined on posts and so on.

original: Thambhādīsvapanītesu, tadaññesupi tiṭṭhati.🔽Apanītesu sabbesu, siyā jahitavatthukā;
analyzed: thambha ādīsu apanītesu tad aññesu pi tiṭṭhati  apanītesu sabbesu siyā jahita vatthukā
translated: When the posts and so on are removed, it remains for the rest.🔽When all are removed, it is as though the site had been given up.

analyzed: gonisādī parikkhittā sesā chadana nāsato
translated: The cow-pen and so on are surrounded, the rest are not.

original: Bhikkhuṃ ṭhapetvā aññesaṃ, hatthato ca paṭiggaho;
analyzed: bhikkhum ṭhapetvā aññesam hatthataḥ ca paṭiggahaḥ
translated: Except for a monk, there is receiving from others’ hands,

original: Tesañca sannidhi anto- vuttaṃ bhikkhussa vaṭṭati.
analyzed: tesam ca sannidhi antar vuttam bhikkhussa vaṭṭati
translated: And storing is allowable for a monk of what is said by them.

original: Bhikkhussa bhikkhuniyā vā, santakaṃ saṅghikampi vā;
analyzed: bhikkhussa bhikkhuniyā vā santakam saṅghikam pi vā
translated: What belongs to a monk or nun, or to the Community,

original: Antovutthañca pakkañca, ubhinnaṃ na ca vaṭṭati.
analyzed: antar vuttham ca pakkam ca ubhinnam na ca vaṭṭati
translated: Cooked or stored, is not allowable for both.

analyzed: a kappa kuṭiyā vuttham sappi ādi vimissitam
translated: What is stored in an unallowable hut, mixed with ghee and so on,

analyzed: antovuttha nti niddiṭṭham paṭhamam kālika dvayam
translated: Is called “stored” and is the first pair of seven-day periods.

analyzed: tehi iva sappi ādīhi bhikkhunā yāvajīvikam
translated: With ghee and so on, a monk’s is for life,

original: Pakkaṃ taṃ pana sattāhaṃ, vaṭṭateva nirāmisaṃ.
analyzed: pakkam tam pana satta aham vaṭṭatā iva nirāmisam
translated: But that cooked by him is allowable for seven days if it is not mixed with any of the five cooked foods.

analyzed: sace āmisa saṃsaṭṭham pakkam tam paribhuñjati
translated: If it’s cooked with food, he may eat it.

analyzed: antovutthañca bhiyyopi sāma pakkañca bhuñjati
translated: He may eat what’s been stored indoors, what’s been cooked by another, what’s been cooked together.

analyzed: yāva kālikam āhāraḥ pānakam yāma kālikam
translated: Food for a specific time, a drink, and what’s for two hours,

analyzed: sattāhakālikam nāma sappi ādika pañcakam
translated: What’s for seven days is the five things beginning with ghee.

analyzed: sesam pana halidda ādi bhesajjam yāvajīvikam
translated: The rest, such as turmeric, is medicine for life.

analyzed: catudhā kālikāḥ vuttāḥ udakam hoti akālikam
translated: The four kinds of allowable times have been spoken of; water is allowable for the time being.

analyzed: paṭiggaha vasena iva kāla atītā tikālikā
translated: Because of receiving, what’s passed the allowable time is of three kinds:

original: Honti dosakarā bhuttā, abhuttaṃ tatiyampi ca.
analyzed: honti dosa karāḥ bhuttāḥ abhuttam tatiyam pi ca
translated: It causes offense if eaten, and also the third if not eaten.

original: Ambaṃ jambu ca cocañca, mocañca madhu muddikā;
analyzed: ambam jambu ca cocam ca mocam ca madhu muddikā
translated: Mango, rose-apple, wood-apple, breadfruit, honey, sugar,

analyzed: sālu phārusakam ca ati pānakam aṭṭhadhā matam
translated: Sāl-tree fruit, and phārusaka: these are considered the eight drinks.

analyzed: pānaka ttham anuññātam phalam pakkam ca āmakam
translated: The fruit that’s allowed as drink is ripe or unripe,

original: Pānahetu paṭikkhitto, savatthukapaṭiggaho.🔽Ambapakkaṃ sukoṭṭetvā, madditvā udake pana;
analyzed: pāna hetu paṭikkhittaḥ savatthuka paṭiggaho  amba pakkam su koṭṭetvā madditvā udake pana
translated: But receiving with a purpose is prohibited for the sake of drink.🔽Having well-pounded ripe mango, having pressed it in water,

original: Pacchā parissavaṃ katvā, pātuṃ vaṭṭati pānakaṃ.
analyzed: pacchā parissavam katvā pātum vaṭṭati pānakam
translated: And afterwards having removed the pulp, the drink is allowable.

analyzed: tu aggi pakkam na vaṭṭati
translated: What’s cooked by the sun is allowable, but what’s cooked by fire is not.

original: Eseva ca nayo sesa-pānakesupi dīpito.🔽Pupphapattaphalucchūnaṃ, cattāro panime rasā;
analyzed: esa iva ca nayaḥ sesa pānakesu pi dīpitaḥ  cattāraḥ panime rasā
translated: And this method is shown for the other drinks as well.🔽The juices of flowers, leaves, fruits, and sprouts,

original: Anuññātā imānaṭṭha, pānāni anujānatā.🔽Sabbo puppharaso vutto, madhukassa rasaṃ vinā;

analyzed: sabbo patta rasaḥ vuttaḥ pakkaḍāka rasam vinā
translated: All the juices of leaves are allowed, except the juice of the date palm.

analyzed: sattannam sa anulomānam dhaññānam phala jam rasam

analyzed: ṭhapetvā anumato sabbaḥ vikāle phala jo raso

analyzed: yāvaka ālika pattānam api sītā udake

analyzed: vikāle pana vaṭṭati  tālam ca nāḷikeram ca panasam ca
translated: And if they are fermented, they are allowed at the wrong time.🔽The palm fruit, the coconut, the breadfruit, the jackfruit,

analyzed: tipusa alābu kumbhaṇḍam tathā pussa phalam pi ca
translated: The tipu, the sala, the bukkha, the kumbhaṇḍa, and the pussa fruit,

analyzed: evam eḷālukam ca ati nava etāni phalāni hi
translated: And the elāluka—these are the nine fruits,

analyzed: aparaṇṇam ca sabbam pi satta dhañña ānulomikam
translated: And all the other fruits are of the seven grains that are in conformity with the rules.
The jujube, the tinduka, the sal, the kosambī, the karamaddaka,

analyzed: mātuluṅga kapittham ca vettam ciñca phalam pi ca
translated: The mātuṅga, the kapittha, the vetta, and the ciñca fruit,

analyzed: phalānam evamādīnam khuddakānam rasaḥ pana
translated: The juice of these and other small fruits,

analyzed: niddiṭṭhaḥ anulomike
translated: Because of the eight drinks, the one in conformity is explained in the one in conformity.

analyzed: sa anulomassa dhaññassa ṭhapetvā phala jam rasam
translated: For the grain in conformity, apart from the juice that comes from the fruit;

analyzed: añño phala rasaḥ natthi a yāma kālikaḥ idha  bhesajja kkhandhaka kathā

analyzed: kathinakkhandhaka kathā
translated: The section on the robe-making ceremony sub-chapter

analyzed: bhikkhūnam vuṭṭhavassānam kathinatthāram abravi

analyzed: kāraṇāḥ muni puṅgavaḥ

analyzed: na ullikhita matta ādi catuvīsati vajjitam
translated: Not one that is just cut up, and so on, not one of the twenty-four kinds of defective robes,

analyzed: cīvaram bhikkhunā ādāya uddharitvā purāṇakam

analyzed: navam adhiṭṭhahitvā ava vattabbam vacasā puna

analyzed: iminā antaravāsena

analyzed: vutte tikkhattum icca ivam kathinam hoti atthatam

analyzed: saṅgham ādāya kathinam iti

analyzed: anumodāmi tīraye

original: Kathinassa ca kiṃ mūlaṃ, kiṃ vatthu kā ca bhūmiyo;

analyzed: aṭṭhadhammavidaḥ bhikkhu kathinatthāram arahati

The preliminary tasks, the determining, the assigning, the robe-making ceremony, the key terms,

analyzed: sibbanam rajanam kappam pubbakiccanti vuccati

translated: The outer robe, the upper robe, and the sarong,🔽The relinquishing, the determining, and the robe-making ceremony itself.

analyzed: pakkamanam ca niṭṭhānam sanniṭṭhānam ca nāsanam
translated: The departing, the completion, the agreement, the loss,

analyzed: savanāsā ca sīmā ca sahubbhārā ti aṭṭhimā
translated: The hearing, the monastery zone, and the consent: these are the eight.

analyzed: kata cīvaram ādāya āvāse nirapekkhakaḥ
translated: Taking the robe that’s been made, not expecting to return to the dwelling,

analyzed: atikkantāya sīmāya hoti pakkamana ntikā
translated: When he has gone beyond the monastery zone, it’s called “at the end of the walk”.

analyzed: vihāre anapekkhako
translated: Taking the robe that’s been made, not expecting to return to the dwelling,

original: Gantvā pana vihāraṃ so, aññaṃ sukhavihārikaṃ.
analyzed: gantvā pana vihāram so aññam sukhavihārikam

analyzed: niṭṭhite cīvare tasmim niṭṭhānantā ati vuccati

analyzed: cīvaram na karissāmi na paccessam

analyzed: evam tu dhura nikkhepe sanniṭṭhā anantikā matā

analyzed: kathina chādanam laddhā na paccessanti ce gato

original: Karontasseva naṭṭhaṃ vā, daḍḍhaṃ vā nāsanantikā.

analyzed: laddha anisaṃso sa apekkhaḥ bahi sīmam gataḥ pana

analyzed: suṇāti cantar ubbhāram sā hoti savanantikā

analyzed: āsāya chinna mattāya āsā avacchedikā matā
translated: The cutting off of hope is reckoned as the cutting off of expectation.

analyzed: tassa so kathinuddhāro sahubbhāro ti vuccati

analyzed: pakkamanam ca niṭṭhānam sanniṭṭhānam ca sīmato

analyzed: cattāro

analyzed: na āsanam savanam ca iva āsā acchedikā api ca
translated: The loss, the hearing, and the cutting off of expectation,

analyzed: a nāmantā samādānam gaṇataḥ yāvadatthikam

analyzed: pārivāsika bhikkhussa bhikkhum disvāna taṅkhaṇe
translated: For a monk on probation, when he sees a monk at that moment,

original: Nārocentassa cetassa, ratticchedo ca dukkaṭaṃ.🔽Pañceva ca yathāvuḍḍhaṃ, labhate pārivāsiko;🔽Kātuṃ tattheva ca ṭhatvā, uposathapavāraṇaṃ.
analyzed: na arocentassa ratti chedo ca dukkaṭaṃ  pañca iva ca yathāvuḍḍham labhate pārivāsikaḥ  kātum ca uposatha pavāraṇam
translated: If he does not inform him, there is a break in the observance day and a wrongdoing.🔽And the five, as they arrive, get to do the observance-day ceremony and the invitation ceremony right there.

analyzed: vassa sāṭim yathāvuḍḍham denti ce saṅgha dāyakā
translated: And the rains residence robe, as they arrive, get to receive it if the donors give it to the Sangha.

original: Oṇojanaṃ tathā bhattaṃ, labhate pañcime pana.
analyzed: oṇojanam tathā bhattam labhate pañcime pana
translated: And the heavy work, and the food, these five get.

analyzed: pārivāsika khandhaka kathā
translated: The chapter on monks on probation is finished.

analyzed: samatha khandhaka kathā
translated: The chapter on settling

analyzed: vivāda ādhāra tā ca anuvāda adhikaraṇam pi ca
translated: Disputes, accusations, and legal issues,

analyzed: āpatta ādhāra tā ca iva kicca adhikaraṇam pi ca
translated: And the basis for an offense, And also the legal issue arising from business.

original: Etāni pana cattāri, vuttāni ca mahesinā;
analyzed: etāni pana cattāri vuttāni ca mahesinā
translated: These four have been spoken of By the Great Seer;

analyzed: bheda kāraka vatthūni vivādaḥ tattha nissitaḥ
translated: The bases for schism, And the dispute is dependent on that.

analyzed: vipattiyaḥ catasso uva anuvādaḥ upāgataḥ
translated: There are just four kinds of failure, And the further legal issue has arisen;

analyzed: āpattādhāratā nāma satta āpattiyaḥ matā
translated: The basis for an offense is considered To be the seven kinds of offenses.

analyzed: saṅgha kiccāni nissāya kicca adhikaraṇam siyā
translated: The legal issue arising from business may be due to business That is dependent on the Sangha’s business.

original: Etesaṃ tu catunnampi, samattā samathā matā.
analyzed: etesam tu samattā samathā matā
translated: But for all of these four, The resolution is considered to be the resolution.

analyzed: sammukhā sati ca amūḷhaḥ paṭiññāvinayaḥ api ca
translated: Face-to-face, mindfulness, and stupidity, And resolution through recollection;

analyzed: ca iva tathā ca
translated: And the further penalty, And likewise the majority decision.

analyzed: tiṇava thārako ca iva sattamaḥ vinayaḥ mataḥ
translated: The covering over as if with grass, And the seventh is considered to be resolution.

analyzed: satti me samathāḥ vuttāḥ buddhena adicca bandhunā
translated: The seven resolutions have been spoken of By the Buddha, the Kinsman of the Sun.

original: Vivādo sammati dvīhi, anuvādo catūhi ca;
analyzed: vivādaḥ sammati dvīhi anuvādaḥ catūhi ca
translated: A dispute is resolved by two, And a further legal issue by four;

analyzed: āpatti pana tīhā iva kiccam ekena sammati
translated: But an offense is by just three, And a legal issue arising from business by one.

analyzed: chaṭṭhena paṭhamena api vivādaḥ ettha sammati
translated: By the sixth and also the first, A dispute is resolved here;

analyzed: sammukha avinaya ādīhi anupubbena tīhi pi
translated: By the resolution face-to-face, etc., And in order by the three.

analyzed: tathā iva pañcamena api anuvādaḥ hi sammati
translated: And likewise by the fifth, For a further legal issue is resolved;

analyzed: sammukhena paṭiññāya tiṇavatthārakena ca
translated: By admission, and by covering over as if with grass.🔽It goes to resolution of an offense

analyzed: āpattu upasamam yāti tīhā iva samathehi sā
translated: By means of the three principles for settling it:🔽By resolution face-to-face alone,

analyzed: sammukha avinayena iva kiccam ekena sammati
translated: By a committee of the Sangha,🔽By a majority decision.

analyzed: tu salākam gāhaye budhaḥ
translated: The wise one should take a vote🔽By means of a token,🔽Either secretly, openly,

analyzed: gūḷhena vivaṭena api kaṇṇajappena vā pana
translated: Or by whispering in the ear.🔽The wise one should take a vote🔽By means of a token,🔽Secretly with those who are shameless,

analyzed: gūḍhena vivaṭena iva lajjisu
translated: Openly with those who are conscientious,

analyzed: bālesu kaṇṇa jappena salākam gāhaye budhaḥ
translated: And by whispering in the ear with the ignorant.🔽How can one know who is

original: Lajjī alajjī bāloti, kena sakkā vijānituṃ?
analyzed: lajjī a lajjī bālaḥ iti kena sakkā vijānitum
translated: Conscientious, shameless, or ignorant?🔽One can know by their actions:

analyzed: sakena kammunā āya iva tena sakkā vijānitum
translated: One who is shameless🔽Commits an offense on purpose,

analyzed: āpajjati ca sañcit ca āpattim parigūhati
translated: Conceals the offense,🔽And goes by a wrong path.

analyzed: chanda ādi agatim yāti alajjī edisaḥ siyā
translated: One who is conscientious🔽Does not commit an offense on purpose,

original: Nāpajjati ca sañcicca, āpattiṃ na ca gūhati;
analyzed: na āpajjati ca sañcit ca āpattim na ca gūhati
translated: Does not conceal an offense,🔽And does not go by a wrong path.

analyzed: na edisaḥ puggalo
translated: One who is ignorant🔽Thinks badly, speaks badly,

analyzed: duccintitaḥ ca dubbhāsī tathā dukkaṭa kāriko
translated: And acts badly.🔽One can know by their characteristics.

analyzed: ediso pana bālo ti lakkhaṇena iva ñāyati
translated: When a vote is taken by means of a token,

analyzed: tidhā salākagāhena bahukāḥ dhamma vādino
translated: If there are many who speak in accordance with the Teaching,

analyzed: yebhuyyasika kammena kattabbanti jinobravi
translated: “The majority-verdict procedure, he said, should be done.”

original: Alajjī sānuvādo ca, asucī kammato ca yo;🔽Tassapāpiyasīkamma-yoggo so hoti puggalo.🔽Bhaṇḍane kalahe jāte, vivādasmiṃ anappake;🔽Bahuassāmaṇe ciṇṇe, anaggepi ca bhassake.🔽Mūlamūlaṃ gavesantaṃ, hoti vāḷañca kakkhaḷaṃ;🔽Tiṇavatthārakeneva, kātabbanti pakāsitaṃ.🔽Yathā ca tiṇapaṇṇena, channaṃ gūthañca muttakaṃ;🔽Na ca vāyati duggandhaṃ, vūpasammati taṅkhaṇe.
analyzed: a lajjī sa anuvādaḥ ca asucī kammato ca yaḥ  so hoti puggalaḥ  bhaṇḍane kalahe jāte vivādasmiṃ anappake  bahu assāmaṇe ciṇṇe an agge pi ca bhassake  mūla mūlam gavesantam hoti vāḷam ca kakkhaḷam  tiṇavatthārakena iva kātabbanti pakāsitam  yathā ca tiṇa paṇṇena channam gūtham ca muttakam  na ca vāyati duggandham taṅkhaṇe
translated: “The shameless, the slanderer, the dirty, the one who’s done a bad action,

original: Ṭhapetvā thullavajjañca, gihīhi paṭisaṃyutaṃ;🔽Diṭṭhāvikammikañceva, yo ca tattha na hoti taṃ.🔽Sesāyāpattiyā yāva, upasampadamāḷato;🔽Suddho hoti nirāpatti, tiṇavatthārake tathā.🔽Samathakkhandhakakathā.🔽Khuddakavatthukkhandhakakathā🔽Rukkhe vā pana kuṭṭevā, aṭṭāne thambhakesu vā;
analyzed: ṭhapetvā thullavajjam ca gihīhi paṭisaṃyutam 🔽diṭṭha āvikammikam ca iva yaḥ ca tattha na hoti tam 🔽sesāya āpattiyā yāva upasampadam āḷataḥ 🔽suddhaḥ hoti nirāpatti tiṇavatthārake tathā 🔽samatha khandhaka kathā 🔽khuddaka vatthu khandhaka kathā 🔽rukkhe vā pana aṭṭāne thambhakesu vā
