original: Nhāyamāno sakaṃ kāyaṃ, ugghaṃseyyassa dukkaṭaṃ.🔽Kāyaṃ gandhabbahatthena, kuruvindakasuttiyā;
analyzed: nhāyamāno sakam kāyam ugghaṃseyyassa dukkaṭam  kāyam gandhabba hatthena kuruvindaka suttiyā
translated: While bathing, he may rub his own body, But not with a rubbing-hand gesture, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: mallakena na ghaṃseyya na aññam aññañca kāyato
translated: He should not rub his body With a fragrant-hand gesture, or with a flower-petal gesture, Or with a wrestling gesture, or with one body part against another.

analyzed: akatam mallakam nāma gilānassa iva vaṭṭati
translated: A wrestling gesture that is not made Is allowed only for one who is sick;

original: Kataṃ taṃ mallakaṃ nāma, sabbesampi na vaṭṭati.
analyzed: katam tam mallakam nāma sabbesam pi na vaṭṭati
translated: That wrestling gesture which is made Is not allowed for anyone.

analyzed: kapāliṭṭhaka khaṇḍāni sabbassa puthu pāṇikam
translated: Pieces of stone or shell, Or anything else that is not smooth,

original: Gilānassāgilānassa, vatthavaṭṭi ca vaṭṭati.🔽Vuttā pheṇakapāsāṇa-kathalā pādaghaṃsane;
analyzed: gilānassa a gilānassa vattha vaṭṭi ca vaṭṭati  vuttā pheṇaka pāsāṇa kathalā pāda ghaṃsane
translated: Are allowed for one who is sick or not sick, And also a cloth strip.🔽It is said that a lump of foam, a piece of cotton-down, or a kathina frame Are for rubbing the feet.

original: Vaṭṭaṃ vā caturassaṃ vā, katakaṃ na ca vaṭṭati.
analyzed: vaṭṭam vā catur assam vā katakam na ca vaṭṭati
translated: A round or square lump Is not allowed.

original: Yaṃ kiñcipi alaṅkāraṃ, dhārentassapi dukkaṭaṃ;🔽Hoti antamaso tāla-paṇṇamattampi bhikkhuno.
analyzed: yam kiñcipi alaṅkāram dhārentassa api dukkaṭam  hoti antamasaḥ tāla paṇṇa mattam pi bhikkhuno
translated: It is an offense of wrong conduct For anyone who wears any kind of ornament,🔽Even if it is just a palm-leaf ornament.

original: Osaṇheyya sake kese, yo hatthaphaṇakena vā;
analyzed: osaṇheyya sake kese yaḥ hattha phaṇakena vā
translated: If he rubs his own hair, Or with a hand gesture, or with a fan,

analyzed: phaṇakena api kocchena dukkaṭam tassa niddise
translated: Or with a fan or a whisk, It is an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: sittha tela uda telehi maṇḍana attham na vaṭṭati
translated: It is not allowed to anoint for the sake of decoration With oil or oil-seed flour;

analyzed: anuloma nipāta attham uddhaṃlomena bhikkhunā
translated: But it is allowed for a monk to anoint with oil-seed flour, Using the upper part of the hand, for the sake of massaging the body.

analyzed: hattham telena temetvā puñchitabbā siroruhā
translated: Rubbing the head with oil, one should scratch with the hand;

analyzed: vaṭṭa tuṇha abhitattassa alla hatthena puñchitum
translated: It is allowed to scratch with a wet hand, if one is covered with mud or dust.

original: Ādāse udapatte vā, yattha katthaci attano;
analyzed: ādāse udapatte vā yattha katthaci attanaḥ
translated: In a mirror, in water, or anywhere else, looking at one’s own face,

analyzed: mukha bimbam vinā hetum olokentassa dukkaṭam
translated: Except for a reason, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: sañchavim tu mukham no ti daṭṭhum ābādha paccayā
translated: “One may look at the face to see if there is something stuck there,”

analyzed: jiṇṇaḥ vaṭṭati
translated: “One may look to see if one is old or not,” and “to know the remaining life-span,” are allowed.

original: Naccaṃ vā pana gītaṃ vā, vāditaṃ vāpi bhikkhuno;
analyzed: naccam vā pana gītam vā vāditam vā api bhikkhuno
translated: If a monk goes to see or hear dancing, singing, or music,

original: Daṭṭhuṃ vā pana sotuṃ vā, gacchato hoti dukkaṭaṃ.🔽Daṭṭhumantamaso mora-naccampi ca na vaṭṭati;
analyzed: daṭṭhum vā pana sotum vā gacchataḥ hoti dukkaṭam  ca na vaṭṭati
translated: there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽It is not allowed to see even the dancing of a peacock,

analyzed: ca na vaṭṭati
translated: or to hear even the singing of a lute.

analyzed: naccantassa sayam vā api dukkaṭam
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for dancing oneself or having someone else dance.

analyzed: an āpatta antara ārāme ṭhatvā suṇāti passati
translated: There is no offense if one hears or sees while staying in a monastery.

original: “Passissāmī”ti naccaṃ vā, gītaṃ vā pana vāditaṃ;🔽Vihārato vihāraṃ vā, gacchato hoti dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: passissāmi iti naccam vā gītam vā pana vāditam  vihārataḥ vihāram vā gacchataḥ hoti dukkaṭam
translated: If one goes from one monastery to another monastery, thinking, “I’ll see it,”🔽there is an offense of wrong conduct for seeing dancing, singing, or music.

analyzed: uṭṭhahitvāna gacchato
translated: Even if one goes from one monastery to another monastery,

original: Ṭhatvā gīvaṃ pasāretvā, passatopi ca vīthiyaṃ.
analyzed: ṭhatvā gīvam pasāretvā passataḥ pi ca vīthiyam
translated: And stretching out his neck, he looks along the road.

original: Kesā dīghā na dhāreyyā, yo dhāreyyassa dukkaṭaṃ;🔽Dvaṅgulaṃ vā dumāsaṃ vā, tato uddhaṃ na vaṭṭati.
analyzed: kesāḥ dīghāḥ na dhāreyyāḥ yaḥ dhāreyyassa dukkaṭaṃ  dvaṅgulam vā du māsam vā tatas uddham na vaṭṭati
translated: If he stands, stretches his neck, and looks down the street, Translation: If he lets his hair grow long, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽He should not let his hair grow longer than two or three fingerbreadths.

original: Nakhe nāsikalomāni, dīghāni na tu dhāraye;
analyzed: nakhe nāsika lomāni dīghāni na tu dhāraye
translated: He should not let his nails grow long, not even the nail on his toe.

original: Na ca vīsatimaṭṭhaṃ vā, kātuṃ vaṭṭati bhikkhuno.
analyzed: na ca vīsatimaṭṭham vā kātum vaṭṭati bhikkhuno
translated: A monk should not make his nails shiny.

original: Kappāpeyya visuṃ massuṃ, dāṭhikaṃ vā ṭhapeyya yo;
analyzed: visum massum dāṭhikam vā ṭhapeyya yaḥ
translated: If he has his hair shaved separately, or if he leaves the hair on his head or on his face,

original: Saṃharāpeyya vā lomaṃ, sambādhe tassa dukkaṭaṃ.🔽Chindato dukkaṭaṃ vuttaṃ, kese kattarikāya vā;
analyzed: saṃhara a peyya vā lomam sambādhe tassa dukkaṭam  chindataḥ dukkaṭam vuttam kese kattarikāya vā
translated: or if he removes the hair from his body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If he cuts his hair with scissors,

original: Agilānassa aññena, chindāpentassa vā tathā.🔽Chindato attano aṅga-jātaṃ thullaccayaṃ siyā;
analyzed: a gilānassa aññena chindāpentassa vā tathā  chindataḥ attanaḥ aṅga jātam thullaccayam siyā
translated: or if he has someone else cut it, except if he is sick,🔽then for cutting his own genitals, he commits a serious offense.

analyzed: sesaṅga chedane atta vadhe āpatti dukkaṭaṃ  ahi kīṭa ādi daṭṭhassa ta ādisa ābādha paccayā
translated: For cutting another part of his body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If he cuts his own genitals because he has seen a snake or an insect there, or because of an illness,

original: Na doso chindato aṅgaṃ, mocentassa ca lohitaṃ.
analyzed: na dosaḥ chindataḥ aṅgam mocentassa ca lohitam
translated: there is no offense.

analyzed: a parissāvanaḥ maggam sace gacchati dukkaṭam
translated: If he goes along a road without taking along a razor, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: yācamānassa vā magge tathā iva adadataḥ pi tam
translated: If he asks for a razor on the road, or if he is given one, it is the same.

original: Na bhuñje na pive naggo, na khāde na ca sāyaye;
analyzed: na bhuñje na pive naggaḥ na khāde na ca sāyaye
translated: I shouldn’t eat, I shouldn’t drink, I shouldn’t go naked, I shouldn’t chew, I shouldn’t suck,

original: Na dade na ca gaṇheyya, na gaccheyyapi añjasaṃ.
analyzed: na dade na ca gaṇheyya na gaccheyya api añjasam
translated: I shouldn’t give, I shouldn’t receive, I shouldn’t go straight on.

analyzed: vanditabbam na naggena vandāpetabbam eva vā
translated: One shouldn’t pay respect to one who is naked, nor should one make one who is naked pay respect.

original: Parikammaṃ na kātabbaṃ, na naggena ca kāraye.🔽Parikamme paṭicchādī, tisso jantāgharādikā;
analyzed: parikammam na kātabbam na naggena ca kāraye  parikamme paṭicchādī tissaḥ jantā ghara ādikā
translated: One shouldn’t do service, nor should one make one who is naked do service.🔽One who is covered should do service, the three sauna-houses, etc.,

analyzed: vuttā vattha paṭicchādī sabbattha pana vaṭṭati
translated: are mentioned. One who is covered with a cloth should do service. Everywhere it is allowable.

original: Yattha katthaci peḷāyaṃ, bhuñjituṃ na ca vaṭṭati;
analyzed: yattha katthacid peḷāyam bhuñjitum na ca vaṭṭati
translated: It is not allowable to eat anywhere on a bed.

analyzed: ekatas bhuñjataḥ hoti dukkaṭam eka bhājane
translated: When eating from one vessel, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: eka pāvuraṇāḥ ekattharaṇāḥ vā nipajjare
translated: If they lie down with one covering or one sheet,

original: Ekamañcepi vā tesaṃ, hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ.🔽Na nisīdeyya saṅghāṭi-pallatthikamupāgato;
analyzed: vā tesam hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ  na nisīdeyya saṅghāṭi pallatthikam upāgataḥ
translated: or on one bed, there is an offense of wrong conduct for them.🔽One shouldn’t sit with one’s upper robe over one’s head or shoulders.

original: Kiñci kīḷaṃ na kīḷeyya, palitaṃ na ca gāhaye.
analyzed: kiñci kīḷam na kīḷeyya palitam na ca gāhaye
translated: One shouldn’t play any game, nor should one grab a gray hair.

analyzed: vā uggatam
translated: Whether it’s on the forehead or the tip of the nose,

analyzed: tādisam palitam caññam gāhāpetum pi vaṭṭati
translated: or on the gums, it’s allowable to have such a gray hair grabbed.

original: Agilāno sace bhikkhu, chattaṃ dhāreyya dukkaṭaṃ;
analyzed: a gilānaḥ sace bhikkhu chattam dhāreyya dukkaṭam
translated: If a monk who is not sick holds up an umbrella, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: attanaḥ cīvara ādīnam guttattham pana vaṭṭati
translated: But it is allowable to wear a cloak To protect one’s own robes, etc.

original: Hatthisoṇḍaṃ catukkaṇṇaṃ, vasanaṃ macchavāḷakaṃ;🔽Velliyaṃ tālavaṇṭañca, nivāsentassa dukkaṭaṃ.🔽Gahipārupanaṃ vāpi, pārupantassa dukkaṭaṃ;
analyzed: hatthi soṇḍam catukkaṇṇam vasanam maccha vāḷakam  velliyam tālavaṇṭam ca nivāsentassa dukkaṭaṃ  gahi pārupanam vā api pārupantassa dukkaṭam
translated: An elephant’s frontal globes, four corners, A garment, a fish’s gills,🔽A blanket, a palm leaf, and a fan: It is wrong to wear these.🔽And it is wrong to wear a garment Worn by a householder;

analyzed: nivāsane pārupane parimaṇḍala tā matā
translated: But it is allowable to wear a garment Worn as an undergarment.

original: Lokāyataṃ na vāceyya, na ca taṃ pariyāpuṇe;
analyzed: lokāyatam na vāceyya na ca tam pariyāpuṇe
translated: He should not expound the Materialists’ doctrines, Nor should he learn them;

analyzed: na tiracchāna vijjā vā vācetabbā ava bhikkhunā
translated: Nor should a bhikkhu expound The doctrines of the animal psychologists.

original: Na ca vaṭṭati dhāretuṃ, sabbā cāmaribījanī;
analyzed: na ca vaṭṭati dhāretum sabbā cāmari bījanī
translated: It is not allowable to carry A sunshade and sandals;

original: Na cālimpeyya dāyaṃ vā, na ca lañje mukhampi ca.
analyzed: na ca ālimpeyya dāyam vā na ca lañje mukhampi ca
translated: He should not anoint his body, Or his head, or his face.

analyzed: na vahe ubhatokājam vaṭṭa tantara kājakam
translated: He should not carry a double-headed drum, But a single-headed one is allowable;

original: Sīsakkhandhakaṭolamba-bhāre doso na vijjati.🔽Aṭṭhaṅgulādikaṃ bhikkhu, pacchimaṃ caturaṅgulā;
analyzed: sīsa kkhandha kaṭaḥ lamba bhāre doso na vijjati  aṭṭhaṅgula ādikam pacchimam catur aṅgulā
translated: There is no offense in carrying A head-band, a shoulder-strap, or a bag.🔽A bhikkhu should not use A tooth cleaner more than a handspan long;

analyzed: khādataḥ danta kaṭṭham ca hoti āpatti dukkaṭam
translated: The last one should be four fingerbreadths long. It is an offense of wrong doing To chew a tooth cleaner.

analyzed: rukkham na iva abhirūheyya kicce sati pi porisam
translated: He should not climb a tree, Even if his life is in danger;

analyzed: āpadāsu yathākāmam vaṭṭatā iva abhirūhitum
translated: But in an emergency he may climb a tree As he likes.

original: Lasuṇaṃ na ca khādeyya, sace nākallako siyā;
analyzed: lasuṇam na ca khādeyya sace na a kallakaḥ siyā
translated: He shouldn’t eat garlic, unless he’s sick.

original: Nāropetabbakaṃ buddha-vacanaṃ aññathā pana.🔽Khipitena ca vattabbaṃ, “jīvā”ti, gihinā puna;
analyzed: na āropetabbakam buddha vacanam aññathā pana  khipitena ca vattabbam jīvāti gihinā puna
translated: The Buddha’s word should not be transgressed, but in other ways it may.🔽The householder should say, “Live on,”

analyzed: jīvatha iti ca vuttena ciram jīva ati vaṭṭati
translated: and if he’s told, “Live long,” that’s acceptable.

analyzed: sāmaṇeram gahaṭṭham vā ākoṭentassa dukkaṭam
translated: If he hits a novice monk or a householder, it’s an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Sayane pupphasaṃkiṇṇe, na vaṭṭati nipajjituṃ.🔽Khurabhaṇḍaṃ na gaṇheyya, sace nhāpitapubbako;
analyzed: sayane puppha saṃkiṇṇe na vaṭṭati nipajjitum  khura bhaṇḍam na gaṇheyya sace nhāpita pubbakaḥ
translated: It’s not allowable to lie down on a bed with flowers strewn over it.🔽If he was formerly a barber, he shouldn’t hold a razor.

original: Na ca dhāraṇiyā uṇhī, sabbā bāhiralomikā.
analyzed: na ca dhāraṇiyā uṇhī sabbā bāhiralomikā
translated: A turban is not allowable, but anything made of outer bark is.

analyzed: aṅgarāgam karontassa dukkaṭam samudīritam
translated: It’s said that there’s an offense of wrong conduct for making a body unguent.

original: Akāyabandhanassāpi, gāmaṃ pavisatopi ca.🔽Lohajaṃ dārujaṃ sabbaṃ, kappiyaṃ mattikāmayaṃ;🔽Vinā satthañca pattañca, katakaṃ kumbhakārikaṃ.
analyzed: a kāya bandhanassa api gāmam pavisataḥ api ca  loha jam dāru jam sabbam kappiyam mattikā mayam  vinā sattham ca pattam ca katakam kumbhakārikam
translated: And for one who doesn’t wear a waistband, even when entering the village.🔽All made of iron or wood or clay🔽are allowable, except for a knife and a bowl, a water filter, and a water pot.

analyzed: khuddaka vatthu khandhaka kathā
translated: The sub-chapter on small items is finished.

analyzed: senāsana kkhandhaka kathā
translated: The sub-chapter on furniture

analyzed: āsandikaḥ atikkanta pamāṇaḥ api ca vaṭṭati
translated: A bench is allowable, even if it exceeds the right size,

analyzed: tathā pañcaṅga pīṭham pi sattaṅgam pi ca vaṭṭati
translated: as is a five-part chair and a seven-part chair.

analyzed: tūla ūnaddhā ghareya iva mañca pīṭhā nisīditum
translated: A pillow stuffed with cotton, And a bed and chair to sit on in the house;

analyzed: sīsa pāda upadhānam ca a gilānassa vaṭṭati
translated: And a mattress stuffed with silk grass Is allowed for one who is sick.

analyzed: santharitvā gilānassa upadhānāni tattha ca
translated: Having spread out a mattress for one who is sick, And there a pillow;

original: Paccattharaṇakaṃ datvā, nipajjantassa vaṭṭati.🔽Tiriyaṃ muṭṭhiratanaṃ, hoti bimbohanaṃ mitaṃ;
analyzed: paccattharaṇakam da tvā nipajjantassa vaṭṭati  tiriyam muṭṭhi ratanam hoti bimbohanam mitam
translated: Having given a sheet, It is allowed to lie down on it.🔽Across, a span is the measure For a bimba-sized pillow.

original: Dīghato ca diyaḍḍhaṃ vā, dvihatthanti kurundiyaṃ.
analyzed: dīghataḥ ca diyaḍḍham vā dvihatthanti kurundiyam
translated: And two and a half cubits long, And two cubits is the kurundika.

original: Pūritā coḷapaṇṇuṇṇa-tiṇavākehi pañcahi;🔽Bhisiyo bhāsitā pañca, tūlānaṃ gaṇanāvasā.
analyzed: pūritā coḷa paṇṇuṇṇa tiṇavākehi pañcahi  bhisiyaḥ bhāsitā pañca tūlānam gaṇanā avasā
translated: Filled with five things—cloth, leaf, Grass, chaff, and cotton wool;🔽Five kinds of mattresses are mentioned, The counting of cotton wool is finished.

original: Bhisitūlāni pañceva, tathā tūlāni tīṇipi;🔽Lomāni migapakkhīnaṃ, gabbhā bimbohanassime.
analyzed: bhisi tūlāni pañca iva tathā tūlāni  lomāni miga pakkhīnam gabbhāḥ bimbohanassime
translated: Five kinds of mattresses are just cotton wool, And three kinds of mattresses are just wool;🔽The wool of animals and birds, And the wool of the unborn is the measure for a pillow.

analyzed: manussalomam lomesu pupphesu bakula ādikam
translated: Human hair, among the wools; Among the flowers, the bakula, etc.;

original: Suddhaṃ tamālapattañca, paṇṇesu na ca vaṭṭati.
analyzed: suddham tamāla pattam ca paṇṇesu na ca vaṭṭati
translated: Pure betel leaves, and a leaf, Are not allowed among the leaves.

analyzed: uṇṇa ādikam pañcavidham ca tūlam
translated: The five kinds of wool beginning with kapok,

original: Mahesinā yaṃ bhisiyaṃ pavuttaṃ;🔽Masūrake taṃ pana vaṭṭatīti;
analyzed: mahesinā yam bhisiyam pavuttam  masūrake tam pana vaṭṭati iti
translated: Which the Great Sage has allowed for a mattress,🔽That is allowed for a mosquito net,

analyzed: kurundiyam aṭṭhakathāya vuttam
translated: It is said in the commentary to the Kurundī.

original: Yadetaṃ tividhaṃ tūlaṃ, bhisiyaṃ taṃ akappiyaṃ;
analyzed: yat etam tividham tūlam bhisiyam tam akappiyam
translated: The three kinds of cotton wool: it is not allowable to make a mattress with that.

original: Missaṃ tamālapattaṃ tu, sabbattha pana vaṭṭati.
analyzed: missam tamāla pattam tu sabbattha pana vaṭṭati
translated: A mattress mixed with betel-leaf is allowable everywhere.

analyzed: rūpam tu purisa itthīnam tiracchāna gatassa vā
translated: If one makes a likeness of a man or a woman, or of an animal,

original: Kārentassa karoto vā, hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ.🔽Jātakaṃ pana vatthuṃ vā, kārāpetuṃ parehi vā;
analyzed: kārentassa karotaḥ vā hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ  jātakam pana vatthum vā kārāpetum parehi vā
translated: whether one is making it or having it made, there is an offense of wrong doing.🔽But it is allowable to have made a picture of the Buddha or a story from the scriptures,

analyzed: mālā kammam latā kammam sayam kātum pi vaṭṭati
translated: or to make a creeper-work or a flower-work oneself.

original: Samānāsaniko nāma, dvīhi vassehi yo pana;
analyzed: samānāsanikaḥ nāma dvīhi vassehi yaḥ pana
translated: A co-student is one who is two years younger than oneself,

original: Vuḍḍho vā daharo vāpi, vassenekena vā pana.
analyzed: vuḍḍhaḥ vā daharaḥ vā api vassena ekena vā pana
translated: whether he is older or younger, or one year younger.

analyzed: samāna vasse vattabbam kiñca na am idha vijjati
translated: One who is of the same age should be addressed as “Sir.” What is there to be said?

analyzed: satta vassa ativassehi pañca vassaḥ nisīdati
translated: One who is seven years older sits down with one who is five years old.

original: Heṭṭhā dīghāsanaṃ tiṇṇaṃ, yaṃ pahoti nisīdituṃ;🔽Ekamañcepi pīṭhe vā, dve nisīdanti vaṭṭati.
analyzed: heṭṭhā dīghāsanam tiṇṇam yam pahoti nisīditum  eka mañce pi pīṭhe vā dve nisīdanti vaṭṭati
translated: On a long seat three can sit down if there is space.🔽On one bed or one chair two can sit down.

analyzed: ubhatobyañjanam itthim ṭhapetvā paṇḍakam pana
translated: Except for a woman with both organs and a paṇḍaka,

analyzed: dīghāsane anuññātam sabbehi pi nisīditum
translated: on a long seat all are allowed to sit down.

analyzed: purimiko pacchimiko
translated: The one in front, the one behind, and likewise the one in the middle, the one above,

analyzed: tayo senāsana ggāhā sambuddhena pakāsitā
translated: Three kinds of taking of dwellings Were taught by the Awakened One.

analyzed: pubba aruṇā pāṭipadassa yāva
translated: From the time of the dawn of the one on the way to the monastery,

analyzed: punar aruṇaḥ bhijjati na iva tāva
translated: Until the dawn breaks, it is not yet broken.

analyzed: idam hi senāsana gāhakassa
translated: This is the time for taking a dwelling,

analyzed: vassūpagame vadanti
translated: Which is called the field for the Rains.🔽If another monk, having come

original: Pātova gāhite añño, bhikkhu senāsane pana;🔽Sace yācati āgantvā, vattabbo gāhitanti so.
analyzed: pātova gāhite aññaḥ bhikkhu senāsane pana  sace yācati āgantvā vattabbaḥ gāhitanti so
translated: To the dwelling that has been taken,🔽Should ask for it, he should be told: “It has been taken.”

analyzed: saṅghikam apaloketvā gahitam vassavāsikam
translated: Having looked around, he may take a dwelling for the Rains,

analyzed: antovasse pi labhate tatrajam sace
translated: Even if it is in the Rains, if he is separated from it, he may get what belongs to it.🔽If a monk, having completed the Rains,

analyzed: vuṭṭhavassaḥ sace bhikkhu kiñci āvāsi hatthato
translated: Should take some requisites from the hand of the resident,🔽And having given them to him, he himself

original: Gahetvā kappiyaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ, datvā tassattano pana.🔽“Asukasmiṃ kule mayhaṃ, vassāvāsikacīvaraṃ;
analyzed: gahetvā kappiyam bhaṇḍam da tvā pana  asukasmin kule mayham vassāvāsika cīvaram
translated: Should go to another region,🔽Saying: “In such and such a family,🔽My Rains-residence robe was taken, take it,”

original: Gāhitaṃ gaṇha”iccevaṃ, vatvā gacchati so disaṃ.
analyzed: gāhitam gaṇhait ca evam vatvā gacchati saḥ disam
translated: If he should go forth there,

original: Uppabbajati ce tattha, gataṭṭhāne, na labbhati;
analyzed: uppabbajati ce tattha gata ṭṭhāne na labbhati
translated: He will not get it at the place he has gone to.🔽What has come to him should be taken

original: Gahetuṃ tassa sampattaṃ, saṅghikaṃyeva taṃ siyā.
analyzed: gahetum tassa sampattam saṅghikam yā iva tam siyā
translated: As belonging to the Community.

original: Manusse sammukhā tattha, paṭicchāpeti ce pana;
analyzed: manusse sammukhā tattha ce pana
translated: If he should entrust it there in the presence of people,

analyzed: sabbam labhati sampattam vassāvāsika cīvaram
translated: He gets everything that comes to him, robe-cloth for the rainy season.

original: Ārāmo ca vihāro ca, vatthūni duvidhassapi;
analyzed: ārāmo ca vihāro ca vatthūni duvidhassa api
translated: A monastery, a dwelling, and a site, of two kinds;

original: Bhisi bimbohanaṃ mañca-pīṭhanti tatiyaṃ pana.🔽Lohakumbhī kaṭāhañca, bhāṇako lohavārako;🔽Vāsi pharasu kuddālo, kuṭhārī ca nikhādanaṃ.
analyzed: bhisi bimbohanam tatiyam pana  lohakumbhī kaṭāhaḥ ca bhāṇakaḥ lohavārakaḥ  vāsi kuddālaḥ kuṭhārī ca nikhādanam
translated: A bed, a bench, and a pillow, and a third.🔽An iron pot, a cauldron, a water-pot, a metal bowl,🔽A knife, an axe, a spade, a hatchet, and a sharpening stone.

original: Valli veḷu tiṇaṃ paṇṇaṃ, muñjapabbajameva ca;
analyzed: valli veḷu tiṇam paṇṇam muñja pabbajam eva ca
translated: Creepers, bamboo, grass, leaves, and also reed and grass,

original: Mattikā dārubhaṇḍañca, pañcamaṃ tu yathāha ca.
analyzed: mattikā dārubhaṇḍam ca pañcamam tu yathā āha ca
translated: Clay, and wooden goods, and a fifth, as it is said.

analyzed: saṅgahitāni dve tatiyam catu saṅgaham
translated: “Two are included in two, the third is included in four,

analyzed: catuttham nava koṭṭhāsam pañcamam aṭṭhadhā matam
translated: The fourth is divided into nine parts, the fifth is considered in eight ways.

analyzed: iti pañcahi rāsīhi
translated: Thus with five groups, with five unadulterated eyes,

analyzed: pañcavīsavidham nā atho garubhaṇḍam
translated: The protector announced the heavy goods in twenty-five ways.”

analyzed: idam hi pana saṅghassa santakam garubhaṇḍakaṃ
translated: Now, this heavy goods of the Sangha,

analyzed: vissajjentaḥ vibhājentaḥ bhikkhu thullaccayam phuse
translated: when he distributes or divides it, a monk commits a serious offense.🔽But if heavy goods are distributed or divided

original: Bhikkhunā garubhaṇḍaṃ tu, saṅghena hi gaṇena vā;
analyzed: bhikkhunā garu bhaṇḍam tu saṅghena hi gaṇena vā
translated: by a monk, by the Sangha, or by a group,

analyzed: vissajjitam a vissaṭṭham vibhattam a vibhājitam
translated: and if it is not distributed or divided,

analyzed: purimesu hi tīsu ettha na cattha agaru bhaṇḍakam
translated: In the first three, there is no heavy article, no bowl,

original: Lohakumbhī kaṭāho ca, lohabhāṇakameva ca.🔽Tividhaṃ khuddakaṃ vāpi, garubhaṇḍakamevidaṃ;
analyzed: loha kumbhī kaṭāhaḥ ca loha bhāṇakam eva ca  tividham khuddakam vā api
translated: No metal basin, no metal bucket, no metal water-pot.🔽Or else it is threefold, or else it is a heavy article,
A metal bowl, a metal basin, a metal water-pot are considered.

analyzed: tatas lohavārakaḥ garubhaṇḍakam
translated: But above that, a metal bowl is a heavy article,

analyzed: bhiṅkāra ādīni sabbāni garubhaṇḍāni honti hi
translated: All the things beginning with a water-pot are heavy articles.

analyzed: bhājetabbaḥ ayopattaḥ  ca
translated: A metal bowl should be shared out;🔽So too a bronze bowl and a copper bowl,

analyzed: dhūma nettā ādikam na iva
translated: A smoke-darkened bowl and so on,

analyzed: bhājetabban ti dīpitam
translated: It is declared, should not be shared out.

original: Attanā paṭiladdhaṃ taṃ, lohabhaṇḍaṃ tu kiñcipi;
analyzed: attanā paṭiladdham tam loha bhaṇḍam tu
translated: But whatever metal article he has acquired himself,

analyzed: na puggalika bhogena bhuñjitabbam hi bhikkhunā
translated: A monk should not use it as his own property.

analyzed: kaṃsa vaṭṭaka lohānam bhājanāni pi sabbaso
translated: And all the vessels of tin, lead, and copper,

analyzed: na puggalika bhogena vaṭṭanti paribhuñjitum
translated: Are not allowed to be used as his own property.🔽This is the method to be understood by the wise

analyzed: tipu bhaṇḍe pi esa iva nayaḥ ñeyyaḥ vibhāvinā
translated: In the case of the three kinds of metal articles;

original: Na doso saṅghike atthi, gihīnaṃ santakesu vā.
analyzed: na dosaḥ saṅghike atthi gihīnam santakesu vā
translated: There is no offence in the case of those belonging to the Community,🔽Or in the case of those belonging to laymen.
A heavy article is a wooden bowl, etc., made of milk-wood,

analyzed: pāda gaṇhanataḥ ghaṭakaḥ garubhaṇḍakaḥ
translated: From the time of taking the bowl, the water-pot and the heavy goods.
The needle-case, the razor-case, the string, the pin, the stone for sharpening, the mirror,

analyzed: bhājanāni na vaṭṭanti gihīnam
translated: The vessels are not allowed, even if they belong to the laity.

analyzed: vā asi bhājaniyā khuddā garubhaṇḍam mahattarī
translated: The knife is a light article, the heavy goods are the larger ones;

analyzed: tathā ca
translated: So also the axe for the doctors, and the lancet for opening the veins.

analyzed: kuṭhāri vāsi kuddālaḥ garubhaṇḍam nikhādanam
translated: The hatchet, the knife, the hoe, the heavy goods are the grindstone;

original: Sikharampi ca teneva, gahitanti pakāsitaṃ.🔽Caturassamukhaṃ doṇi-mukhaṃ vaṅkampi tattha ca;
analyzed: sikharam pi ca tena iva pakāsitam  caturassamukham doṇimukham vaṅkam pi tattha ca
translated: And the sickle is also declared to be so if it is taken.🔽The four-sided one, the bowl-mouthed one, the curved one, and there also the staff,

analyzed: sa daṇḍam khuddakam sabbam garubhaṇḍam nikhādanam
translated: The small one is all, the heavy goods are the grindstone.

analyzed: muṭṭhikam adhikaraṇī saṇḍāsaḥ vā tulā ādikam
translated: The measuring-rod, the balance, the scales, and so on,

original: Kiñci saṅghassa dinnaṃ ce, taṃ sabbaṃ garubhaṇḍakaṃ.
analyzed: kiñci saṅghassa dinnam ce tat sabbam garubhaṇḍakam
translated: If anything is given to the Community, all that is heavy goods.

original: Nhāpitassa ca saṇḍāso, kattarī ca mahattarī;
analyzed: nhāpitassa ca saṇḍāsaḥ kattarī ca mahattarī
translated: And the barber’s staff, and the large knife,
The large chopping-block is heavy goods for the butchers.

original: Valli saṅghassa dinnā vā, tatthajātāpi rakkhitā;
analyzed: saṅghassa dinnā vā tattha jātā api rakkhitā
translated: And the creeper given to the Community, or that which grows there and is guarded,

analyzed: aḍḍha bāhu ppamāṇā api garu vetta latā ādikā
translated: The heavy goods are the betel vine, and so on, even if it is a fathom long.

analyzed: suttavāka ādi nibbattāḥ rajjukāḥ yottakāni vā
translated: A rope, a string, or a net made from the bark of trees, etc.,

analyzed: saṅghassa dinna kāle tu gacchanti
translated: When given to the Community, become heavy articles.

original: Nāḷikerassa hīre vā, vāke vā pana kenaci;
analyzed: nāḷikerassa hīre vā vāke vā pana kenacid
translated: A coconut, or a jack-fruit, or something else,

analyzed: vaṭṭetvā hi katā eka vaṭṭā api garu bhaṇḍakam
translated: Wrapped up and made into a ball, is also a heavy article.

original: Veḷu saṅghassa dinno vā, rakkhito tatthajātako;🔽Aṭṭhaṅgulāyato sūci-daṇḍamatto garuṃ siyā.
analyzed: saṅghassa dinnaḥ vā rakkhitaḥ tatthajātakaḥ  aṭṭhaṅgula āyataḥ sūci daṇḍa mattaḥ garum siyā
translated: Bamboo given to the Community, or protected by someone born there,🔽A needle-case eight fingerbreadths long, or the size of a staff, is heavy.

analyzed: chatta daṇḍa salākāyaḥ daṇḍaḥ kattara ya ṭṭhipi
translated: A staff for a sunshade, a walking stick, a staff with a hook,

analyzed: pādagaṇhanakā telanāḷī bhājaniyā ime
translated: A foot-scraper, an oil tube, a bowl, these are heavy.

original: Muñjādīsupi yaṃ kiñci, muṭṭhimattaṃ garuṃ siyā;
analyzed: muñja ādī supi yam kiñci muṭṭhimattam garum siyā
translated: In muñja grass, etc., whatever is the size of a handful is heavy.

analyzed: tāla paṇṇa ādim ekam pi dinnam vā tattha jātakam
translated: A single palm leaf, etc., given or born there,

analyzed: aṭṭha aṅgula ppamāṇaḥ api garukam ritta potthakaḥ
translated: Even if eight fingerbreadths long, an empty bag is heavy.

original: Mattikā pakatī vāpi, pañcavaṇṇā sudhāpi vā.
analyzed: mattikā pakatī vā api pañca vaṇṇā sudhā api vā
translated: Clay, or a finished product, or the five-colored plaster,

original: Silesādīsu vā kiñci, dinnaṃ vā tatthajātakaṃ;
analyzed: silesa ādīsu vā kiñci dinnam vā tattha jātakam
translated: Or something given in the precepts, etc., or born there,

analyzed: tāla pakka pamāṇam tu dīpitam
translated: The size of a palm leaf, is declared to be a heavy article.

analyzed: valli veḷa ādikam kiñci a rakkhitam a gopitam
translated: Something like a bamboo fence, unprotected and unguarded,

analyzed: garu bhaṇḍam na hotā iva gahetabbam yathāsukham
translated: Heavy goods are not at all; they can be taken as one likes.

original: Rakkhitaṃ gopitaṃ vāpi, gahetabbaṃ tu gaṇhatā;
analyzed: rakkhitam gopitam vā api gahetabbam tu gaṇhatā
translated: Whether guarded or unguarded, they can be taken by the one who takes them;

original: Samakaṃ atirekaṃ vā, datvā phātikameva vā.
analyzed: samakam atirekam vā da tvā phātikam eva vā
translated: An equal amount or more, after giving back what was borrowed.

analyzed: añjanam haritālañca tathā hiṅgu manosilā
translated: Collyrium, yellow orpiment, and likewise asafoetida and realgar;

analyzed: bhājetabban ti viññeyyam viññunā vinayaññunā
translated: These should be known as to be shared, by one who is wise and knows the Monastic Law.

analyzed: dāru bhaṇḍe pi yo koci sūci daṇḍa ppamāṇako
translated: Any kind of wooden goods, as much as a bamboo stick,

analyzed: aṭṭhaṅgula āyataḥ dāru bhaṇḍakaḥ garu bhaṇḍakam
translated: A wooden goods measuring eight fingerbreadths is heavy goods.

original: Mahāaṭṭhakathāyaṃ tu, vibhajitvāva dassitaṃ;🔽Āsandikopi sattaṅgo, bhaddapīṭhañca pīṭhikā.
analyzed: mahā aṭṭhakathā ayam tu vibhajitvā ava dassitam  āsandikaḥ api sattaṅgaḥ bhaddapīṭham ca pīṭhikā
translated: But in the Great Commentary, it is taught after dividing it up:🔽A bench, a seven-part bed, a fine bed, a small bed,

original: Pīṭhameḷakapādañca, tathāmaṇḍakavaṭṭakaṃ;🔽Kocchaṃ palālapīṭhañca, dhovane phalakampi ca.
analyzed: pīṭham eḷaka pādam ca tathā maṇḍaka vaṭṭakam  koccham palāla pīṭham ca dhovane phalakam api ca
translated: A bed with legs and frame, and likewise a foot-wiping stone,🔽A foot-wiping cloth, a straw mat, and a wooden slab for washing,

original: Bhaṇḍikā muggaro ceva, vatthaghaṭṭanamuggaro;🔽Ambaṇampi ca mañjūsā, nāvā rajanadoṇikā.
analyzed: bhaṇḍikā muggaro ca iva vattha ghaṭṭana muggaro  ca mañjūsā nāvā rajanadoṇikā
translated: A box, a pestle, a pestle for a mortar,🔽A water-strainer, a fan, a boat, a dye-pot,

analyzed: uḷuṅkaḥ upi samuggaḥ upi karaṇḍampi kaṭacchupi
translated: A water-sifter, a water-strainer, a basket, a water-pot,

analyzed: evamādi tu sabbam pi saṅghikam garubhaṇḍakam
translated: Like this and so on, all of it is heavy goods belonging to the Sangha.

analyzed: sabbam dāru mayam geha sambhāram garukam matam
translated: All the heavy things in a wooden house are considered to be the property of the Sangha.

analyzed: bhājiyam kappiyam cammaṃ a kappiyam a bhājiyam
translated: A hide that has been cut up is allowable; a hide that has not been cut up is not allowable.

analyzed: eḷa cammam garum vuttam tathā iva udukkhala ādikam
translated: An elephant hide is said to be heavy; so too a water strainer, etc.

analyzed: pesakārādi bhaṇḍañca kasi bhaṇḍañca saṅghikam  tathā iva ādhārakaḥ patta pidhānam tālavaṇṭakam
translated: Goods of a weaver, etc., and goods of a farmer are the property of the Sangha.🔽So too a stand, a bowl-rest, a palm-leaf fan,

original: Bījanī pacchi caṅkoṭaṃ, sabbā sammuñjanī garu.
analyzed: bījanī pacchi caṅkoṭam sabbā sammuñjanī garu
translated: A needle case, a water filter, a key, a razor—all these are heavy.

original: Yaṃ kiñci bhūmattharaṇaṃ, yo koci kaṭasārako;🔽Cakkayuttakayānañca, sabbampi garubhaṇḍakaṃ.🔽Chattañca muṭṭhipaṇṇañca, visāṇaṃtumbabhājanaṃ;
analyzed: yam kiñci bhūmattharaṇam  cakka yuttaka yānañca sabbam pi garubhaṇḍakam  chattam ca muṭṭhi paṇṇam ca visāṇam tumba bhājanam
translated: Any kind of floor covering, any kind of wooden bowl,🔽And a cart with wheels are all heavy goods.🔽An umbrella, a fan, a horn, a water pot,

analyzed: idam
translated: Sandals, a fire-drilling stick, a razor case, etc.—these are light.

analyzed: hatthi dantaḥ visāṇam ca yathāgatam atacchitam
translated: An elephant tusk, a horn, as it has come, uncut,

original: Mañcapādādi yaṃ kiñci, bhājanīyamaniṭṭhitaṃ.🔽Niṭṭhito tacchito vāpi, vidho hiṅgukaraṇḍako;
analyzed: mañca pāda ādi yam kiñci bhājanīyam aniṭṭhitam  niṭṭhito tad śitaḥ vā api vidho hiṅgu karaṇḍako
translated: Any kind of bowl, such as a leg of a bed, etc., that is not finished,🔽Is finished or cut, but a water strainer, a bamboo water filter,

analyzed: añjanī ca salākāyaḥ bhājanī udapuñchanī
translated: A bamboo comb, a bamboo container, a bamboo water strainer, a bamboo cup,

analyzed: sabbam kulāla bhaṇḍam pi paribhoga araham pana
translated: And all the earthenware goods are, however, suitable for use.

analyzed: dhūma dānam kapallikā
translated: A bowl, charcoal, a pan,🔽Smoke offering, a water strainer,🔽A shrine, a lamp, a tree,

analyzed: thūpikā ca cayanacchadaniṭṭhakā
translated: A heap, a cover, a mattress:🔽All of these belonging to the Sangha

original: Saṅghikaṃ pana sabbampi, garubhaṇḍanti dīpitaṃ.🔽Patto kañcanako ceva, thālakaṃ kuṇḍikāpi ca;
analyzed: saṅghikam pana sabbam pi garu bhaṇḍanti dīpitam  patto kañcanakaḥ ca iva thālakam kuṇḍikā api ca
translated: Are called heavy goods.🔽A bowl, a golden one,🔽A cup, a water filter,🔽A water pot, a metal one,

analyzed: ghaṭakaḥ kuṇḍikā api ca
translated: A water filter, a bowl:🔽Heavy goods are heavy,

analyzed: garunā garubhaṇḍam ca thāvarena ca thāvaram
translated: And solid goods are solid.🔽But after they have been transferred to the Sangha,

analyzed: saṅghassa parivattetvā gaṇhitum pana vaṭṭati
translated: It’s allowable to take them.🔽If one gets down from one’s bed or bench

analyzed: adhotena ca pādena nakkame sayanāsanam
translated: With one’s feet uncovered,🔽Or if one does so with one’s feet wet,

analyzed: alla pādena vā bhikkhu tathā iva sa upāhano
translated: Or with one’s sandals on,🔽If one spits on the ground,

analyzed: bhūmiyā niṭṭhubhantassa parikammaka tāya vā
translated: Or on a surface that has been treated,🔽Or if one spits on a wall

analyzed: parikamma katam bhittim a passentassa dukkaṭam
translated: That has been treated, it’s wrong.🔽If one spreads out on the ground🔽A bed or bench belonging to the Sangha

original: Parikammakataṃ bhūmiṃ, saṅghikaṃ mañcapīṭhakaṃ;🔽Attano santakeneva, pattharitvāna kenaci.
analyzed: parikamma katam bhūmim saṅghikam mañca pīṭhakam  attano santakena iva pattharitvāna kenaci
translated: With one’s own bedding,🔽And then lies down on it,🔽And if one’s body touches the bed

original: Nipajjitabbaṃ, sahasā, tassa niddāyato yadi;🔽Sarīrāvayavo koci, mañcaṃ phusati dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: nipajjitabbam sahasā tassa niddāyataḥ yadi 🔽sarīra avayavaḥ mañcam phusati dukkaṭam
translated: While falling asleep, it’s wrong.

original: Lomesu pana lomānaṃ, gaṇanāyeva dukkaṭaṃ;🔽Talena hatthapādānaṃ, vaṭṭatakkamituṃ pana.
analyzed: lomesu pana lomānam gaṇanāya iva dukkaṭam  talena hattha pādānam pana
translated: But if he counts the hairs on the body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If he rubs the body with a cloth,

analyzed: sahassa gghanakaḥ koci piṇḍapātaḥ sa cīvaraḥ
translated: If a bowl worth a thousand, with a robe, is given,

original: Patto avassikaṃ bhikkhuṃ, likhitvā ṭhapitopi ca.🔽Tādiso piṇḍapātova, saṭṭhivassānamaccaye;🔽Uppanno saṭṭhivassassa, ṭhitikāya dade budho.
analyzed: pattaḥ avassikam bhikkhum likhitvā ṭhapitaḥ api ca  tādisaḥ piṇḍapātaḥ uva  uppannaḥ saṭṭhi vassassa ṭhitikāya dade budhaḥ
translated: And if a bowl is set aside for a monk who is staying on,🔽Even if it is worth a thousand,🔽The wise one should give it to him after sixty days have passed.

analyzed: uddesa bhattam bhuñjitvā jātaḥ ce sāmaṇerako
translated: If a novice monk has arisen after eating a meal to which he had been invited,

original: Gahetuṃ labhati taṃ pacchā, sāmaṇerassa pāḷiyā.
analyzed: gahetum labhati tam pacchā sāmaṇerassa pāḷiyā
translated: He may take it later, according to the Monastic Code for novice monks.

analyzed: sampuṇṇa vīsa vassaḥ yaḥ sve uddesam labhissati
translated: If one who is twenty years old will receive the full ordination the next day,

original: Ajja so upasampanno, atītā ṭhitikā siyā.🔽Sace pana salākā tu, laddhā bhattaṃ na taṃdine;
analyzed: ajja saḥ upasampannaḥ atītā ṭhitikā siyā  sace pana salākā tu laddhā bhattam na
translated: The full ordination is today, and the probation is in the past.🔽But if the voting tickets are received, but the meal is not on that day,

original: Laddhaṃ, punadine tassa, gāhetabbaṃ, na saṃsayo.
analyzed: laddham puna dine tassa gāhetabbam na saṃsayaḥ
translated: The meal is received on the next day, and there is no doubt that it should be taken.

analyzed: uttaruttari bhaṅgassa bhattassa ikacarassa hi
translated: For one who eats only one meal a day, and who is a progressive eater,

original: Visuñhi ṭhitikā katvā, dātabbā tu salākikā.
analyzed: visum hi ṭhitikā katvā dātabbā tu salākikā
translated: The voting tickets should be given after making a probationary announcement.

analyzed: bhattam eva sace laddham na
translated: But if only a meal is received, and not a progressive meal,

original: Laddhamuttaribhaṅgaṃ vā, na laddhaṃ bhattameva vā.🔽Yena yena hi yaṃ yaṃ tu, na laddhaṃ, tassa tassa ca;
analyzed: laddham uttari bhaṅgam vā na laddham bhattam eva vā  yena yena hi yam yam tu na laddham tassa tassa ca
translated: What has been obtained, or what has not been obtained, or what is left over, or what is not left over,🔽Or whatever has not been obtained, and whatever has not been obtained again,

original: Taṃ taṃ punadine cāpi, gāhetabbanti dīpitaṃ.
analyzed: tam tam puna dine ca api gāhetabbanti dīpitam
translated: That should be taken, it is taught.

analyzed: saṅgha uddesa ādikam idam sattavidham api ca
translated: The seven kinds of meals, the meal for the Sangha, and so on,

analyzed: catur bidham udīritam
translated: And the four kinds of meals, the meal for newcomers, and so on,

original: Vihāravārabhattañca, niccañca kuṭibhattakaṃ;🔽Pannarasavidhaṃ bhattaṃ, uddiṭṭhaṃ sabbamevidha.🔽Pāḷimaṭṭhakathañceva, oloketvā punappunaṃ;🔽Saṅghike paccaye sammā, vibhajeyya vicakkhaṇo.🔽Senāsanakkhandhakakathā.🔽Vattakkhandhakakathā🔽Āgantukāvāsikapiṇḍacārī-;
analyzed: vihāra vāra bhattañca niccam ca kuṭibhattakam  pannarasavidham bhattam uddiṭṭham  pāḷimaṭṭhakatham ca iva oloketvā punappunam  saṅghike paccaye sammā vibhajeyya vicakkhaṇaḥ  senāsana kkhandhaka kathā  vatta khandhaka kathā  āgantuka āvāsika piṇḍa cārī
translated: The meal for those who are staying on, the regular meal, the meal for those who are working,

original: Senāsanāraññanumodanāsu;🔽Vattāni bhatte gamikassa jantā-;🔽Ghare tathā vaccakuṭippavese.🔽Ācariyupajjhāyakasissasaddhi-;🔽Vihārivattānipi sabbasova;🔽Vattāni vuttāni catuddaseva;🔽Visuddhacittena vināyakena.
analyzed: senā āsana arañña numodanāsu 🔽vattāni bhatte gamikassa jantā 🔽ghare tathā vacca kuṭippavese 🔽ācariya upajjhāyaka sissa saddhi 🔽vihāri vattāni pi sabbaso va 🔽vattāni vuttāni catuddasā iva 🔽visuddha cittena vināyakena
translated: The meal for the sick, the meal for those nursing the sick, the meal for the Sangha, the meal for a specific number of monks, the meal for the Sangha wherever it may be, the meal for those who are present, the meal for visitors, the meal for those going away, the meal for the sick, the meal for those nursing the sick, the meal for the Sangha, the meal for a specific number of monks, the meal for the Sangha wherever it may be, the meal for those who are present, the meal for visitors, the meal for those going away, the meal for the sick, the meal for those nursing the sick, the meal for the Sangha, the meal for a specific number of monks, the meal for the Sangha wherever it may be, the meal for those who are present, the meal for visitors, the meal for those going away, the meal for the sick, the meal for those nursing the sick, the meal for the Sangha, the meal for a specific number of monks, the meal for the Sangha wherever it may be, the meal for those who are present, the meal for visitors, the meal for those going away, the meal for the sick, the meal for those nursing the sick, the meal for the Sangha, the meal for a specific number of monks, the meal for the Sangha wherever it may be, the meal for those who are present, the meal for visitors, the meal for those going away, the meal for the sick, the meal for those nursing the sick, the meal for the Sangha, the meal for a specific number of monks, the meal for the Sangha wherever it may be, the meal for those who are present, the meal for visitors, the meal for those going away, the meal for the sick, the meal for those nursing the sick, the meal for the Sangha, the meal for a specific number of monks, the meal for the Sangha wherever

original: Āgantukena ārāmaṃ, pavisantena bhikkhunā;🔽Chattaṃ panāpanetabbaṃ, muñcitabbā upāhanā.
analyzed: āgantukena ārāmam pavisantena bhikkhunā  chattam pana apanetabbam muñcitabbā upāhanā
translated: When a visitor enters the monastery,🔽he should put away his sunshade and take off his sandals.

original: Oguṇṭhanaṃ na kātabbaṃ, sīse cīvarameva vā;
analyzed: oguṇṭhanam na kātabbam sīse cīvaram eva vā
translated: He shouldn’t cover his head, or his shoulder with his robe,

original: Na hi tena ca dhotabbā, pādā pānīyavārinā.🔽Vanditabbāva pucchitvā, vihāre vuḍḍhabhikkhuno;
analyzed: na hi tena ca dhotabbā pādā pānīya vārinā  vanditabbā ava pucchitvā vihāre vuḍḍhabhikkhuno
translated: and he shouldn’t wash his feet with drinking water.🔽After asking permission, he should bow to the senior monks in the dwelling.

original: Kāle senāsanaṃ tena, pucchitabbañca bhikkhunā.🔽Vaccaṭṭhānañca passāva-ṭṭhānaṃ pānīyameva ca;
analyzed: kāle senāsanam tena pucchitabbam ca bhikkhunā  vaccaṭṭhānam ca passāvaṭṭhānam pānīyam eva ca
translated: At the right time, he should ask the resident monks about the sleeping place,🔽the restroom, the urinal, the drinking water,

analyzed: paribhojanīyam saṅgha katikam gocara ādikam  vuḍḍham āgantukam disvā bhikkhunā āvāsikena api
translated: the water for washing, the common water, the walking sticks, and the almsbowls.🔽When he sees a senior visitor,

original: Pattaṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paccuggantvāna cīvaraṃ.🔽Āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, tassa pādodakampi ca;🔽Upanikkhipitabbañca, pucchitabbañca vārinā.
analyzed: pattam paṭiggahetabbam paccuggantvāna cīvaram  āsanam paññapetabbam tassa pāda udakam pi ca  upanikkhipitabbañca pucchitabbañca vārinā
translated: the resident monk should receive his bowl and robe after going to meet him.🔽He should prepare a seat and also water for washing his feet.🔽He should put out his foot stool and ask him about drinking water.

original: Vandeyyo paññapetabbaṃ, tassa senāsanampi ca;🔽Ajjhāvutthamavutthaṃ vā, gocarāgocarampi ca.
analyzed: vandeyyaḥ paññapetabbam tassa senāsanam pi ca  vā gocara agocaram pi ca
translated: He should bow to him and prepare a sleeping place for him,🔽and he should ask him about his recitation and about the almsround area.

analyzed: vaccaṭṭhānam ca passāvaṭṭhānam sekkha kulāni ca
translated: The restroom, the urinal, the families who support him,

analyzed: pavese nikkhame kālaḥ vattabbaḥ pāniya ādikam
translated: It’s time to go out for alms. You should say, ‘Water,’ and so on.

analyzed: sace saḥ navakaḥ hoti
translated: If he’s a novice,

analyzed: āgata āgantukaḥ yathā  nisinnena iva tena assa
translated: he should be treated like a newly arrived visitor.

analyzed: sabba māvāsi bhikkhunā  atra pattam ṭhapehi iti
translated: The resident monk should do all this while sitting.🔽‘Put your bowl here,’ ‘Sit here,’

original: Iccevaṃ pana vattabbaṃ, deyyaṃ senāsanampi ca.
analyzed: icc evam pana vattabbam deyyam senāsanam pi ca
translated: and he should say, ‘You may give me a resting place.’

analyzed: dāru mattika bhaṇḍāni gantu kāmena bhikkhunā
translated: If a monk who wants to go away

analyzed: gantabbam paṭisāmetvā thaketvā āvasatham pi ca
translated: has wooden or earthenware goods, he should take them with him. He should also take the resting place.

analyzed: āpucchitvā api gantabbam bhikkhunā sayanāsanam
translated: Even if there’s no one to ask permission from, a monk should still go away after informing someone.

original: Pucchitabbe asantepi, gopetvā vāpi sādhukaṃ.🔽Sahasā pavise nāpi, sahasā na ca nikkhame;
analyzed: pucchitabbe asante pi gopetvā vā api sādhukam  sahasā pavise na api sahasā na ca nikkhame
translated: It’s good if he also protects the resting place well.🔽He shouldn’t enter or leave in a hurry.

original: Nātidūre naccāsanne, ṭhātabbaṃ piṇḍacārinā.🔽Vāmahatthena saṅghāṭiṃ, uccāretvātha bhājanaṃ;🔽Dakkhiṇena paṇāmetvā, bhikkhaṃ gaṇheyya paṇḍito.
analyzed: na atidūre nacca āsanne ṭhātabbam piṇḍacārinā  vāma hatthena saṅghāṭim uccāretvā atha bhājanam  dakkhiṇena paṇāmetvā bhikkham gaṇheyya paṇḍitaḥ
translated: He shouldn’t stand too far away or too close.🔽The wise one should lift up his robe with his left hand and his bowl with his right.🔽He should receive the almsfood while looking at the person giving.

analyzed: sūpam vā dātu kāmā ati sallakkheyya muhuttakam
translated: If he wants to get rice porridge, he should consider the time.

analyzed: olokeyya antarā bhikkhu na bhikkhādāyikā mukham
translated: The monk should look around, but not at the face of the person giving the almsfood.

analyzed: pānīya ādi pana āneyyam bhikkhunā āraññakena api
translated: If one has had water, etc., brought, even by a novice monk in the forest;

original: Nakkhattaṃ tena yogo ca, jānitabbā disāpi ca.
analyzed: nakkhattam tena yogaḥ ca jānitabbā disā api ca
translated: The constellations, the work, and the directions should be known.

analyzed: vacca passāvatitthāni bhavanti paṭipāṭiyā
translated: The places for defecating, for urinating, and for washing after defecating are to be in order;

analyzed: karontassa yathāvuḍḍham hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ
translated: If one does it in the wrong order, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Sahasā ubbhajitvā vā, na ca vaccakuṭiṃ vise;
analyzed: sahasā ubbhajitvā vā na ca vaccakuṭim vise
translated: If one has hastily urinated or defecated, or if one has not entered the restroom;

original: Ukkāsitvā bahi ṭhatvā, pavise saṇikaṃ pana.
analyzed: ukkāsitvā bahis ṭhatvā pavise saṇikam pana
translated: After coughing, one should stand outside and then enter quietly.

original: Vaccaṃ na nitthunantena, kātabbaṃ pana bhikkhunā;
analyzed: vaccam na nitthunantena kātabbam pana bhikkhunā
translated: One should not defecate while making a noise, but a monk should do it;

original: Khādato dantakaṭṭhaṃ vā, karoto hoti dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: khādataḥ dantakaṭṭham vā karotaḥ hoti dukkaṭam
translated: If one chews tooth wood or does it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Vaccaṃ pana na kātabbaṃ, bahiddhā vaccadoṇiyā;🔽Passāvopi na kātabbo, bahi passāvadoṇiyā.🔽Kharena nāvalekheyya, na kaṭṭhaṃ vaccakūpake;🔽Chaḍḍeyya na ca pāteyya, kheḷaṃ passāvadoṇiyā.
analyzed: vaccam pana na kātabbam bahiddhā vacca doṇiyā  passāvaḥ api na kātabbaḥ bahi passāva doṇiyā  kharena na avalekheyya na kaṭṭham vacca kūpake  chaḍḍeyya na ca pāteyya kheḷam passāva doṇiyā
translated: One should not defecate outside the toilet,🔽or urinate outside the urinal.🔽One should not wipe oneself on the rough side of the wood, or put wood in the toilet;🔽One should not throw trash or spit into the urinal.

analyzed: pādukāsu ubbhajeyya vicakkhaṇaḥ
translated: One should not urinate or defecate while standing on the sandals;

analyzed: paṭicchādeyya tattha iva ṭhatvā nikkhamane pana
translated: One should cover oneself while standing there, but not when leaving.

original: Nācameyya sace vaccaṃ, katvā yo salile sati;
analyzed: na ācameyya sace vaccam katvā yaḥ salile sati
translated: If one has defecated in water, one should not go into it,

analyzed: tassa dukkaṭam uddiṭṭham muninā mohana asinā
translated: The Sage, the one with the sword of wisdom,🔽Has declared it a wrongdoing to make a sound while rinsing the mouth,🔽To make a slurping sound while eating,

original: Sasaddaṃ nācametabbaṃ, katvā capu capūti ca;🔽Ācamitvā sarāvepi, sesetabbaṃ na tūdakaṃ.🔽Ūhatampi adhovitvā, nikkhamantassa dukkaṭaṃ;
analyzed: sa saddam na ācametabbam katvā capu capu iti ca  ācamitvā sarāve pi sesetabbam na tu udakam  adhovitvā nikkhamantassa dukkaṭaṃ
translated: To drink water with the bowl in the hands,🔽To leave water in the bowl,🔽To leave the bowl on the ground without a support,🔽To leave the bowl on a seat,

original: Uklāpāpi sace honti, sodhetabbaṃ asesato.🔽Avalekhanakaṭṭhena, pūro ce pīṭharo pana;
analyzed: sace honti sodhetabbam asesato  avalekhana kaṭṭhena ce pīṭharo pana
translated: To throw away a full water pot,🔽To fill a pot with water without first asking permission from the senior monk,

original: Chaḍḍeyya kumbhi rittā ce, kumbhiṃ pūreyya vārinā.🔽Anajjhiṭṭho hi vuḍḍhena, pātimokkhaṃ na uddise;🔽Dhammaṃ na ca bhaṇe, pañhaṃ, na puccheyya na vissaje.
analyzed: chaḍḍeyya kumbhi rittā ce kumbhim pūreyya vārinā  an ajjhiṭṭhaḥ hi vuḍḍhena pātimokkham na uddise  dhammam na ca bhaṇe pañham na puccheyya na vissaje
translated: To recite the Pāṭimokkha without first asking permission from the senior monk,🔽To give a teaching without first asking permission from the senior monk,🔽To ask a question without first asking permission from the senior monk,

original: Āpucchitvā kathentassa, vuḍḍhaṃ vuḍḍhatarāgame;🔽Puna āpucchane kiccaṃ, natthīti paridīpitaṃ.
analyzed: āpucchitvā kathentassa vuḍḍham vuḍḍhatara āgame  punar āpucchane kiccam na atthi iti paridīpitam
translated: To give an answer without first asking permission from the senior monk,🔽To study with a senior monk without first asking permission from the senior monk,

analyzed: vuḍḍhena ika vihārasmim saddhim viharatā pana
translated: To recite the scriptures without first asking permission from the senior monk,🔽To give a recitation without first asking permission from the senior monk,

original: Anāpucchā hi sajjhāyo, na kātabbo kadācipi.🔽Uddesopi na kātabbo, paripucchāya kā kathā;
analyzed: an āpucchā hi sajjhāyaḥ na kātabbaḥ kadācipi  uddesaḥ api na kātabbaḥ paripucchāya kā kathā
translated: To ask a question without first asking permission from the senior monk,🔽To give an answer without first asking permission from the senior monk,

original: Na ca dhammo kathetabbo, bhikkhunā dhammacakkhunā.
analyzed: na ca dhammaḥ kathetabbaḥ bhikkhunā dhamma cakkhunā
translated: To give a teaching without first asking permission from the senior monk,

original: Na dīpo vijjhāpetabbo, kātabbo vā na ceva so;
analyzed: na dīpaḥ vijjhāpetabbaḥ kātabbaḥ vā na ca iva so
translated: A lamp should not be extinguished, nor should one do such a thing.

analyzed: vāta pāna kavāṭāni thakeyya vivareyya no
translated: One should open the windows and doors, and close them.

analyzed: caṅkame caṅkamantaḥ ca vuḍḍhataḥ parivattaye
translated: When walking on a walk, one should turn to face the elder.

original: Tampi cīvarakaṇṇena, kāyena na ca ghaṭṭaye.🔽Purato neva therānaṃ, nhāyeyya na panūpari;
analyzed: cīvara kaṇṇena kāyena na ca ghaṭṭaye  puratas na iva therānam na
translated: One should not touch the elder with the corner of one’s robe or with one’s body.🔽One should not bathe in front of or above the elders.

original: Uttaraṃ otarantānaṃ, dade maggaṃ, na ghaṭṭaye.
analyzed: uttaram otarantānam dade maggam na ghaṭṭaye
translated: When descending from the upper to the lower, one should give way, not touch.

original: Vattaṃ aparipūrento, na sīlaṃ paripūrati;🔽Asuddhasīlo duppañño, cittekaggaṃ na vindati.
analyzed: vattam a paripūrentaḥ na sīlam paripūrati  a suddha sīlaḥ duppaññaḥ citta ekaggam na vindati
translated: Not fulfilling the duties, one does not fulfill virtue.🔽One of impure virtue and little wisdom does not find one-pointedness of mind.

analyzed: vikkhitta cittaḥ nekaggo saddhammam na ca passati
translated: One of distracted mind and one-pointedness does not see the true Teaching.

analyzed: a passamānaḥ saddhammam dukkhā na parimuccati
translated: Not seeing the true Teaching, one is not freed from suffering.

original: Tasmā hi vattaṃ pūreyya, jinaputto vicakkhaṇo;
analyzed: tasmā hi vattam pūreyya jinaputtaḥ vicakkhaṇaḥ
translated: Therefore, the wise son of the Victor should fulfill the duties.

analyzed: ovādam buddha seṭṭhassa katvā nibbānam ehiti
translated: Having fulfilled the advice of the Buddha, the best, one attains Nibbāna.

analyzed: vatta khandhaka kathā
translated: The explanation of the chapter on duties is finished.

original: Bhikkhunikkhandhakakathā🔽Kāyaṃ ūruṃ thanaṃ vāpi, vivaritvāna bhikkhunī;
analyzed: bhikkhu nikkhandhaka kathā  kāyam ūrum thanam vā api vivaritvāna bhikkhunī
translated: The explanation of the chapter on nuns🔽A nun should not show her body, thigh, or breast,

original: Attano aṅgajātaṃ vā, bhikkhussa na ca dassaye.
analyzed: attanaḥ aṅga jātam vā bhikkhussa na ca dassaye
translated: Or her genitals, to a monk.

original: Bhikkhunā saha yaṃ kiñci, sampayojentiyāpi ca;
analyzed: bhikkhunā saha yam kiñci sampayojentiyā api ca
translated: And also if she joins in with a monk,

original: Tato bhāsantiyā bhikkhuṃ, hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: tatas bhāsantiyā bhikkhum hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ
translated: Or if she speaks to a monk, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Na ca bhikkhuniyā dīghaṃ, dhāreyya kāyabandhanaṃ;
analyzed: na ca bhikkhuniyāḥ dīgham dhāreyya kāya bandhanam
translated: A nun should not wear a long body-belt,

original: Teneva kāyabandhena, thanapaṭṭena vā pana.🔽Vilīvena ca paṭṭena, cammapaṭṭena vā tathā;
analyzed: tena iva kāya bandhena thana paṭṭena vā pana  vilīvena ca paṭṭena camma paṭṭena vā tathā
translated: Or with that same body-belt, or with a cloth-strip,🔽Or with a silk-strip, or likewise with a leather-strip,

analyzed: dussa paṭṭena vā dussa veṇiyā dussa vaṭṭiyā
translated: Or with a cloth-strip, or with a cloth-fringe, or with a cloth-band.🔽She should not bend her body,

original: Na phāsukā nametabbā, dukkaṭaṃ tu namentiyā;
analyzed: na phāsukā nametabbā dukkaṭam tu namentiyā
translated: But if she bends it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: na ghaṃsā peyya samaṇī jaghanam aṭṭhikā ādinā
translated: A nun should not massage her buttocks with a bone or the like.

original: Hatthaṃ vā hatthakocchaṃ vā, pādaṃ vā mukhamūrukaṃ;
analyzed: hattham vā hatthaka uccham vā pādam vā mukha ūrukam
translated: If she massages her hand, her forearm, her foot, her face, or her head,

original: Koṭṭāpeti sace tassā, hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: koṭṭāpeti sace tassā hoti āpatti dukkaṭaṃ
translated: Then there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽She should not smear her mouth,

original: Na mukhaṃ limpitabbaṃ tu, na cuṇṇetabbameva ca;
analyzed: na mukham limpitabbam tu na cuṇṇetabbam eva ca
translated: Nor should she rub it with powder.

original: Manosilāya vāpatti, mukhaṃ lañjantiyā siyā.🔽Aṅgarāgo na kātabbo, mukharāgopi vā tathā;
analyzed: manosilāya mukham lañjantiyā siyā  aṅga rāgaḥ na kātabbaḥ mukha rāgaḥ api vā tathā
translated: If she smears her mouth with a stone of soap-nut, there is an offense.🔽She should not apply color to her body,🔽Nor likewise to her face.🔽She should not apply color to her private parts,

original: Avaṅgaṃ na ca kātabbaṃ, na kātabbaṃ visesakaṃ.
analyzed: avaṅgam na ca kātabbam na kātabbam visesakam
translated: Nor should she apply color to her breasts.

analyzed: olokanakataḥ rāgāḥ oloketum na vaṭṭati
translated: Because of lust, she should not look at a man with the intention of flirting.

original: Ṭhātabbaṃ na ca sāloke, sanaccaṃ na ca kāraye.
analyzed: ṭhātabbam na ca sa āloke sa naccam na ca kāraye
translated: One should not stay in the dark, nor should one make love.

analyzed: dukkaṭam muninā vuttam gaṇikam vuṭṭhapentiyā
translated: The Sage said that it is wrong to give the going forth to a prostitute;

original: Suraṃ vā pana maṃsaṃ vā, paṇṇaṃ vā vikkiṇantiyā.
analyzed: suram vā pana maṃsam vā paṇṇam vā vikkiṇantiyā
translated: Or to sell liquor, meat, or vegetables.

original: Vaḍḍhiṃ vāpi vaṇijjaṃ vā, payojetuṃ na vaṭṭati;
analyzed: vaḍḍhim vā api vaṇijjam vā payojetum na vaṭṭati
translated: It is not allowable to engage in usury or trade;

original: Tirīṭaṃ kañcukaṃ vāpi, yadi dhāreti dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: tirīṭam kañcukam vā api yadi dhārā iti dukkaṭam
translated: If one wears a tirika or a kancuka, it is wrong.

original: Dāso vā pana dāsī vā, tathā kammakaropi vā;
analyzed: dāsaḥ vā pana dāsī vā tathā kammakaraḥ api vā
translated: A slave, a slave woman, or a worker,

analyzed: na ca iva upaṭṭhapetabbaḥ tiracchāna gataḥ api vā
translated: Or even an animal, should not be given the going forth.

original: Na ca bhikkhuniyā sabba-nīlādiṃ pana cīvaraṃ;
analyzed: na ca bhikkhuniyā sabba nīla ādim pana cīvaram
translated: A nun should not wear a robe that is all blue, and so on;

original: Dhāretabbaṃ, na dhāreyya, sabbaṃ namatakampi ca.🔽Paṭicchannāpaṭicchannaṃ, chinnaṃ vācchinnameva vā;
analyzed: dhāretabbam na dhāreyya sabbam ca  paṭicchanna apaṭicchannam chinnam vā acchinnam eva vā
translated: She should not wear one that is all black, or all brown.🔽One should not look at a man’s private parts, whether covered or uncovered,

analyzed: purisa byañjanam sabbam oloketum na vaṭṭati
translated: Or cut or uncut.

original: Dūratova ca passitvā, bhikkhuṃ bhikkhuniyā pana;
analyzed: dūratas va ca passitvā bhikkhum bhikkhuniyā pana
translated: If a nun sees a monk from afar,

analyzed: maggaḥ tassa padātabbaḥ okkamitvāna dūratas
translated: She should step aside and let him pass.

original: Bhikkhuṃ pana ca passitvā, pattaṃ bhikkhaṃ carantiyā;
analyzed: bhikkhum pana ca passitvā pattam bhikkham carantiyā
translated: If a nun sees a monk who is walking for alms,

analyzed: nīharitvā tam ukkujjam dassetabbam tu bhikkhuno
translated: Having taken it out, it should be shown to a monk.

analyzed: saṃvellikam ca kātum vā dhāretum kaṭi suttakam
translated: And to make a bandage, or to wear a loin cloth,

analyzed: utu kāle anuññātam utunīnam mahesinā
translated: Is allowed during the proper time, by the Great Seer for those who have their season.

analyzed: itthi posa yutam yānam hattha vaṭṭakam eva vā
translated: A vehicle yoked with a woman, or even a handcart,

analyzed: pāṭaṅkī ca gilānāya vaṭṭatā iva abhirūhitum
translated: And a palanquin, it is proper for a sick nun to mount.

analyzed: garu dhamme ṭhitāya api mānattam tu carantiyā
translated: Even if she is established in the grave offenses, if she is undertaking the trial period,

analyzed: sammannitvā padātabbā dutiyā pana bhikkhunī
translated: She should be sent back after being approved by a second nun.

original: Yassā pabbajjakāle tu, gabbho vuṭṭhāti itthiyā;
analyzed: yassā pabbajja kāle tu gabbhaḥ vuṭṭhāti itthiyā
translated: If a woman who has gone forth gives birth to a child,

original: Putto yadi ca tassāpi, dātabbā dutiyā tathā.
analyzed: puttaḥ yadi ca tassa api dātabbā dutiyā tathā
translated: If he is her son, she should be given a second probation.

analyzed: mātā labhati pāyetum bhojetum
translated: The mother may nurse her own child, and may feed him,

original: Maṇḍetumpi ure katvā, setuṃ labhati sā pana.
analyzed: katvā setum labhati sā pana
translated: And may adorn him by placing him on her lap, but she is not allowed to carry him.

original: Ṭhapetvā sahaseyyaṃ tu, tasmiṃ dutiyikāya hi;
analyzed: ṭhapetvā sahaseyyam tu tasmin dutiyikāya hi
translated: Except for sleeping together, for that second probationer,

analyzed: purisesu yathā aññesu vattitabbam tathā iva ca
translated: She should behave just as towards other men.

original: Vibbhameneva sā hoti, yasmā idha abhikkhunī;
analyzed: vibbhamena iva sā hoti yasmai idha abhikkhunī
translated: Because she is not a nun here, since she is suspended,

analyzed: tasmā bhikkhuniyā sikkhā paccakkhānam na vijjati
translated: Therefore for a nun there is no offense in rejecting the training.

analyzed: vibbhantāya yathā tassā punar natthu upasampadā
translated: When she has gone over, there is no further full ordination for her.

analyzed: gatāya tittha āyatanam tathā natthu upasampadā
translated: When she has gone to a sect, there is no further full ordination for her.

analyzed: chedanam nakha kesānam purisehi ca vandanam
translated: Cutting the nails and hair, and paying respect to men,

analyzed: vaṇassa parikammam pi sāditum pana vaṭṭati
translated: And nursing a wound: all this is allowed.

original: Na vaccakuṭiyā vacco, kātabbo yāya kāyaci;
analyzed: na vacca kuṭiyā vaccaḥ kātabbaḥ yāya kāyaci
translated: One should not defecate in a privy anywhere;

analyzed: heṭṭhā api vivaṭe uddham paṭicchanne pi vaṭṭati
translated: It is allowed below open, above covered.

original: Na ca vaṭṭati sabbattha, pallaṅkena nisīdituṃ;
analyzed: na ca vaṭṭati sabbattha pallaṅkena nisīditum
translated: One should not sit cross-legged everywhere;

original: Gilānāyaḍḍhapallaṅkaṃ, vaṭṭatīti pakāsitaṃ.🔽Na ca bhikkhuniyāraññe, vatthabbaṃ tu kathañcana;
analyzed: gilāna āyaḍḍha pallaṅkam vaṭṭati iti pakāsitam  na ca bhikkhuniyā araññe vatthabbam tu kathaṃcana
translated: It is allowed for a sick nun to sit on a half-moon seat.🔽A nun should not live in the wilderness in any way;🔽It is not allowed to bathe in a place frequented by men,

original: Atitthe naratitthe vā, nhāyituṃ na ca vaṭṭati.🔽Samaṇī gandhacuṇṇena, yā ca vāsitamattiyā;
analyzed: atitthe nara titthe vā nhāyitum na ca vaṭṭati  sa maṇī gandha cuṇṇena yā ca vāsita mattiyā
translated: Or in a ford. And if a nun

original: Nhāyeyya paṭisote vā, tassā āpatti dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: nhāyeyya paṭisote vā tassāḥ āpatti dukkaṭaṃ
translated: Bathes with scented ground bath powder, or with oil, or upstream, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: tvaṃyā iva paribhuñjāti paribhoga attham attano
translated: “You use it,” if she gives her own property

original: Dinnaṃ abhutvā aññassa, dentiyā pana dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: dinnam a bhutvā aññassa dentiyā pana dukkaṭaṃ
translated: To be used, but then, without eating it herself, gives it to someone else, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: sabbam paṭiggahāpetvā bhikkhūhi paribhuñjitum
translated: Having had it all received, the nuns should eat it.

analyzed: bhikkhunīnam tu vaṭṭati
translated: But not if they are not fully ordained, and it is allowable for nuns.

analyzed: bhikkhu nikkhandhaka kathā
translated: The section on the nuns is finished.

analyzed: iti vinaya vinicchaye khandhaka kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The section on the Khandhakas is finished.

analyzed: catubbidha kamma kathā  cattāri imāni kammāni apalokana saññitam
translated: The discussion of the four kinds of legal issues🔽There are four kinds of legal issues:🔽The one called “to be informed,”

analyzed: kammam ñatti catutthakam
translated: The one called “motion,” the one called “motion and one announcement,”🔽And the one called “motion and three announcements.”

analyzed: apalokana kammam tu pañca ṭhānāni gacchati
translated: The legal procedure consisting of “to be informed” goes to five places:🔽The legal procedure consisting of “motion” goes to nine places,

analyzed: ñatti kammam nava ṭṭhānam dutiyam satta gacchati
translated: The second to seven,

original: Tathā ñatticatutthampi, satta ṭhānāni gacchati;🔽Nissāraṇañca osāro, bhaṇḍukaṃ brahmadaṇḍako.🔽Apalokanakammañhi, kammalakkhaṇapañcamaṃ;
analyzed: tathā satta ṭhānāni gacchati  nissāraṇam ca osāraḥ bhaṇḍukam brahmadaṇḍakaḥ  apalokana kamman hi kamma lakkhaṇa pañcamam
translated: And likewise the one consisting of “motion and three announcements” to seven places.🔽The legal procedure consisting of “to be informed” is the fifth in terms of the characteristics of legal procedures.🔽The legal procedure consisting of “to be informed” and the one consisting of “to be announced” should be spoken by a novice monk.

original: Nissāraṇañca osāraṃ, samaṇuddesato vade.🔽Bhaṇḍukaṃ pabbajantena, channena brahmadaṇḍakaṃ;
analyzed: nissāraṇam ca osāram samaṇa uddesataḥ vade  bhaṇḍukam pabbajantena channena brahmadaṇḍakam
translated: The legal procedure consisting of “motion” should be done by one who is going forth, by Channa, and by the one with the brahmin’s rod.

analyzed: aññassa api ca kātabbaḥ tathārūpassa bhikkhuno
translated: And it should be done for another monk of that kind.

analyzed: sabbaso sannipatitvāna āpucchitvāna sabbaso
translated: The whole Sangha should gather, and after informing each other,

original: Cīvarādiparikkhāraṃ, saṅgho yaṃ deti tassa hi.
analyzed: cīvara ādi parikkhāram saṅghaḥ yam deti tassa hi
translated: The Sangha gives the requisites, such as robes, to him.

analyzed: tikkhattum apaloketvā bhikkhūnam ruciyā pana
translated: After looking three times, and then with the approval of the monks,

original: Evaṃ saṅghassa dānaṃ tu, hoti taṃ kammalakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: evam saṅghassa dānam tu hoti tam kamma lakkhaṇam
translated: This is how a gift to the Sangha is done. This is the characteristic of the legal procedure.

analyzed: uposatha pavāraṇā
translated: Sending away, the essence of the Monastic Code, the observance-day ceremony, the invitation ceremony,

original: Sammuti ceva dānañca, paṭiggāho ca sattamo.
analyzed: sammuti ca iva dānam ca paṭiggāho ca sattamaḥ
translated: Agreement, and a gift, and the seventh is receiving,

analyzed: paccukkaḍḍhana tā ca iva aṭṭhamī parikittitā
translated: And sending back, which is declared to be the eighth:

analyzed: kammassa lakkhaṇam ca ati nava ṭhānāni ñattiyā
translated: These are the nine grounds for a motion.

original: Vinicchaye asampatte, therassāvinayaññuno;🔽Tassa nissāraṇā vuttā, yā sā nissāraṇāti hi.
analyzed: vinicchaye a sampatte therassa a vinaya ññunaḥ  tassa nissāraṇā vuttā yā sā nissāraṇā ati hi
translated: When there is no settled legal issue, and a senior monk who is an expert on the Monastic Law,🔽Sending him away is called sending away.

analyzed: upasampadā apekkhassa āgaccha usāraṇā ti sā
translated: When a person seeking the full ordination has arrived, the motion to invite is the motion to invite.

analyzed: uposatha vasena api pavāraṇa vasena api
translated: And also for the observance-day ceremony and the invitation ceremony.

analyzed: ñattiyāḥ hi ñatti kammāni ime duve
translated: Because it is done by motion, these two legal procedures are called “done by motion”.

analyzed: upasampadā apekkhan hi ca
translated: “I will instruct the person seeking the full ordination.”

analyzed: itthannāmam aham bhikkhum puccheyyam vinayanti ca
translated: “I will ask the monk so-and-so about the Monastic Law.”

analyzed: evamādi pavattā hi edisā sammuti
translated: This kind of motion is called “agreement”.

analyzed: nissaṭṭha cīvara ādīnam dānam dānanti vuccati
translated: Giving back the robe and so on is called “giving”.

analyzed: āpattīnam paṭiggāho paṭiggāhaḥ iti vuccati
translated: The receiving of the offenses is called “receiving.”

analyzed: paccukkaḍḍhanatā nāma pavārukkaḍḍhanā matā
translated: The sending back is considered the sending back of the invitation;

analyzed: imam uposatham katvā kāle pavārayām iti
translated: “Having done this observance day, I invite at the right time.”

analyzed: ti ṇava tthārake sabba paṭhamā ñatti ca itarā
translated: The covering over as if with grass is the first motion and the rest;

analyzed: kamma lakkhaṇam etat ti nava ṭhānāni ñattiyā
translated: The characteristics of the legal procedure are said to be the nine grounds for a motion.

analyzed: satta ṭhānāni gacchati
translated: The legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements also has seven grounds:

analyzed: nissāraṇam athosāram sammutim dānam eva ca
translated: Sending back, sending forth, agreement, and also giving;

analyzed: uddhāram desanam kamma lakkhaṇam pana sattamam
translated: Restoration, the announcement, and the characteristics of the legal procedure are the seventh.

analyzed: patta nikkujjana ādī tu nissārā usāraṇā matā
translated: The shaking of the almsbowl, etc., is considered the sending back and sending forth.

original: Sammuti nāma sīmādi, sā pañcadasadhā matā;
analyzed: sammuti nāma sīmā ādi sā pañcadasadhā matā
translated: Agreement is the monastery zone, etc., and it is said to be of fifteen kinds:

analyzed: dānam kathinavatthassa dānam mataka vāsasaḥ
translated: The giving of the robe-cloth for the robe-making ceremony, and the giving of the robe-cloth of the one who has died;

original: Kathinassantarubbhāro, “ubbhāro”ti pavuccati;🔽Desanā kuṭivatthussa, vihārassa ca vatthuno.
analyzed: kathinassa antarubbhāro ubbhāro ti pavuccati  desanā kuṭi vatthussa vihārassa ca vatthuno
translated: The distribution of the robe-cloth is said to be “distribution.”🔽The announcement of the robe-cloth, and of the site for a dwelling,

analyzed: ca moha āropana ādisu
translated: And in the legal procedure of covering over as if with grass, and in the case of the one who has been confused and misled, etc.,

analyzed: kamma vācā vasena ittha kamma lakkhaṇa tā matā
translated: The characteristics of the legal procedure are considered to be the announcements of the legal procedure.

analyzed: iti ñatti dutiyassa ime satta pakāsitā
translated: Thus these seven have been explained🔽For the legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements.

analyzed: tathā satta ṭhānāni gacchati
translated: So too the fourth with the three announcements Goes to seven instances.

analyzed: nissāraṇam athosāram sammutim dāna niggaham
translated: Sending away, and readmission, And the transaction, and giving, and withholding,

analyzed: samanubhāsanam ca iva sattamam kamma lakkhaṇam
translated: And the act of reproving, Are the seventh characteristic of a transaction.

analyzed: tad jana ādīnam kammānam karaṇam pana
translated: But the doing of the seven transactions, Beginning with censure,

analyzed: nissāraṇā atha tesam osāraṇā matā
translated: Is sent away and is appeased, And their readmission is agreed upon.

analyzed: ovādaḥ bhikkhunīnam tu sammuti iti pakāsitā
translated: But the admonition of nuns Is declared to be a transaction;

analyzed: mānatta parivāsānam dānam dānanti vuccati
translated: The giving of probation and of the trial period Is called “giving.”

analyzed: puna mūlāpaṭikkassaḥ niggaho ti pavuccati  ukkhittassa anuvattikāḥ aṭṭha yāvatatīyakā
